story:
Supergravity and the Eleventh Dimension

 

a new play by Boston-based playwright Heather Houston


THE SHOW

Have you ever been the winner, and lost? 

Have you ever been able to explain the cosmos, but will never understand your lover?

Have you ever wondered what would happen if you were able to fall into a black hole? And survive? If you could see what's on the other side? If there was an other side?

Supergravity is an extraordinary piece of work. The play is told primarily through the point of view of Tom, a theoretical physicist, and on its journey explores the relationships of four close friends — Leslie, Dan, Fred, and Tom — the year after the tragic death of their friend Carmen strains their relationship to the point of fracture. Carmen — her ghosts, her memories, her essence — haunts the group, and the laws of physics are bent as the remaining friends work through their suspicions, grief, anger, and sadness together to answer the question of How Carmen Died. As they slowly bring the truth to light, they must all reconcile what truly happened with their own version of reality.

That's the basic story, anyway. 

With your contribution to this production, you will actively aid in bringing this play to life on stage. Each and every cent you give will go towards securing our theatre space — The Factory Theatre — and to offset the cost of the scenery, props, lights, and sound that will bring the death of Carmen to a close.

We are extraordinarily excited for you to see this show and explore the world. Help us build a cabin, and we'll take you there. 

Supergravity and the Eleventh Dimension runs July 11 – 20 at The Factory Theatre (791 Tremont St, Boston). Tickets are on sale at http://supergravity.brownpapertickets.com/.

WHO WE ARE

Since our founding in 2009, we here at Vagabond Theatre Group have been bringing theatre artists of Boston together to create new, engaging work. VTG has a proven commitment to producing plays by young, local artists and in being an active company in the emerging Boston small theatre scene. 

In addition to full-scale productions, VTG presents There Will Be Words, a new play workshop. Held quarterly at Trident Booksellers and Cafe, submitted and selected new works are read in front of a live audience by a full cast of actors. In the spirit of open collaboration, an in-depth Q&A with the playwright follows the reading, allowing the audience to engage directly with the creation of new work. To date, three of our TWBW-read shows have gone on to produciton (two by VTG).

Supergravity and the Eleventh Dimension will be our fifth full scale production of an original work, following two IRNE-nominated plays, Burning the Barn and Burning Up the Dictionary, as well as True Believers and The Unfortunate Cuthroats.

story:
Pace University Presents:

MUD by Maria Irene Fornes

 

Hello link clickers! My name is Ellise and I am the director for Mud. I am currently a Senior Directing/Acting major at Pace University. I have been given the wonderful opportunity to direct MUD by Maria Irene Fornes, this January. I have the most exciting group of actors and designers (listed below) but now we need your help!

 

Director- Ellise Lesser

Assistant Director- Dana Greenfield, Dondre Stuetley

Stage Manager- Kelsey Lake

Lights Designer- David Shocket

Costume Designer- Matsy Stinson

Sound Designer- Jade Ziane

Props Designer- Jesse James Keitel

Makeup Design- Stefani Vivian

Produced by Pace University

 

Cast:

Mae-Maggie Allen

Lloyd-David Armanino

Henry-Chris Lemieux

 

Synopsis: A play in 17 scenes set amid the groping lives of the rural poor.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Since this show is being set up in an educational setting, our budget is extremely minimal- that's where you come in! We need your help in order to sincerely reach our goals in this show. We are looking for your generousity to make our artistic vision come true!

Your money will be going to our set, lights, props, costumes, and sound purchases. I have the most wonderful designers, but in order for them to work the extent of their magic we need some extra support. This is why we are aiming for a total of $500; this cast and crew deserves every resource possible! The amount of talent on this project is ridiculous and we want to accentuate that!


If we do not reach our goal, the money will still go towards the production- it is definitely happening- we would just like to supplement it as much as humanly possible. If we receive more than our goal (because you all rock) it will just increase what we are able to accomplish throughout this production!

Since we are based out of Pace, the main perk we can offer you in return is our undying love and gratitude. And tell you that you're pretty, because if you donate, you definitely are.

 

Come See the Show!

The show goes up January 3oth-February 3rd at 8pm in Schaeberle Studio at Pace University!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to contribute, please help in another way! This can be done by:

-Sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter (This is where Indiegogo wants us to remind you of their share tools!)

-Send out an email, write a letter, make a sign, or anything you can to help us make the show the best it can possibly be!

 

Thank you so much for your support while we get this show up and running!

says THANK YOU for supporting our show

The Last Night of Ballyhoo by Alfred Uhry

Steve Barberio made his New Mexico directorial debut!

Please contribute so we may continue bringing wonderful theatre with amazing actors to Albuquerque

Mother Road is emerging as one of New Mexico's premiere professional theatre companies and is celebrating its  seventh season in Albuquerque.

story:
The New Masculinites Festival

Man Question uses a theatre-based workshop to address masculinity, grow community, and create possibilities for new gender expressions--in order to create a world free of gender-based oppression in which every person has the power to play with and create their own identities. 

In 2011 we created the first New Masculinites Festival as a way to bring more people into the conversation. Through performances and dialogue, the festival explores the impacts that the expectations of masculinity have on our lives, and invites people to create new, less scripted versions of manhood.

The festival takes place on Saturday, May 2, at the Clemente Soto Velez Cultural Center at 107 Suffolk Street in Manhattan, starting at 1:00pm.

We Need Your Help to Make it Happen!

Here's what we're raising money for:

  • Space: The Clemente has given us a special rate for the day, but we still need to meet our end of the bargain.
  • Tech: It's important to us to keep the integrity of the work, and that often requires tech. This translates to rentals and tech professionals to help us make a great show. 
  • Print materials: Programs!
  • Artists Expenses : Our artists are generously donating their time and talent to the festival, but some of them are traveling to be here, and we want to help them.

We have some fun perks you receive if you donate! Check them out to the right.

The Impact

The conversation about how the expectations of masculinity have impacted us, is one that is rarely happening. Furthermore, there is not enough work to remedy the negative impacts. This festival seeks to do just that, and to make space for folks to create new definitions for masculinity. 

Our 2015 Festival Partner--Re:Gender

In alignment with their exciting effort to engage men in gender equity, Re:Gender has generously partnered to produce the festival.  Check them out at http://regender.org/

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to give, we still love you. Any interest in interning with us, or being a festival volunteer? Please let us know by emailing us wilandmike@manquestion.org.

Also, if you could spread the word about the festival and this campaign, we'd love you even more!

story:
Short Summary

Blue Moves' full-length production for the season is "Blue Terra," a free contemporary dance performance inspired by the theme Earth and performed on the grounds of Shelby Bottoms Nature Center Saturday, September 26th and Sunday, September 27th, 2015. The audience will be guided by a drummer to different sites in the area to watch earth-inspired dances performed on the grass. We're also collaborating with multi-media artists Camera Lucida from Louisville, Kentucky, and hope to include informational booths from local environmental groups, as well as performances by DancEast students. Choreography featured is by Holly Cannon Hesse, Sarah Marler, Valerie Hackworth, with a film by Amanda Cantrell Roche, and (hopefully) a guest choreographer. A moonlit walk led by the Nature Center Staff is planned as an option after both performances.

What We Need & What You Get

Blue Moves has always operated on a modest budget, but there are some essential, significant expenses associated with producing a free show. If we do not reach our goal, we'll start cutting from the bottom of the list and work our way up. If we exceed our goal, we'll be able to fund a guest choreographer, a professional photo shoot and videography, and increase artists stipends.

Liability Insurance:   $300

Indiegogo and fiscal sponsor fees:  $350

Costumes:   $300

Programs/Map:   $100

Guest Artists:  $300

Materials for perks and office supplies:  $300

Stage manager/sound:   $50

Graphic Designer:    $100

Portable speaker purchase:   $200

Dancer and choreographer stipends $100 each  x 8; $100 x 4 =   $1200

Bonus Category

Because Indiegogo fees are 4 % if you reach your goal and 9 % if you do not, we have set our fundraising goal at a bare minimum. However, there are other expenses we hope to cover in this campaign, and we hope you'll help us get there. An additional $400 would cover guest choreographer stipend and a professional photo shoot. An additional $1000 would allow us to pay for videography and more reasonable guest artist and graphic designer stipends.

Please consider this donation tantamount to purchasing a ticket. By supporting the project, you are essentially becoming a producer of Blue Terra.
Here are our perks:

$10  Name in Program

$25 Name in Program and personal thank you note with a small earth surprise gift

$50 All of the above + a Blue Moves water bottle

$75 All of the above + a small ad/message space in program

$150 Name in program, thank you note with Earth surprise gift, Blue Moves water bottle  + 1/4 page ad in program

$225  Name in program, thank you note with Earth surprise gift, Blue Moves water bottle  + 1/2 page ad in program

$500 Name in program, thank you note with Earth surprise gift, Blue Moves water bottles and an original Earth-inspired work of art created by Blue Moves.

Please note that all donations are tax-deductible and will be made to our fiscal sponsor, abrasiveMedia, but are earmarked for Blue Terra.

The Impact

This show is entirely crowd-funded and will not happen without your support. Your donation funds a contemporary dance performance in a public park. The earth theme is particularly poignant at this time, when it is crucial that we are aware of the needs of the earth. Please know we put in hundreds of hours of unpaid rehearsal and creative energy to bring this show to you. The art we make is for you, but we need your donation -- at whatever level you are able -- to bring it to life.

Our last show, Burning Blue, was successfully funded by the generous support of many of you and the Tennessee Arts Commission. 

Risks & Challenges

Weather is always a risk for an outdoor performance. In order to allow as many people as possible to experience our show, we are offering two performances. Creating a site-specific production means many on-site rehearsals, and working on ways to contain the energy and focus in an outdoor setting with many distractions. Our guest artist drummer will serve as a guide, leading the audience from site to site, taking you on short wooded trails and through open fields on your journey through this production.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation, please consider sharing this campaign. We may also need volunteers on the days of the shows. You can contact us at bluemovesmoderndance@gmail.com to be placed on a list for volunteer work. Thank you!

story:
JUSTE DEBOUT UK – History

JUSTE DEBOUT is one of the biggest Street Dance Festival Worldwide. It was created in France in 2002 and was the first event ever dedicated to Hip Hop, House, Lockin & Poppin (dance styles). Since 2005 JUSTE DEBOUT decided to have partnership with other countries. 

JUSTE DEBOUT UK has been created by CLARA BAJADO - Director (Director of INDAHOUSE Company) & VICKI IGBOKWE - Producer (Director of UCHENNA DANCE Company) in 2011.

An energetic female duet that really wanted to help UK Dance scene grow by providing a prestigious dance event as the JUSTE DEBOUT.

By having the JUSTE DEBOUT in the U.K we brought an international artistic exchange between dancers from all over the globe, and gave an amazing show to Non-Dancers, Dance lovers, music 'afficionados' and excitement seekers.

Since the 1st year, number of dancers registered and spectators has been growing, from 800 to more than 1000 spectators and dancers. 

In 2013, MARIE GUIBERGIA joined the team as an Executive Producer.

BE PART OF JUSTE DEBOUT UK SUCCESS STORY...

Since the beginning JUSTE DEBOUT UK has been a self-financed event so any contribution would help us to make this event happen again in London next February 2014. It has been such an amazing platform for local dancers but also for foreign dancers to meet exchange.

Our aim: Make Street Dance Culture accessible for all and get everyone together through Dance and Music. 

JUSTE DEBOUT UK needs £10000 to be able to pay the venue and everything else linked to it (security, sound system, catering, lightings, staff, technicians...) and no matter if we reach our goal all your contribution will go directly toward our venue expenses. 

This is only 1/2 of the total of our expenses so any penny's welcome :-) 

Since 2011 the event has been hold at the Camden Centre in Kings Cross St Pancras, it is really important for us to keep the venue for its location and an easy access for anyone coming from the UK and abroad. 

Also winners from the UK will have the chance to perform in Paris, France at the Grand Finale in front of 16000 people at the well known Palais Omnisport de Paris Bercy. A great opportunity to bring UK talents overseas. 

So any contributor will help us make this dream come true and help the development of UK young artists! 


EVEN IF YOU CAN'T HELP... YOU STILL CAN... 

By spreading the word to the world!!!

If you or your friend or your family know a friend or a member of their family who knows... It's all about community, communication, sharing & love... 


THANK YOU IS NOT ENOUGH & TALK IS CHEAP WE CAN'T OFFER YOU MUCH IN RETURN BUT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WOULD HELP OUR COMMUNITY GROW AND KEEP OUR ART ALIVE!!!
story_txt:
JUSTE DEBOUT UK – History


JUSTE DEBOUT is one of the biggest Street Dance Festival Worldwide. It was created in France in 2002 and was the first event ever dedicated to Hip Hop, House, Lockin & Poppin (dance styles). Since 2005 JUSTE DEBOUT decided to have partnership with other countries. 
JUSTE DEBOUT UK has been created by CLARA BAJADO - Director (Director of INDAHOUSE Company) & VICKI IGBOKWE - Producer (Director of UCHENNA DANCE Company) in 2011.
An energetic female duet that really wanted to help UK Dance scene grow by providing a prestigious dance event as the JUSTE DEBOUT.
By having the JUSTE DEBOUT in the U.K we brought an international artistic exchange between dancers from all over the globe, and gave an amazing show to Non-Dancers, Dance lovers, music 'afficionados' and excitement seekers.
Since the 1st year, number of dancers registered and spectators has been growing, from 800 to more than 1000 spectators and dancers. 
In 2013, MARIE GUIBERGIA joined the team as an Executive Producer.


BE PART OF JUSTE DEBOUT UK SUCCESS STORY...
Since the beginning JUSTE DEBOUT UK has been a self-financed event so any contribution would help us to make this event happen again in London next February 2014. It has been such an amazing platform for local dancers but also for foreign dancers to meet exchange.
Our aim: Make Street Dance Culture accessible for all and get everyone together through Dance and Music. 


JUSTE DEBOUT UK needs £10000 to be able to pay the venue and everything else linked to it (security, sound system, catering, lightings, staff, technicians...) and no matter if we reach our goal all your contribution will go directly toward our venue expenses. 
This is only 1/2 of the total of our expenses so any penny's welcome :-) 
Since 2011 the event has been hold at the Camden Centre in Kings Cross St Pancras, it is really important for us to keep the venue for its location and an easy access for anyone coming from the UK and abroad. 
Also winners from the UK will have the chance to perform in Paris, France at the Grand Finale in front of 16000 people at the well known Palais Omnisport de Paris Bercy. A great opportunity to bring UK talents overseas. 
So any contributor will help us make this dream come true and help the development of UK young artists! 



EVEN IF YOU CAN'T HELP... YOU STILL CAN... 
By spreading the word to the world!!!
If you or your friend or your family know a friend or a member of their family who knows... It's all about community, communication, sharing & love... 

THANK YOU IS NOT ENOUGH & TALK IS CHEAP WE CAN'T OFFER YOU MUCH IN RETURN BUT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WOULD HELP OUR COMMUNITY GROW AND KEEP OUR ART ALIVE!!!

story:
Who are these gabby little ladies and why are they wedged, unmoving, amid the furniture of this enormous mansion? Where is the rest of their body? What could be hidden inside those purses that they’re clutching so tightly? And who is feeding all these cats that we see traipsing around? Is it really a mansion or some kind of institution? What is the deal with that man who keeps visiting them at any odd time? How can they be so pretty and yet sing so terribly out of tune? And, finally, what could possibly be the source of all their self-confidence?

Ποιες είναι αυτές οι λαλίστατες γυναίκες που στέκονται έτσι ακίνητες και σφηνωμένες; Που βρίσκεται το υπόλοιπο σώμα τους; Τι κρύβουν στις τσάντες τους και τις κρατούν τόσο σφιχτά; Κι αυτές οι γάτες που κυκλοφορούν στο χώρο από ποιον άραγε να ταΐζονται  Πρόκειται για έπαυλη ή μήπως είναι κάποιο ίδρυμα; Τι ρόλο παίζει αυτός ο άνδρας που τις επισκέπτεται τόσο συχνά; Πως είναι δυνατόν να είναι τόσο όμορφες και να τραγουδούν τόσο παράφωνα;  Και από που αντλούν, επιτέλους, τόση αυτοπεποίθηση;


                                                 

What’s the project about?

“Happy Days in Grey Gardens” is a production inspired by Samuel Beckett’s “Happy Days” and the Maysles brothers’ documentary “Grey Gardens”. It is a play for 9 women and one man. Mondays & Tuesdays from the 4th of November at the 104 Theatre in Athens.

Click here to learn more and interact with our site that was especially designed by Dimitris Marlagoutsos.

Τι είναι το project;

Οι “Ευτυχισμένες μέρες στους τεφρούς κήπους” είναι μια θεατρική παράσταση εμπνευσμένη από τις «Ευτυχισμένες μέρες» του Samuel Becket και το ντοκιμαντέρ «Grey Gardens» των αδερφών Maysles. Με πρωταγωνιστές εννέα γυναίκες και έναν άνδρα. Η πρεμιέρα της έχει προγραμματιστεί στις 4 Νοεμβρίου 2013 στην Αθήνα, στο θέατρο 104 

Κλικάρετε εδώ για να μάθετε περισσότερα και να παίξετε με το διαδραστικό μας site που έφτιαξε ειδικά για την παράσταση ο Δημήτρης Μαρλαγκούτσος.

                                             

Summary

Nine women from different age groups and backgrounds. Every dawn, they wake up and every nightfall, they perish. Over and over again, with dignity and awkwardness. Every one of their days is as a lifetime that must be filled with activities to justify the Greatest of Questions: why do they dwell in this world and what is their purpose? At their side, a single man attempts to explain the inexplicable. He is caretaker, servant, observer... watching them happily relish in the absurdity of their existence.

Read more about the play and watch the original audiovisual material made especially for the production’s site.

Σύνοψη

Εννέα γυναίκες διαφορετικών ηλικιών και καταβολών κάθε πρωί ξυπνούν και κάθε βράδυ πεθαίνουν. Ξανά και ξανά, με αμηχανία και αξιοπρέπεια. Κάθε ημέρα τους είναι σαν μια ολόκληρη ζωή που πρέπει να γεμίσει από δραστηριότητες που θα δικαιολογήσουν το πιο μεγάλο ερωτηματικό: Γιατί βρίσκονται σε αυτόν τον κόσμο και ποιος είναι ο σκοπός τους; Δίπλα τους, ένας μοναδικός άντρας, προσπαθεί να δώσει εξηγήσεις στο ανεξήγητο. Παρατηρητής, επιστάτης και υπηρέτης, τις παρακολουθεί να απολαμβάνουν ευτυχισμένες το παράλογο της ύπαρξης.

Διαβάστε περισσότερα για το έργο και δείτε το πρωτότυπο οπτικοακουστικό υλικό που φτιάχτηκε για το site της παράστασης.

                                          

Why do we think it’s important to realize this project?

We live in a time where the absurd prevails. Sometimes it seems like we live in an institution which forces us to commit to its new terminology. All relationships need to be redefined: social, political and, ultimately, existential. We all feel we should get away from this situation, but at the end of the day we stay put,  almost self-willingly. We live in total immovability and passively accept everything that happens to us (with rare exceptions). What is the thing that really drives us to this non-action? That is exactly what we aim to explore through this production; it is why we consider it so important to make this project materialize, through your contributions.

We are excited with the crowd funding process and especially with your part in it. We firmly believe in the importance of making theatre in Greece in this historic time, when no funds are being channeled for the arts. Through this effort, we think we can all help promote freedom of expression and support fresh, creative ideas individually and collectively. Thus, these ideas may be able to reach their audience without succumbing to this non-action that is being imposed on us. We see crowdfunding as the future and consider it a creative process in itself. We think it is well worth looking into what alternative funding has to offer. If you have not done it before, you can always start with our production “Happy Days in Grey Gardens” in Athens!

Γιατί πιστεύουμε ότι είναι σημαντική η υλοποίηση του;

Ζούμε σε μια εποχή όπου το παράλογο κυριαρχεί. Μοιάζει σαν να ζούμε σε ένα ίδρυμα το οποίο μας αναγκάζει να μάθουμε την νέα ορολογία του με την οποία μέχρι πριν μερικά χρόνια δεν είχαμε καμία σχέση. Οι σχέσεις επαναπροσδιορίζονται. Κοινωνικές, πολιτικές και τελικά υπαρξιακές. Από αυτό το περιβάλλον θα θέλαμε να ξεφύγουμε αλλά τελικά σχεδόν οικειοθελώς παραμένουμε. Βρισκόμαστε σε πλήρη ακινησία και δεχόμαστε παθητικά όσα μας συμβαίνουν πλην ελάχιστων εξαιρέσεων. Τι είναι αυτό που μας οδηγεί στην μη δράση; Αυτό προσπαθούμε να διερευνήσουμε μέσα στην παράσταση αυτή και γι αυτό θεωρούμε σημαντικό να γίνει πραγματικότητα με την δική σας συμμετοχή.

Είμαστε ενθουσιασμένοι και με τον τρόπο που θα συγκεντρώσουμε τα χρήματα για να πάρει σάρκα και οστά αυτή η παράσταση και συγκεκριμένα με την βοήθειά σας, γιατί είναι σημαντικό να υλοποιούνται παραστάσεις σήμερα που δεν δίνονται πια χρήματα για τον πολιτισμό. Με αυτόν τον τρόπο βοηθάμε στην ελευθερία της έκφρασης και στηρίζουμε εμείς οι ίδιοι φρέσκες, δημιουργικές ιδέες να φτάσουν στο κοινό τους, χωρίς να είμαστε αναγκασμένοι να υποκύπτουν στην ακινησία που μας επιβάλουν. Γιατί είναι πιο δημιουργική διαδικασία και θεωρούμε ότι είναι το μέλλον. Αξίζει να εξερευνήσετε την εναλλακτική χρηματοδότηση ! Αν δεν το έχετε ξανακάνει, ξεκινήστε μαζί μας!

                                           

Who are we?

Katia Goulioni conceived the project and is the director of the play. She is an actress both in theatre and film and has directed two theatre productions (the plays “House” and “Baby”). You can learn more about her at: www.katiagoulioni.com.

The 10 actors of the performance have contributed to the play, as the material they brought to the rehearsals (text, photos, improvisations) became one of the major sources of the final text.

Ποιοι είμαστε;

Η Κάτια Γκουλιώνη που σκηνοθετεί την παράσταση, είχε και την αρχική σύλληψη της ιδέας.  Είναι η ίδια ηθοποιός στο θέατρο και τον κινηματογράφο και έχει σκηνοθετήσει στο παρελθόν άλλες δυο παραστάσεις (“House” και “Baby”).  Περισσότερα μπορείτε να δείτε στο: www.katiagoulioni.com.

Οι 10 ηθοποιοί της παράστασης συνδιαμόρφωσαν το έργο, καθώς το υλικό που έφεραν (κείμενα, φωτογραφίες, αυτοσχεδιασμοί) αποτέλεσε βασική πηγή για το τελικό κείμενο του έργου.

The actors: Michelle Valley, Larisa Vergou, Maria Eglezaki, Photini Kapellaki, Rita Lytou, Katerina Miheli, Thanasis Petropoulos, Thalia Protonotariou, Areti Seintaridou, Alexandra Hasani.



Production Credits:

Play: Katia Goulioni, Nikos Pastras, Angelos Frantzis.

Directing: Katia Goulioni

Set Design: Theo Prodromidis

Costumes Design: Katia Goulioni

Lighting Design: Sophia Adamopoulou

Assistant Director: Xenia Kalantzi

Promo Videos: Nikos Pastras, Angelos Frantzis

Site Construction: Dimitris Marlagoutsos


Οι ηθoποιοί: Michele Valley, Λαρίσα Βέργου, Μαρία Εγγλεζάκη, Φωτεινή Καπελλάκη, Ρίτα Λυτού, Κατερίνα Μιχελή, Θανάσης Πετρόπουλος, Θάλεια Πρωτονοταρίου, Αρετή Σεϊνταρίδου, Αλεξάνδρα Χασάνι


Οι υπόλοιποι συντελεστές της παράστασης:

Κείμενο: Κάτια Γκουλιώνη, Νίκος Πάστρας, Άγγελος Φραντζής

Σκηνοθεσία: Κάτια Γκουλιώνη

Σκηνογραφία: Θοδωρής Προδρομίδης

Κοστούμια: Κάτια Γκουλιώνη

Σχεδιασμός φωτισμού: Σοφία Αδαμοπούλου

Βοηθός σκηνοθέτη: Ξένια Καλαντζή

Promo videos: Νίκος Πάστρας, Άγγελος Φραντζής

Κατασκευή site: Δημήτρης Μαρλαγκούτσος


                           


Why do we need your participation?

With your support we are planning to cover our basic expenses (set/ costumes/ venue rent etc). This production requires work from 18 people, who will only get paid after basic expenses are covered. So, because we believe this performance is about you too, we invite you to help us out to realize it! 

Namely our budget is as follows (in Euros):

Theatre rental: 1800

Set/ Construction: 1000

Props: 200

Costumes: 400

Special Lights: 700

Poster/ Postcards: 300

Program: 300

Promotion: 300


Γιατί χρειαζόμαστε την συμμετοχή σας;

Με την υποστήριξη σας σκοπεύουμε να καλύψουμε τα βασικά μας έξοδα ( Σκηνικά-κοστούμια-ενοίκιο θεάτρου κτλ.) . Η παράσταση απαιτεί την δουλειά 18 ανθρώπων σε σύνολο οι οποίοι θα πληρωθούν εφόσον βγουν τα βασικά έξοδα. Επειδή πιστεύουμε ότι αυτή η παράσταση σας αφορά, σας καλούμε να μας βοηθήσετε να γίνει πραγματικότητα! 

Συγκεκριμένα τα χρήματα θα πάνε σε...

Βασικό ενοίκιο χώρου: 1800

Σκηνογραφία/κατασκευές: 1000

Φροντιστηριακά αντικείμενα: 200

Κοστούμια: 400

Ειδικοί φωτισμοί: 700

Αφίσα/κάρτες: 300

Πρόγραμμα: 300

Προωθητικές ενέργειες: 300

                                        

What is “Grey Gardens”?

The documentary “Grey Gardens” by the Maysles brothers was filmed in the infamous “Grey Gardens” estate of the Bouvier family. This masterpiece was at its time a tremendous style and fashion influencer, while it later spawned both a Broadway musical and a fiction film starring Jessica Lange and Drew Barrymore. “Grey Gardens” is the portrait of two rather eccentric women: the 79 year old Edith Bouvier- Beale and her 56 year old daughter, “LIttle” Edie, who were the aunt and cousin respectively of Jackie Kennedy - Onassis. Both women lived secluded in their deserted mansion of 28 rooms, infested with wild weeds, cats, fleas and raccoons. The camera lens invades their most personal moments, captures their arguments, confessions of unrequited love and unfulfilled dreams, and presents them as eternal teenagers still swimming around in the faded grandeur of their long lost glory days.

The queer world of “Grey Gardens” (being particularly close to Beckett’s universe) was a major source of inspiration for the development of the characters of our play.

Τι είναι το “Grey Gardens”;

Η ταινία-ντοκιμαντέρ «Grey Gardens» των αδελφών Maysles γυρίστηκε το 1975 στους ξακουστούς «Γκρίζους Κήπους» της οικογένειας Mπουβιέ. Το αριστουργηματικό αυτό φιλμ είχε τεράστια επιρροή στον κόσμο του στιλ και της μόδας και έγινε θεατρική παράσταση και ταινία με την Ντρού Μπάριμορ και την Τζέσικα Λανγκ. Το «Grey Gardens», είναι το πορτρέτο δύο εκκεντρικών γυναικών, της 79χρονης Ίντιθ Μπουβιέ Μπιλ και της 56χρονης κόρης της Ίντι, θείας και ξαδέρφης αντίστοιχα της Ζακλίν Κένεντι-Ωνάση, που ζουν απομονωμένες στην ερειπωμένη, 28 δωματίων, έπαυλή τους, μέσα στα αγριόχορτα, ανάμεσα σε γάτες, ψύλλους και ρακούν. Η κάμερα εισβάλλει στις πιο προσωπικές τους στιγμές, αποσπώντας αντιδικίες, εξομολογήσεις για αδιέξοδους έρωτες και ανεκπλήρωτα όνειρα, παρουσιάζοντάς τες ως αιώνιες έφηβες, βυθισμένες στα περασμένα τους μεγαλεία. 

Ο παράδοξος κόσμος του “Grey Gardens”, τόσο κοντινός στο πνεύμα του Μπέκετ, αποτέλεσε βασική πηγή έμπνευσης για την ανάπτυξη των χαρακτήρων του έργου μας.

                                              

What is “Happy Days”?

“Happy Days” by Samuel Beckett is considered one of the masterpieces of modern theatre and one of the most emblematic plays of the theatre of the absurd. In “Happy Days” nothing ever changes. Movement is immobility. Absence is action. Time is frozen and space is isolated. Human existence vibrates not with the conflict of passions or events, but in the absence of those.

Winnie is looking for a kind gesture, an answer to her questions. She is sitting still atop her deserted hill. Abandoned, she screams a whisper for help. The tragic twist: the abandonment is dwelling inside her and her invocation for help is but to herself.

At no point did we ever contemplate to adapt such an accomplished and well made play as “Happy Days”. We instead took inspiration from the philosophy and questioning in Beckett’s work -and this play in particular- allowing them to permeate the essence of our production.

                                

Τι είναι οι “ευτυχισμένες μέρες”;

Οι “Ευτυχισμένες μέρες” του Samuel Becket θεωρείται ένα από τα αριστουργήματα του σύγχρονου θεάτρου και ένα από τα πιο εμβληματικά έργα του θεάτρου του παραλόγου. Στις «ευτυχισμένες μέρες» τίποτα δεν αλλάζει. Η κίνηση είναι  ακινησία. Η απουσία είναι δράση. Ο χρόνος είναι παγωμένος και ο χώρος είναι απομονωμένος. Η ανθρώπινη ύπαρξη πάλλεται, όχι σε συγκρούσεις παθών και γεγονότων, αλλά στην απουσία αυτών. 

Η Ουίννυ ψάχνει μια τρυφερή χειρονομία, μια απάντηση στις ερωτήσεις της. Είναι ακίνητη στον έρημο λόφο. Εγκαταλελειμμένη, ουρλιάζει ψιθυριστά για βοήθεια. Με την τραγική διαφορά ότι η εγκατάλειψη βρίσκεται μέσα της, και η επίκληση είναι προς τον εαυτό της.

Σε καμία περίπτωση δεν θελήσαμε να διασκευάσουμε ένα τόσο ολοκληρωμένο έργο σαν αυτό. Όμως η φιλοσοφία και τα ερωτήματα που βρίσκονται στο σύνολο του έργου του Μπέκετ και ειδικότερα οι “Ευτυχισμένες μέρες”  διατρέχουν το πνεύμα της παράστασης μας.

                                            

The Theatre

104 Theatre is aiming at promoting the arts and culture through the creation of a diverse artistic program (with abn emphasis on new creators), which aims at reaching a wide audience.

 

Το θέατρο

Το θέατρο 104 έχει σαν στόχο την προαγωγή της τέχνης και του πολιτισμού, μέσα από την δημιουργία ενός πολυσυλλεκτικού καλλιτεχνικού προγράμματος που απευθύνεται σε μια ευρεία κλίμακα του κοινού, με έμφαση ωστόσο στους νέους δημιουργούς.

everything that happens to us (with rare exceptions). What is the thing that
really drives us to this non-action? That is exactly what we aim to explore through
this production; it is why we consider it so important to make this project
materialize, through your contributions.
We are excited with the crowd funding process and especially
with your part in it. We firmly believe in the importance of making theatre in
Greece in this historic time, when
no funds are being channeled for the arts. Through this effort, we think we can
all help promote freedom of expression and support fresh, creative ideas individually
and collectively. Thus, these ideas may be able to reach their audience without
succumbing to this non-action that is being imposed on us. We see crowdfunding
as the future and consider it a creative process in itself. We think it is well
worth looking into what alternative funding has to offer. If you have not done
it before, you can always start with our production “Happy Days in Grey
Gardens” in Athens!


Γιατί πιστεύουμε ότι είναι σημαντική η υλοποίηση
του;


Ζούμε
σε μια εποχή όπου το παράλογο κυριαρχεί.
Μοιάζει σαν να ζούμε σε ένα  ίδρυμα το
οποίο μας αναγκάζει να μάθουμε την νέα
ορολογία του με την οποία μέχρι πριν
μερικά χρόνια δεν είχαμε καμία σχέση.
Οι σχέσεις επαναπροσδιορίζονται.
Κοινωνικές, πολιτικές και τελικά
υπαρξιακές. Από αυτό το περιβάλλον θα
θέλαμε να ξεφύγουμε αλλά τελικά σχεδόν
οικειοθελώς παραμένουμε. Βρισκόμαστε
σε πλήρη ακινησία και δεχόμαστε παθητικά
όσα μας συμβαίνουν πλην ελάχιστων
εξαιρέσεων.  Τι είναι αυτό που μας οδηγεί
στην μη δράση; Αυτό προσπαθούμε να
διερευνήσουμε μέσα στην παράσταση αυτή
και γι αυτό θεωρούμε σημαντικό να γίνει
πραγματικότητα με την δική σας συμμετοχή.






Είμαστε
ενθουσιασμένοι και με τον τρόπο που θα
συγκεντρώσουμε τα χρήματα για να πάρει
σάρκα και οστά αυτή η παράσταση και
συγκεκριμένα με την βοήθειά σας, γιατί
είναι σημαντικό να υλοποιούνται
παραστάσεις σήμερα που δεν δίνονται
πια  χρήματα για τον πολιτισμό. Με αυτόν
τον τρόπο βοηθάμε στην ελευθερία της
έκφρασης και στηρίζουμε εμείς οι ίδιοι
φρέσκες, δημιουργικές ιδέες να φτάσουν
στο κοινό τους, χωρίς να είμαστε
αναγκασμένοι να υποκύπτουν στην
ακινησία που μας επιβάλουν. Γιατί είναι
πιο δημιουργική διαδικασία και θεωρούμε
ότι είναι το μέλλον. Αξίζει να εξερευνήσετε
την εναλλακτική χρηματοδότηση !  Αν δεν
το έχετε ξανακάνει, ξεκινήστε μαζί μας!


                                           
Who are we?
Katia Goulioni conceived the project and is the director of the
play. She is an actress both in theatre and film and has directed two theatre
productions (the plays “House” and “Baby”). You can learn more about her at: www.katiagoulioni.com.
The 10 actors of the performance have contributed to the play,
as the material they brought to the rehearsals (text, photos, improvisations)
became one of the major sources of the final text.






Ποιοι είμαστε;

Η Κάτια Γκουλιώνη που σκηνοθετεί την παράσταση, είχε και την αρχική σύλληψη της ιδέας.  Είναι η ίδια ηθοποιός στο θέατρο και τον κινηματογράφο και έχει σκηνοθετήσει στο παρελθόν άλλες δυο παραστάσεις (“House” και “Baby”).  Περισσότερα μπορείτε να δείτε στο: www.katiagoulioni.com.
Οι 10 ηθοποιοί της παράστασης συνδιαμόρφωσαν το έργο, καθώς το υλικό που έφεραν (κείμενα, φωτογραφίες, αυτοσχεδιασμοί) αποτέλεσε βασική πηγή για το τελικό κείμενο του έργου.



The actors: Michelle Valley, Larisa Vergou, Maria Eglezaki, Photini Kapellaki, Rita Lytou, Katerina Miheli, Thanasis Petropoulos, Thalia Protonotariou, Areti Seintaridou, Alexandra Hasani.



Production Credits:
Play: Katia Goulioni, Nikos Pastras, Angelos Frantzis.
Directing: Katia Goulioni
Set Design: Theo Prodromidis
Costumes Design: Katia Goulioni
Lighting Design: Sophia Adamopoulou
Assistant Director: Xenia Kalantzi
Promo Videos: Nikos Pastras, Angelos Frantzis
Site Construction: Dimitris Marlagoutsos

Οι ηθoποιοί: Michele Valley, Λαρίσα Βέργου, Μαρία Εγγλεζάκη, Φωτεινή Καπελλάκη, Ρίτα Λυτού, Κατερίνα Μιχελή, Θανάσης Πετρόπουλος, Θάλεια Πρωτονοταρίου, Αρετή Σεϊνταρίδου, Αλεξάνδρα Χασάνι


Οι υπόλοιποι συντελεστές της παράστασης:
Κείμενο: Κάτια Γκουλιώνη, Νίκος Πάστρας, Άγγελος Φραντζής
Σκηνοθεσία: Κάτια Γκουλιώνη
Σκηνογραφία: Θοδωρής Προδρομίδης
Κοστούμια: Κάτια Γκουλιώνη
Σχεδιασμός φωτισμού: Σοφία Αδαμοπούλου
Βοηθός σκηνοθέτη: Ξένια Καλαντζή
Promo videos: Νίκος Πάστρας, Άγγελος Φραντζής
Κατασκευή site: Δημήτρης Μαρλαγκούτσος

                           




Why do we need your participation?

With your support we are planning to cover our basic expenses (set/ costumes/ venue rent etc). This production requires work from 18 people, who will only get paid after basic expenses are covered. So, because we believe this performance is about you too, we invite you to help us out to realize it! 
Namely our budget is as follows (in Euros):

Theatre rental: 1800
Set/ Construction: 1000
Props: 200
Costumes: 400
Special Lights: 700
Poster/ Postcards: 300
Program: 300
Promotion: 300


Γιατί χρειαζόμαστε την συμμετοχή σας;

Με την υποστήριξη σας σκοπεύουμε να καλύψουμε τα βασικά μας έξοδα ( Σκηνικά-κοστούμια-ενοίκιο θεάτρου κτλ.) . Η παράσταση απαιτεί την δουλειά 18 ανθρώπων σε σύνολο οι οποίοι θα πληρωθούν εφόσον βγουν τα βασικά έξοδα. Επειδή πιστεύουμε ότι αυτή η παράσταση σας αφορά, σας καλούμε να μας βοηθήσετε να γίνει πραγματικότητα! 
Συγκεκριμένα τα χρήματα θα πάνε σε...
Βασικό ενοίκιο χώρου: 1800
Σκηνογραφία/κατασκευές: 1000
Φροντιστηριακά αντικείμενα: 200
Κοστούμια: 400
Ειδικοί φωτισμοί: 700
Αφίσα/κάρτες: 300
Πρόγραμμα: 300
Προωθητικές ενέργειες: 300


                                        

What is “Grey Gardens”?


The documentary “Grey Gardens” by the Maysles brothers was
filmed in the infamous “Grey Gardens” estate of the Bouvier family. This
masterpiece was at its time a tremendous style and fashion influencer, while it
later spawned both a Broadway musical and a fiction film starring Jessica Lange
and Drew Barrymore. “Grey Gardens” is the portrait of two rather eccentric
women: the 79 year old Edith Bouvier- Beale and her 56 year old daughter,
“LIttle” Edie, who were the aunt and cousin respectively of Jackie Kennedy -
Onassis. Both women lived secluded in their deserted mansion of 28 rooms,
infested with wild weeds, cats, fleas and raccoons. The camera lens invades
their most personal moments, captures their arguments, confessions of
unrequited love and unfulfilled dreams, and presents them as eternal teenagers
still swimming around in the faded grandeur of their long lost glory days.
The queer world of “Grey Gardens” (being particularly close to
Beckett’s universe) was a major source of inspiration for the development of
the characters of our play.


Τι είναι το “Grey Gardens”;

Η ταινία-ντοκιμαντέρ «Grey Gardens» των αδελφών Maysles γυρίστηκε το 1975 στους ξακουστούς «Γκρίζους Κήπους» της οικογένειας Mπουβιέ. Το αριστουργηματικό αυτό φιλμ είχε τεράστια επιρροή στον κόσμο του στιλ και της μόδας και έγινε θεατρική παράσταση και ταινία με την Ντρού Μπάριμορ και την Τζέσικα Λανγκ. Το «Grey Gardens», είναι το πορτρέτο δύο εκκεντρικών γυναικών, της 79χρονης Ίντιθ Μπουβιέ Μπιλ και της 56χρονης κόρης της Ίντι, θείας και ξαδέρφης αντίστοιχα της Ζακλίν Κένεντι-Ωνάση, που ζουν απομονωμένες στην ερειπωμένη, 28 δωματίων, έπαυλή τους, μέσα στα αγριόχορτα, ανάμεσα σε γάτες, ψύλλους και ρακούν. Η κάμερα εισβάλλει στις πιο προσωπικές τους στιγμές, αποσπώντας αντιδικίες, εξομολογήσεις για αδιέξοδους έρωτες και ανεκπλήρωτα όνειρα, παρουσιάζοντάς τες ως αιώνιες έφηβες, βυθισμένες στα περασμένα τους μεγαλεία. 
Ο παράδοξος κόσμος του “Grey Gardens”, τόσο κοντινός στο πνεύμα του Μπέκετ, αποτέλεσε βασική πηγή έμπνευσης για την ανάπτυξη των χαρακτήρων του έργου μας.

                                              



What is “Happy Days”?


“Happy Days” by Samuel
Beckett is considered one of the masterpieces of modern theatre and one of the
most emblematic plays of the theatre of the absurd. In “Happy Days” nothing
ever changes. Movement is immobility. Absence is action. Time is frozen and
space is isolated. Human existence vibrates not with the conflict of passions
or events, but in the absence of those. 
Winnie is looking for a kind gesture, an answer to her
questions. She is sitting still atop her deserted hill. Abandoned, she screams
a whisper for help. The tragic twist: the abandonment is dwelling inside her
and her invocation for help is but to herself.
At no point did we ever contemplate to adapt such an
accomplished and well made play as “Happy Days”. We instead took inspiration
from the philosophy and questioning in Beckett’s work -and this play in
particular- allowing them to permeate the essence of our production.


                                

Τι είναι οι “ευτυχισμένες μέρες”;

Οι “Ευτυχισμένες μέρες” του Samuel Becket θεωρείται ένα από τα αριστουργήματα του σύγχρονου θεάτρου και ένα από τα πιο εμβληματικά έργα του θεάτρου του παραλόγου. Στις «ευτυχισμένες μέρες» τίποτα δεν αλλάζει. Η κίνηση είναι  ακινησία. Η απουσία είναι δράση. Ο χρόνος είναι παγωμένος και ο χώρος είναι απομονωμένος. Η ανθρώπινη ύπαρξη πάλλεται, όχι σε συγκρούσεις παθών και γεγονότων, αλλά στην απουσία αυτών. 
Η Ουίννυ ψάχνει μια τρυφερή χειρονομία, μια απάντηση στις ερωτήσεις της. Είναι ακίνητη στον έρημο λόφο. Εγκαταλελειμμένη, ουρλιάζει ψιθυριστά για βοήθεια. Με την τραγική διαφορά ότι η εγκατάλειψη βρίσκεται μέσα της, και η επίκληση είναι προς τον εαυτό της.
Σε καμία περίπτωση δεν θελήσαμε να διασκευάσουμε ένα τόσο ολοκληρωμένο έργο σαν αυτό. Όμως η φιλοσοφία και τα ερωτήματα που βρίσκονται στο σύνολο του έργου του Μπέκετ και ειδικότερα οι “Ευτυχισμένες μέρες”  διατρέχουν το πνεύμα της παράστασης μας.

                                            

The Theatre

104 Theatre is aiming at promoting the arts and culture through the creation of a diverse artistic program (with abn emphasis on new creators), which aims at reaching a wide audience.

 

Το θέατρο

Το θέατρο 104 έχει σαν στόχο την προαγωγή της τέχνης και του πολιτισμού, μέσα από την δημιουργία ενός πολυσυλλεκτικού καλλιτεχνικού προγράμματος που απευθύνεται σε μια ευρεία κλίμακα του κοινού, με έμφαση ωστόσο στους νέους δημιουργούς.

story:
Epic Arts has identified a need for raising awareness of road safely in Cambodia. Using the performing arts to education and send a clear message to people in the country we hope that we can tackle this issue and educate Cambodian people about motorbike

The project will be based on information from the ‘Cambodian National Road Safety Action Plan 2011-2020’, initiated by Handicap International. 

The report states the following key facts that have inspired this project:

 

-       76% of all motorbike accident fatalities in Cambodia are the result of head injuries

-       Motorbike riders account for 77% of all major casualties and 71% of fatalities in Cambodia

-       50% of all reported motorbike accidents are due to speeding

-       17% of all reported motorbike accidents are due to drink driving

-       At least 4 people everyday die on Cambodia’s roads because of a motorbike related accident.

 

The Project

 

The project entitled ‘MOTO, MOTO’ will be created by Epic Encounters performers and choreographer Becky Devitt. The project will consist of a movement/physical theatre piece that raises awareness and educates people on the dangers of motorbike driving in Cambodia. There will be an accompanying movement workshop that works alongside the performance to educate participants further. ‘MOTO, MOTO will tour the regions of Battambang, Siem Reap, Kampong Thom, Phnom Penh, Takeo and Kampot provinces performing for schools, villages, communes and Pagodas between October and March 2013-2014.

 

Overall Aim

 

Raise awareness and education around road safely and motorbikes in Cambodia, helping to reduce road accidents in Cambodia through the use of theatre and performance.

 

Outcomes

 

The audience members and participants of the workshop will be more aware of the dangers of:

-       Not wearing helmets/Not fastening helmets

-       High speed driving

-       Drink driving

-       The affects of motorbike accidents on friends and families

 

In addition to this:

-       The audience will have a clearer understanding of disability and be able see ability not disability in our performers

-       The audience will be able to interact with the performers through the workshop and enjoy learning about a serious subject using the arts

-       The Encounters performers and other staff and students at Epic Arts will be educated and made more aware of road safety issues.

 

Epic Arts is an NGO working in Cambodia. We promote integration of people of all abilities and disabilities using the arts as a form of expression, transformation and empowerment; celebrating the creative potential of those with whom we work. Epic Arts believes in a world where Every Person Counts (EPiC) and where people living with disabilities are valued, accepted and respected.

EPIC ARTS is a registered charity in the UK and is a registered NGO in the Kingdom of Cambodia. We are subject to independent audits within the UK and we are a transparent and accountable organisation.

story:
...Mondays' campaign is ALL about community members (you) coming together to $upport a lofty and worth while creative endeavor that will have far reaching positive impacts on others.

 

CLKing Creations

Is a community based artist development and performing arts organization founded on the belief that the arts are in us all.  With a sole focus on beautifying our world in all that we do we pride ourselves on providing the perfect blend of education and entrtainment within all of our creations.  This approach has resulted in numerous gains among those our offerings have reached to date. It is now time to expand on this reach, a feat that will only be achieved with the continued support of contributors like you.      

...Mondays Synopsis

Mondays is an engaging stage play centered around the woes of the modern day workforce. Filled with situations that every working person can relate to, Mondays uses humor, drama and suspense to portray what most Mondays really feel like. From horrible bosses to insufficient office space, this corporate comedy is filled with twists, turns and plenty of interns.  Complete with an array of unforgettable workplace personalities this production makes it clear why everyone hates Mondays.

What You See IS What You Get

Contributions will go to support all pre-production, production, and post-production expenses associated with the creation of ...Mondays the stage play AND the twelve (12) episode web series that will be leveraged to promote said stage play.  This two phase endeavor has an all inclusive budget of nearly $10,000 of which we are attempting to raise half or $5,000.  While our investment goal may be substaintial, through the increase in moral and corporate culture that will result, the lasting impact ...Mondays will have will be invaluable for years to come. (Itemized expenses below)

  • Cast & Crew Payroll - $1,450
  • Filming - $250
  • Editing - $450 
  • Theatre Rental - $4,080
  • Set Design -$900
  • Transportation - $325
  • Insurance - $189
  • Marketing - $1,750
  • Public Relations - $590

Impact

Everybody needs to learn.  Everybody needs to laugh.  Through this ...Mondays campaign we are attempting to provide both to as many people as possible.  With your contribution we will be able to do just that.  THANKS IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us share our goal, our dream & our campaign with THE WORLD.

You can follow us on most social media outlets @clkingcreations or at our website www.clkingcreations.com  

THANK YOU!!!

story:
El Club de los CURSIS, Teatro IN DA HAUS

4x4 Producciones nació en 2013 de la mano de Maga Díaz, Carla Müller, Diana Díaz y Maria Alesia Machado. En la búsqueda de crear un proyecto personal como actrices, decidimos emprender una productora de teatro, audiovisual y gestión cultural, con el fin de generarnos oportunidades de trabajo para nosotras y para otros en una situación país tan compleja como la que vivimos. Para nosotras la crisis ha sido un impulso para crear y apostar por una Caracas que ofrezca más opciones de entretenimiento y reflexión a través de la cultura.

El TEATRO IN DA HAUS  es un formato de teatro no convencional íntimo es decir, la obra puede ser presentada desde una oficina, un jardín, una cocina, hasta la sala de una casa, lo que permite que el espectador puede sentirse parte de la historia que se presenta. El TEATRO IN DA HAUS es el motor de 4x4 Producciones  y este año decidimos ......la primera experiencia del TEATRO IN DA HAUS con una nueva obra “El club de los cursis”. La primera temporada fue con “Te dejo la corona” de la misma autora y cómplice de 4x4: Karin Valecillos.  

El Club de los Cursis reflexiona a través de la comedia sobre la manera en cómo la sociedad contemporánea entiende el romanticismo y las contradicciones entre la idealización de las relaciones y la cotidianidad. En un mundo donde las relaciones de pareja cada vez son más frágiles, esta obra muestra con humor nuestras ideas preconcebidas del amor. El Club de los Cursis IN DA HAUS es una obra que nos da la posibilidad de encontrarnos, identificarnos y reconciliarnos con el tema del amor, algo que tanta falta nos hace en estos momentos como Venezolanos.

Con tu aporte podremos financiar la obra de teatro en su totalidad. Ademas estarás apoyando a Karin Valecillos la dramaturga, Leo Van Schermbeek el director, Jorge Roig el asistente de dirección, y un elenco conformado por siete actores: Antonio Delli, Aitor Aguirre, Héctor Castro, y nosotras las 4x4, para brindar una opción cultural diferente, más allá de los recortes eléctricos implementados en el país, que han afectado a los teatros y Centros Culturales de la ciudad. Todo esto son desafíos que nos impulsan a buscar soluciones creativas con el fin de generar un resultado.

¿Qué necesitamos para poder llevar a cabo el Club de los Cursis?

Escenografía, vestuario, material POP para la promoción, plan de medios, creación de teasers digitales de la obra para la difusión y promoción, mobiliario para el público y transporte para la escenografía a las diferentes locaciones.
 

¿Qué hacemos en 4x4 Producciones?

Desde que nos unimos y conformamos 4x4 Producciones hemos generamos  propuestas teatrales de calidad en cada uno de los montajes. Entre ellos: 

      ·  El Piquete (2013 y 2014) Co-Producción con La Caja de Fósforos. Festival de       montaje de textos inéditos realizados por dramaturgos nacionales emergentes.
      ·  Online (2015) Original de Karin Valecillos / Dirección: Giovanny García. 4ta Temporada de Microteatro Venezuela
     ·  Las Mirabal "En el Tiempo de Las Mariposas" (2014-2015) de Caridad Svich / Dirección: Haydée Faverola. 1era Temporada en el Espacio Plural del Trasnocho Cultural y 2da Temporada en la Sala Experimental del Centro Cultural BOD
     ·  Te Dejo La Corona IN DA HAUS (2014-2015) Original de Karin Valecillos / Dirección: Giovanny García. 1era Temporada en espacios no convencionales 2da temporada en la Sala Experimental del Centro Cultural BOD. Festival de Teatro de Caracas 2015
     ·  Ctrl+Alt+Del "Las infinitas posibilidades del amor" (2014) de Itamar Moses/Dirección: Diana Volpe.  Teatro Santa Fe. 

Creemos en lo que hacemos y este segundo IN DA HAUS lo pronosticamos con mucho éxito y entusiasmo.  Gracias por tu tiempo, apoyo y por ser un cursi como nosotras :)
story_txt:
El Club de los CURSIS, Teatro IN DA HAUS


4x4 Producciones nació en 2013 de la mano de Maga Díaz, Carla Müller, Diana Díaz y Maria Alesia Machado. En
la búsqueda de crear un proyecto personal como actrices, decidimos
emprender una productora de teatro, audiovisual y gestión cultural, con
el fin de generarnos oportunidades de trabajo para nosotras y para otros en una situación país tan compleja como la que vivimos. Para nosotras la crisis ha sido un impulso para crear y apostar por una Caracas que ofrezca más opciones de entretenimiento y reflexión a través de la cultura.
El TEATRO IN DA HAUS  es un formato de teatro no convencional íntimo es
decir, la obra puede ser presentada desde una oficina, un jardín, una cocina, hasta la sala
de una casa, lo que permite que el espectador puede sentirse parte de la historia
que se presenta. El TEATRO IN DA HAUS es el motor de 4x4 Producciones 
y este año decidimos ......la primera experiencia del TEATRO IN DA HAUS con
una nueva obra “El club de los cursis”. La primera temporada fue con “Te dejo
la corona” de la misma autora y cómplice de 4x4: Karin Valecillos.  
El Club de los Cursis reflexiona a través de
la comedia sobre la manera en cómo la sociedad contemporánea entiende el romanticismo
y las contradicciones entre la idealización de las relaciones y la
cotidianidad. En un mundo donde las relaciones de pareja cada vez son más
frágiles, esta obra muestra con humor nuestras ideas preconcebidas del amor. El Club de los Cursis IN DA HAUS es una obra
que nos da la posibilidad de encontrarnos, identificarnos y reconciliarnos con
el tema del amor, algo que tanta falta nos hace en estos momentos como
Venezolanos.
Con tu
aporte podremos financiar la obra de teatro en su totalidad. Ademas estarás apoyando a Karin Valecillos la dramaturga, Leo Van Schermbeek el director, Jorge Roig el asistente de dirección, y un elenco conformado por siete actores: Antonio Delli, Aitor Aguirre, Héctor Castro, y nosotras las 4x4, para brindar una opción cultural diferente, más allá de los recortes eléctricos implementados en el país, que han afectado a los teatros y Centros
Culturales de la ciudad. Todo esto son desafíos que nos impulsan a buscar soluciones creativas con el fin de generar
un resultado.
¿Qué necesitamos para poder llevar a cabo el Club de los Cursis?
Escenografía, vestuario, material POP para la promoción, plan de
medios, creación de teasers
digitales de la obra para la difusión y promoción, mobiliario para el público y transporte para la escenografía a las diferentes locaciones. 
¿Qué hacemos en 4x4 Producciones?
Desde que nos unimos y conformamos 4x4 Producciones hemos generamos  propuestas teatrales de calidad en cada uno de los montajes. Entre ellos: 
      · 
El Piquete (2013 y 2014) Co-Producción con La Caja de Fósforos. Festival de       montaje de textos inéditos realizados por
dramaturgos nacionales emergentes.      · 
Online (2015) Original de Karin Valecillos / Dirección: Giovanny García. 4ta Temporada de Microteatro Venezuela     · 
Las Mirabal "En el
Tiempo de Las Mariposas" (2014-2015) de Caridad Svich / Dirección: Haydée Faverola. 1era
Temporada en el Espacio Plural del Trasnocho Cultural y 2da Temporada en la Sala Experimental del Centro Cultural BOD     · 
Te Dejo La Corona IN DA HAUS (2014-2015) Original de Karin
Valecillos / Dirección: Giovanny García. 1era Temporada en espacios no convencionales 2da temporada en la Sala Experimental del Centro Cultural BOD. Festival de Teatro de Caracas 2015     · 
Ctrl+Alt+Del "Las
infinitas posibilidades del amor" (2014) de Itamar
Moses/Dirección: Diana Volpe.  Teatro Santa Fe. 
Creemos en lo que hacemos y este segundo IN DA HAUS lo pronosticamos con mucho éxito y entusiasmo.  Gracias por tu tiempo, apoyo y por ser un cursi como nosotras :)

story:
Our Project:

We are a group of local actors from Winnipeg Manitoba in Canada who have been selected to produce and perform the 2006 OBIE AWARD WINNING PLAY, "The Thugs" by Adam Bock, at the 2016 Winnipeg Fringe Theatre Festival  in July.

"The Thugs" is a quick paced, dark comedy about a group of temps working at a law firm who try to discover the truth about rumours of people who suddenly go missing at their law firm.  It is a great play with complex, funny characters and a female central cast at the heart of the story, which is why we are very excited about the production.

What we need:

We would like to reach out to you, in hopes to raise $1800 in order to help with production costs for our production.  With your help, funding for our project will help with the payment of:

Festival Venue and production fee - $750.00
Licensing and rights for the play - $750.00
Props, Costumes, Advertising (Posters & Handbills) - $300.00
**Any additional money raised will go toward the production value of our play**

Your Impact With Your Donation:

As a local community theatre group, the biggest obstacle preventing local production companies from making any project is....money.  The average cost for any production company to be in the Fringe can cost anywhere from $1500 - $3000 depending on the nature of their production.  With your help we can put on a production that we are absolutely passionate about.  The money we are asking for is the bare minimum we require to get the play off the ground. 

Risks & Challenges:

This is our company's first crowd funding pitch.  Perhaps our biggest risk for our campaign is simply that we do not know many people as we are a new production group.  We just hope that our passion for this project comes through in our pitch and video.  We are not sure if this will work or if we will raise any money, but we are willing to give crowd funding a try and raise any kind of money for financial relief for our show.

We are in a fantastic venue this year and have great showtimes and we feel that we are in a great position to get a great audience turn out for all our shows.  With your help, we can put on the best show possible and give the audience the best Fringe theatre experience possible.

We would love for everyone who comes across this pitch to kindly spread the word about our campaign and give whatever they can and help a bunch of local actors give the city of Winnipeg a great show for the festival.

story:
Our Story

Since September 2015, our team--of all women-identifying theatermakers--has been working on a play called Di and Viv and Rose by British playwright Amelia Bullmore.  It's a new play, but the story spans decades, from 1983 to the present.

In their first year away from home at university, three women, from three distant corners of England, form an unlikely family under one roof. Life feels boundless and their shared flat on Mossbank Road is...cozy. Living is beautiful and intense. Rose comes from money. Di hasn't the funds for a doctor. Viv is saving herself--but for or from what, the other two wonder...Time catapults them forward, apart, back together, and into each other's laps, hearts, and truths by turns.

United by a love for these characters' transformative friendship, we rehearsed from October to December in 2015 and self-produced a staged reading in midtown Manhattan on December 18th.

We submitted a proposal including testimonials from our December 18th audience, and we received full permission and rights from the playwright, Amelia Bullmore to produce the official, U.S. premiere! When the play premiered in London, it was met with powerful and loving responses, and even transferred to The West End.  It's an honor beyond words to have Amelia's blessing to share her play with New York audiences!


So far, we have:

+ An amazing team assembled! 

+ The rights to produce!

+ Funding from our first investor, which covers the cost of rights!

+ Approved rental of our ideal, intimate, 55-seat theater, The Studio at Theatre Row, for a 3-week run, June 2nd-June 19th.  

+ Funding from a few generous donors, covering the rental of the theater! WOW!

With rights and venue approved and funded, our next step is to dive back into rehearsals and begin the design process in order to open our production on June 2nd, just before some New Yorkers de-camp for the summer.


We are asking for your support! With your donations, we will be able to:

+ Purchase scenic materials

+ Cover the construction and transportation of our set

+ Rent lighting instruments

+ Purchase costumes that suit the multiple decades of the play from thrift shops

+ Arrange marketing and publicity

+ Subsidize the high school outreach program (*details below)

+ Rent rehearsal space

+ Pay our wonderful creative team of artists and technicians!  

Any amount is appreciated and truly makes a difference! We'll joy to show how your donation is immediately transformed into creative energy and resources, be it a video clip of our dramaturg--whose fee will be made possible by your donation--sharing her latest discovery, or a photo of the used armchair you help us buy on Craigslist which becomes part of iconic Mossbank, the shared flat that the three characters fill with their history and hope when they move in together.  


Outreach!

The play explores a bevy of coming-of-age moments shared by many young women.  Our production has an outreach component: free matinees for high school students, and a conversation with the artists - curated by our dramaturg - thereafter, to foster a space in which these young people can talk about what they saw, how they relate to it, and freely ask questions.  Our dramaturg will also present contextualizing detail about the exclusionary whiteness of the most publicized women's movements in the early 80's, the scope of mainstream women's rights language at the time, and how privilege insulated homogenous groups.  Shining a light on the cultural history of Northern England, our dramaturg will open up a conversation about how the play implies but does not directly explore the women's consciousnesses of racial inequality, though the women do explicitly explore issues of class, sexual identity, reproductive rights, and privilege.

 

Thank you!

We'd love to welcome you into this growing family of creators and supporters, uniting to share this story about how our friends grow our hearts, minds, and lives.

"You grow up together in the sense that if something bad or sad or good happens to one of you, it almost happens to the other." (Di)

Thank you for your time and care.  See you at Mossbank (Theatre Row, NYC) in June!


Love,

Di (Olivia), and Viv (Raven), and Rose (Leslie), and team!


CREATIVE TEAM:

Director: Leta Tremblay

Producer: Allison Ciuci

Acting Coach: Misha Calvert

Dialect Coach: Amanda Quaid

Scenic Design: Reilly Horan

Costume Design: Alice Wang

Lighting Design: Reilly Horan

Videographer: Dafna Gottesman

Master Carpenter: Reilly Horan


photos from reading: Taylor Freeman

story:
Summary

Hi! My name is Doug Motel. I am an actor, writer & songwriter. 

Some of my solo plays include: MICK IN AMERICA, MIND SALAD (L.A. Weekly Award nomination for writing and performing) and SHIVA ARMS (winner L.A. Weekly Award for writing and performing and winner Theatre LA Ovation Award for Best Writing of a World Premier play). My show PRAESTIGUM features the stories of Judas, Benedict Arnold and James Wormley Jones (the first African-American undercover agent for the FBI.)


I have been working on a new show called THIS IS THE SHOW, and I am about to do a more developed workshop at the 13th Street Rep Co. But I need to raise more money to pay the terrific team I have assembled.

THIS IS THE SHOW is the story of my (sometimes rocky) journey in show business and about I came to stop living as if my life were the dress rehearsal for the real life that was waiting “just around the corner”.

Your donation will make it possible to put this show on and help to promote it.

What I Need & What You Get

I need to raise $3,500. I will use the money for the following:

  • Theater Rental 
  • Light & Sound Operator
  • Piano and Bass players & Drummer
  • Music charts
  • Transportation back and forth to NYC
  • Videography 
  • Mailing
  • Insurance policy required by theater
  • Scenery and props
  • Ads and program printing 

PERKS

The various perks range from a personalized thank you on my Youtube channel all the way to a special command performance at your home! 

If I don’t meet my goal, I will put on SOME version of the show but alas not the one that I am envisioning.

Our Impact Together

In a time when leading politicians are still promoting the old macho “fame or shame” and you are a “winner or a loser” credos in our culture, I feel we need to create stories that challenge those notions. I offer that maybe, just maybe real happiness has about as much to do with showing off your shiny things as baseball has to nail polish. 

We have come to worship so many empty icons that it is time we get together in a darkened theater and remember that no one on their deathbed ever said: “I wish I had spent more time getting more people to feel envious of me.”

THIS IS THE SHOW is my attempt to contribute something to THAT conversation, but I do need your help in getting it out there.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, you might be strapped right now and not able to donate at the $10 level, but I could SURE use your help in spreading the word. The Shows are Weds Nights: April 6, 13th and 20th. If you know folks near NYC, please forward this with the Indiegogo share buttons?

If you do complete a transaction, Indiegogo will give you the option to send a message to your friends and followers on Facebook and Twitter. 

This message will inform your friends that you just backed “THIS IS THE SHOW” and will include a link to our campaign page (you'll be able to edit the text). Please send these messages! It only takes a second and it'll be a huge help! 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!***

story:
Earlier this year, I was asked to audition for a TV pilot as a bad TV Magician and I invented the Psychic Hill Billy. Penn Jillette challenged me saying "if you're going to do it, learn an actual goddamn trick". He gave me a trick to do and I am so thankful he did. I really enjoyed playing the character and I found performing magic to be thrilling.

Being a writer for Penn & Teller: Fool Us for the last 3 seasons, I have been given an unfair vantage point to the world's best magicians. I have approached some of them, Johnny Thompson, Penn & Teller and more. I  asked them to "teach me one trick"... and they did.

On September 10th, the show I currently stage manage comes to a close. I have a new job lined up but it doesn't start until January. With your help and generosity, I can dedicate these next few months to rehearsing obsessively, writing a one man comedy magic show, and launching a fully realized weekend long production with props, set, and crew at a theater in Las Vegas. Plus, the performances will be shot, recorded and edited by one of the best production companies in Las Vegas.

You in?

story:
What's the Project?

"Scar Tissue" is a new play still in the development stages. We've had a staged reading in July 2017, and we are now focussed on developing the play further by way of rehearsals with a creative and a cast of actors over the next 4 weeks. This will culminate in a one night only performance. This performance is our chance to take the project to the next level, to invite many theatre professionals who may want to pick up the play for a full run.

Why now?

"Scar Tissue" has already had a profound effect on those who have read it or seen the staged reading in July. So many people have told us "That's happened to me." "That's happened to my friend." "That's happened to my sister." "That's happened to my daughter." Then the #MeToo movement happened. With so many women coming forward and sharing their experiences, we too, want to share our voice and continue this integral conversation.

Synopsis

Time does not heal all wounds. Best friends Jessica and Sam each have scars from their pasts that have never quite healed. Jessica has never been able to get passed an extremely damaging romantic relationship from her formative years in college, while Sam has been ignoring a painfully fractured relationship with her sister. After years of denial, they are both forced to confront these wounds head on. The only way they can begin to heal is to face what they didn't want to see - and they cannot do that without each other.

Who We Are

We're an all-female creative team!

Victoria Fragnito, Playwright/Producer:  Victoria is an actor/director turned playwright based out of NYC. When she moved to the city to pursue her acting career, she began looking for roles she could use in a footage reel. That proved much more difficult than she thought, as creative, complex, and interesting roles for women were few and far between. She decided to create her own. She began writing a scene that would eventually turn into the full length "Scar Tissue".

Francesca Di Cesare, Director/Producer: Francesca has been directing in NYC for 5 years. Originally from the U.K. she's passionate about new works, and in particular this project. Francesca directed the staged reading of "Scar Tissue" in July, and her partnership with Victoria developed along with the play! She believes completely in the power and strength of women, and wants to highlight that within this piece.

Kristin Ciccone Gole, Dramaturg: Kristin is a storyteller at heart. She's been writing and performing in Philadelphia and New York City since 2008. She has worked as a developmental editor since 2010, helping writers find their voice during the revision process. She holds a BA with Honors in Theatre from Drew University and a Masters in Journalism from Columbia. She is currently a digital content editor and producer at Spotify. She is excited to bring this important story to life.

What We Need

New plays take time to form. We need your support in order to develop the script and the characters further with a team of artists. We are asking for $3,000 to help us fund this development process, culminating in a one night only performance. Here are the specifics of where your donation will be going:

  • Rehearsal Space- I'm not sure you've heard, but New York City can be pricey. Rehearsal space will cost us an average of $20/hour, and that is on the low side of things! At 4 hours of rehearsal, 4 times a week, it begins to add up FAST!
  • Pay Our People- It is extremely important to us that we pay the wonderful creative artists that have dedicated their time and talent to make this the best possible representation of Scar Tissue. We value them as artists and we want to show them that we value them. 
  • Marketing- We need to get the word out! We want anyone and everyone to hear this story. To do that we need certain marketing materials; postcards, posters, paid ads on social media etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no worries! You can still help us spread the word. Share our campaign on: Facebook, Instagram, twitter. Email your friends, family, co-workers. This is a play that shares OUR voice, and to do that, we need YOUR voices.

Thank you all for your love and support!

#MeToo

What's the Project?

This performance is our chance to take the project to the next level, to invite many theatre professionals who may want to pick up the play for a full run.
Why now?
"Scar Tissue" has already had a profound effect on those who have read it or seen the staged reading in July. So many people have told us "That's happened to me." "That's happened to my friend." "That's happened to my sister." "That's happened to my daughter." Then the #MeToo movement happened. With so many women coming forward and sharing their experiences, we too, want to share our voice and continue this integral conversation.
Synopsis
Time does not heal all wounds. Best friends Jessica and Sam each have scars from their pasts that have never quite healed. Jessica has never been able to get passed an extremely damaging romantic relationship from her formative years in college, while Sam has been ignoring a painfully fractured relationship with her sister. After years of denial, they are both forced to confront these wounds head on. The only way they can begin to heal is to face what they didn't want to see - and they cannot do that without each other.
Who We Are
We're an all-female creative team!
Victoria Fragnito, Playwright/Producer:  Victoria is an actor/director turned playwright based out of NYC. When she moved to the city to pursue her acting career, she began looking for roles she could use in a footage reel. That proved much more difficult than she thought, as creative, complex, and interesting roles for women were few and far between. She decided to create her own. She began writing a scene that would eventually turn into the full length "Scar Tissue".
Francesca Di Cesare, Director/Producer: Francesca has been directing in NYC for 5 years. Originally from the U.K. she's passionate about new works, and in particular this project. Francesca directed the staged reading of "Scar Tissue" in July, and her partnership with Victoria developed along with the play! She believes completely in the power and strength of women, and wants to highlight that within this piece.
Kristin Ciccone Gole, Dramaturg: Kristin is a storyteller at heart. She's been writing and performing in Philadelphia and New York City since 2008. She has worked as a developmental editor since 2010, helping writers find their voice during the revision process. She holds a BA with Honors in Theatre from Drew University and a Masters in Journalism from Columbia. She is currently a digital content editor and producer at Spotify. She is excited to bring this important story to life.

What We Need
New plays take time to form. We need your support in order to develop the script and the characters further with a team of artists. We are asking for $3,000 to help us fund this development process, culminating in a one night only performance. Here are the specifics of where your donation will be going:


Rehearsal Space- I'm not sure you've heard, but New York City can be pricey. Rehearsal space will cost us an average of $20/hour, and that is on the low side of things! At 4 hours of rehearsal, 4 times a week, it begins to add up FAST!

Pay Our People- It is extremely important to us that we pay the wonderful creative artists that have dedicated their time and talent to make this the best possible representation of Scar Tissue. We value them as artists and we want to show them that we value them. 

Marketing- We need to get the word out! We want anyone and everyone to hear this story. To do that we need certain marketing materials; postcards, posters, paid ads on social media etc.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, no worries! You can still help us spread the word. Share our campaign on: Facebook, Instagram, twitter. Email your friends, family, co-workers. This is a play that shares OUR voice, and to do that, we need YOUR voices.
Thank you all for your love and support!
#MeToo

story:
El Teatro Campesino

Founded in 1965 by American playwright Luis Valdez as a means of organizing the nation’s agricultural workers through art and culture, El Teatro Campesino - literally “the Farm Workers’ theater” - has been at the forefront of using theater as an artistic generator of social change for five decades. ETC’s seminal work has impacted and influenced several artists and cultural institutions in developing an acting technique, aesthetic, and narrative of Latinos’ pursuit of social justice in the United States and internationally. From flat bed trucks to the Broadway stage, this multigenerational company has worked to empower Chicano/Latino artists and communities from its home in San Juan Bautista, California since 1971.

 

 

¡Viva La Causa! - A Retrospective

“Viva La Causa”(Long Live the Cause) invites audiences to explore the museum halls of the ETC Playhouse in San Juan Bautista as rooms and retrospective exhibits come to life with live and site-specific performances. Audiences travel from room to room as historical memorabilia from our museum halls summon classic teatro works that highlight the cultural, political and social struggles of the past in order to rekindle the fight for la causa.

 

PERFORMANCE SCHEDULE:

Sept 1st - 24th, 2017, Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8pm,

and Saturdays and Sunday’s at 2pm.

LOCATION:

El Teatro Campesino,705 Fourth Street, San Juan Bautista CA, 95045

TICKETS:

$20 General Admission  $17 Students/Seniors $15  Children 12 years and under. (Audience capacity  @ 60 people per show) 

 

WHY YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS: 

Donating ensures the successful re-launch of this unique production, as it fights for the preservation of ETC's 50 year history and the lasting vitality of arts and culture for future generations.

 

WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

  1. Curating specialized exhibits and museum halls that create this unique experience. 
  2. Amplifying the technical aspects of the production including; lights, sound, and projection design.
  3. Supporting the next generation of Teatistas at El Teatro Campesino!

 

WHAT ARE THE PERKS OF GIVING?

Besides backing a great Causa?! How about a special Viva La Causa Poster, Shout outs on Facebook (so you can brag to all your amigas, amigos and familia), or an "Early works by Luis Valdez" book signed by El Maestro himself. ¿Mas? Give a little more and get Priority or VIP seating to the show, your name printed in our programs, VIP dinner for two...or maybe four, with our directors of the show!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now? That's ok! Here are some other ways you can get involved:

  • Share this campaign with others! Help us spread the word and get others interested. 
  • Follow us on Facebook and keep watch for future productions, events and opportunities to get involved. (http://www.facebook.com/elteatrocampesino/)
  • Attend our Fundraiser on July 27th in San Juan Baustista @ Jardines De San Juan from 5-8pm.  (http://www.jardinesrestaurant.com/)
