*PLEASE NOTE that all donations are in USD (US Dollars).                                                           *SVP NOTEZ que tous les montants des dons sont en USD (dollar américain)DANSE À LA CARTEPlease support us in our mission to create and sustain consistent quality drop in classes and coaching in Ballet & Contemporary dance for the Montreal dance community. Danse à la Carte will be providing these classes in order to support the continued pursuit of professional and educational development and excellence in the Montreal dance community.Faites un don et soutenez notre mission! Danse à la carte est un organisme à but non-lucratif qui offre des classes de ballet et de contemporain de qualité à la communauté de la danse montréalaise. Ces classes sont données de façon régulière dans le but de soutenir la poursuite du développement professionnel et éducatif de l’excellence en danse.(version française un peu plus bas)Mission statementOver the past few years I have had the great pleasure of being able to work with many wonderful artists from a plethora of Montreal dance companies. Teaching regular drop in ballet classes in the city has made me a witness to the benefits and effects of providing these dancers with a neutral environment that is void of company politics and pressures. Current, future and retired Ballet dancers, Contemporary dancers and Modern dancers and teachers all taking a Ballet class or Contemporary workshop together, inspiring each other, supporting each other, networking, training and exploring new things together. Everyone is there because they want to take a quality class, to learn something new and to train hard in their chosen craft or passion. The dancers from this Montreal dance community deserve to have this space available to them when they need it. It is an invaluable tool in their training when classes are not provided for them, they are in between contracts, looking for employment, coming back from an injury or simply feeling defeated in their present employment.It is my priority when I am teaching and in charge of a project that I provide an energetic enviroment based on support, respect, encouragment and space for self expression and exploration. I am very demanding as a teacher but I push people in a positive and productive way and my return is that I get to see people flourish. I want the montreal dance community to have a place where everyone is free to network, connect with other artists, refuel, grow, develop and hopefully find new inspiration.In the classes and workshops presented to the community over the past 6 months I have had dancers from 
La La La Human StepsNederlands Danse TheaterLa Compagnie Marie ChouinardRubberbandance GroupBJM DanseFlakEzdanza Virginie Brunelle Danse ContemporaineCas Public

Het national BalletLe Royal Winnipeg BalletAtlantique Ballet Théâtre du CanadaL’École Supérieure de Ballet du QuébecBallet Métropolitain de MontréalBallet Ouest de MontréalLes Grands Ballets Canadiens de Montréal
I am committed to facilitating access to quality professional level classes for the dancers of Montreal and I hope that you may join and support me in this new venture. Given the very sudden and imminent closure of Ballet Professionnel Montreal (classes ending February 28th) I ask for your help  in creating a start up fund for this project so that I can continue to offer a minimum of 3 ballet classes per week which will be taught by experienced teachers who have a deep understanding of both classical and contemporary dance. Also in the plans are to offer 1 contemporary class per week as well as a professional level workshops exploring repertoire and methods of choreographers such as Nacho Duato, Victor Quijada, Barak Marshall, Andrew Skeels and hopefully Crystal Pite, Peter Chu and others.I have a goal of raising $2500 to cover a portion of the costs of the first month of classes & workshops (teachers fees,studio rentals, ballet barres, supplies and administration fees) after which point the organization should be able to find it's footing and continue forward based on its own revenue. During this time myself and my team will be looking into registering as an official not for profit organization which will become the vessel for offering this opportunity for the continued professional development for all artists of the Montreal dance community. The city has become a mecca for dance not only in North America but well beyond yet we do not have 'infrastructure' to support it with consistency. I hope to be able to be able to create and sustain a space which is worthy of our hard won reputation.In my view having access to proper training options is imperative for a healthy and successful career. Given the typically low salaries of dance artists keeping the cost of attending the classes is a priority and it is my goal to keep the price for training classes between $10 and $15 as well as the workshops between $20 and $40.Sincerely,Lisa Davies et l'équipe de Danse à la Carte, Veronique Giasson & Robin Mathes(version française)Mission de l'organismeAu cours des dernières années, j'ai eu l'immense privilège de travailler avec de merveilleux artistes venant de diverses compagnies de danse montréalaises. Enseigner des classes de ballet ici sous une base régulière m'a permis de constater à quel point il est bénéfique pour un danseur de s'entraîner dans un environnement neutre, sans compétition ni politique de compagnie. 

Qu'ils soient danseurs classiques et contemporains, danseurs de la relève, danseurs retraités ou encore enseignants, tous peuvent bénéficier de classes quotidiennes et d'ateliers de danse contemporaine. En s'entraînant ensemble, ils peuvent s'inspirer de l'un et de l'autre, se soutenir, agrandir leur réseautage et approfondir leur technique dans un climat professionnel de haut niveau.

Un entraînement quotidien et rigoureux est essentiel pour les danseurs pigistes, car ceux-ci se retrouvent souvent dans des situations nécessitant l'existence de classes d'entraînement régulières: intervalles entre deux contrats, recherche d'emploi, retour au travail suite à une blessure, etc. Ces danseurs méritent de disposer d'un espace lorsqu'ils en ont besoin.

En tant que responsable du projet «Danse à la carte», ma priorité est de fournir un environnement énergique basé sur le soutien, le respect et l'encouragement, dans un espace où l'expression de soi et l'exploration sont mises de l'avant. 

Au cours des six derniers mois, j'ai enseigné des classes à de nombreux artistes pigistes, en plus de danseurs venant de diverses compagnies et écoles:

- La la la human steps
- Netherlands Dance Theater
- Compagnie Marie Chouinard
- RUBBERBANDance Group
- BJM danse
- Flak
- ezdanza- Cas Public
- Virginie Brunelle danse
- Het national Ballet
- Royal Winnipeg Ballet
- Ballet-théâtre atlantique du Canada
- L'École supérieure de ballet du Québec
- Ballet métropolitain de Montréal
- Ballet Ouest 
- Les Grands ballets canadiens de Montréal

Pour l'instant, les cours offerts par «Danse à la carte» seront donnés dans des studios situés à proximité du centre-ville ou du Plateau Mont-Royal. 

Dans un futur rapproché, j'espère offrir une classe de danse contemporaine par semaine ainsi que des ateliers qui permettront d'explorer le répertoire et les méthodes de chorégraphes renommés tels que Nacho Duato, Victor Quijada et Barak Marshall. J'aimerais également pouvoir inviter Andrew Skeels, Crystal Pite et Peter Chu et plusieurs autres artistes que je respecte grandement.  

Je m'engage aujourd'hui à faciliter l'accès aux cours professionnels à Montréal et j'ose espérer que vous puissiez m'appuyer et me soutenir dans cette nouvelle aventure. Compte tenu de la fermeture imminente de Ballet Professionnel Montréal (classes se terminant le 28 février prochain), j'aimerais en quelque sorte prendre la relève et continuer d'offrir des classes d'entraînement sous une base régulière.

Maintenir l'accès à des classes adaptées aux besoins de la communauté professionnelle de la danse est une action indispensable à la réussite du milieu. En raison des faibles revenus de la plupart des danseurs, je tenterai de maintenir le coût d'une classe entre 10$ et 15$ et le coût d'un atelier entre 20$ et 40$. 

Je me tourne donc vers vous pour amasser les 2 500$ qui sont nécessaires pour démarrer le projet. Cet argent permettra de couvrir les frais du premier mois, soit le mois de mars. Je pourrai ainsi continuer à offrir un minimum de trois classes de ballet par semaine. L'organisation devrait ensuite pouvoir être autonome financièrement.

Nature des dépenses:

- salaire des enseignants
- location des studios
- barres de ballet
- autres fournitures 

Mon équipe et moi entreprenons déjà toutes les démarches afin d'enregistrer «Danse à la carte» comme organisme à but non-lucratif. Montréal est aujourd'hui un lieu important pour la danse en Amérique du Nord et partout à travers le monde. C'est pourquoi il est de notre devoir de continuer à nourrir le milieu. 

Nous n'avons pas encore nos propres studios, mais nous comptons être en mesure de créer et de maintenir un espace digne de notre réputation et de notre travail acharné.

Je vous remercie à l'avance de l'attention que vous porterez à mon projet.

Au plaisir de vous voir bientôt,

Lisa Davies et l'équipe de Danse à la Carte, Véronique Giasson et Robin Mathes

story:
The image above is early concept art by Matt Gardner.  Would YOU like to be a character in the show?  For a generous donation of $1,000, you WILL be!  We'll use your likeness to create an alien seen in a crucial scene in the play!                  

                                      About the show

 Jim and Dave (‘s Blood Meets Jupiter) is a Musical Outer Space Buddy Comedy of Intergalactic Proportions. 

Jim and Dave are a couple of longtime beerdrinking buddies who spend their evenings hanging out and watching football at a local bar. They are abducted by bumbling aliens and whisked through the far reaches of space, encountering several species of aliens; some are hostile, some are groovy, and some are truly bizarre. Finally, the two friends must make a decision of on behalf of all humanity. 

Audiences will enjoy the fastpaced comedy, the upbeat music, and all of the cosmic visual effects that go along with a show that is set in outer space. 

                                      About the Production

Jim and Dave (’s Blood Meets Jupiter) is being produced independently by authors Steve Clark, Kalena Victoria Dickerson, and Ed Plough in collaboration with Project 891 Theatre Company. With optimism, we ask for your financial support for the Intergalactic Premiere of this exciting new musical. 

This team has been writing musicals together for eight years. Michael Rashid of Project 891, an actor and director who has been working with Chicago theaters for more than 10 years, will be directing the show. 

Your donation will help Jim and Dave (‘s Blood Meets Jupiter): 

• Rent a rehearsal space and theatre to develop this unique new work 

• Hire a Music Director and fourpiece band 

• Employ a cast of twelve amazing performers, as well as cosmically brilliant designers to bring whole new alien worlds and characters to life

• Pay for material costs involved with marketing and promotion 

• Create cosmic set pieces for spaceships, Earth, and alien planets 

• Develop lighting worthy of space chases and a discofunk party planet 

• Build costumes and puppets for the eclectic sci-fi cast of characters 

This production, opening June 15, will add a fresh, original voice to the Chicago musical theater scene 

...and you can be a part of it.


                                      From the Authors: 

We believe that comedy is an important means of uplifting people’s spirits and bringing communities together, and through this play, we seek to demonstrate the value of friendship and collaboration through humor. 

By partially funding the Intergalactic Premiere of Jim and Dave (’s Blood Meets Jupiter), you will assist with the creative leap of placing our words and music in front of an audience and help us complete an important step on our artistic journey. 

Thank you for your support! 

 Steve Clark, Kalena Victoria Dickerson, and Ed Plough

story:
The (re)Birth of BIRTHDAY SAX

You may remember us from ANT Fest back in 2012. Well you are in luck....we are coming back to Ars Nova on May 1st, 2nd, and 3rd at 8pm!

And if you don't know us, let me introduce you to Manheim. He is a small-town German performer who longs for the city and wants nothing more than to bring his gift to the world! His gift is that of singing classic 1980's soundtrack songs with his 3 back up Fräuleins and the Garden State Saxophone Quartet (of course)! 

Oh and it's his birthday.

And now we're back at Ars Nova and better than ever. With new songs, exclusive video footage of Manheim's success in Germany, and a few special guests. This birthday bash is sure to be the best one yet!

The Impact

After our successful stint at ANT Fest in May 2012, we have been invited back (everyone loves Manheim) for a weekend of shows May 1 - 3 at Ars Nova. Manheim can't wait to share what he's been up to this past year and bring more music and love! We invite you to jump on board this train and help us make Manheim's dreams come true!

What We Need

Although we had a previous show, we're pulling out all the stops for this production and we need your help! Between rehearsing all of Manheim's new material, creating some fantastic video footage for the production, and paying our cast and crew, the costs sure add up. Every little bit counts though and we really appreciate your help! 

Bonus, our tickets are only $15 (what a deal!!). So think about what you would pay to see your favorite little wiener schnitzel perform in the flesh and make a contribution. Manheim and his Fräuleins say "danke schoen!"

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution will help.  If you can't give $50, give $25.  If you can't give $25, give $10. If you can't contribute, please send this link to a friend who might be able to.  Every little bit will add up and help us greatly.  And whatever you do, don't forget to buy your ticket at Ars Nova for May 1st - 3rd! https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pr/933511

Our Fantastic Team

Our writer and lovable Manheim: Tim Girrbach

Our sassy Fräuleins: Nancy Renee Braun, Anna Marquardt, Annie Petersmeyer & Jen Tullock

The Garden State Saxophone Quartet

And a few special guests....!

Costume Design: Court Watson

Lighting Design: Joel Silver

Director & (Fabulous) Choreographer: Wendy Seyb

Producer: Katharine Sullivan

BIOS:


Tim Girrbach (Writer/Manheim) is an actor, writer, and one half of music comedy duo Squirm and Germ (ANT Fest, UCBeast, The PIT, Joe's Pub, The Apollo, Charleston Comedy Festival). With Squirm and Germ, Tim has been nominated for INNY and ECNY Comedy Awards and their videos have been featured on CollegeHumor.com, The UK's NME Online Music Magazine, Humor Blogs: FunnyNotSlutty, Strollerderby, The Apiary, and a Neti Pot manufacturer's website. He has been seen in numerous commercial projects for Time Warner, UPS, Wendy's, Tide, The National Drug Campaign, and Guinness. Theatrical credits include Doppio, Word Word Word (Ars Nova), Oliver (Papermill Playhouse) and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat (Broadway). www.timgirrbach.com

Wendy Seyb (Director/Choreographer) The Pee Wee Herman Show (Broadway/HBO - Choreographer), Click, Clack, Moo (Off-Broadway - Choreographer; Lortel nomination), The Toxic Avenger Musical (Off-Broadway - Choreographer; Lortel, Dora, Callaway nomination), Murder For Two (Off-Broadway - Choreographer), How You Look At It (The Sacramento Ballet - Director/Choreographer), cirque-style show Onirique (Director/Choreographer - Big E Award). Shows with Disney, Cartoon Network, Richard Frankel Productions, Nickelodeon, and SeaWorld. Her Narrative Dance Comedies have won a Golden Nose Award, been seen in short film form, spec commercials, and music videos, and at esteemed NYC venues including Dance Theater Workshop, Joyce SoHo, and Baryshnikov Arts Center. www.wendyseyb.com

Katharine Beckett Sullivan (Producer). Katharine most recently co-produced the hugely successful new, immersive musical The Orion Experience. She produced the New York premiere of Vassily Sigarev's award-winning Black Milk at the East 13th Street Theatre. She produced the original version of Birthday Sax at Ars Nova, as well as served as co-producer for Purple Rep’s inaugural season. Prior to breaking free as an independent theatre producer, Katharine worked for formalist director/designer Robert Wilson and his Watermill Foundation. She has worked with costume designer Gregg Barnes on The Drowsy Chaperone on Broadway, Mame (Kennedy Center) and Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (National Tour), among others. She is the founder of the Emerging Artists Theatre Co. as well as the Indigent College Unit, for which she has directed and produced multiple shows. She is a graduate of NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts with a degree focused on directing and design and holds an MFA in Theatre Management and Producing from Columbia University.

story:
Teatro Libre, Inc.

y ¡A la porra!, Inc.

presentan

 

55to Festival de Teatro Puertorriqueño del Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña

 

Secretos prohibidos de Tere Marichal Lugo

Teatro Victoria Espinosa


16, 17, 18, 23, 24, y 25 de mayo de 2013

Boletos: (787) 662-6947

 


Secretos prohibidos

La obra

 

 Secretos Prohibidos es una obra de teatro basada en la comedia del arte, sus máscaras y argumentos. Tere Marichal Lugo presenta una historia en tres actos en la que el hilo conductor es el amor, la avaricia y los secretos que cada personaje inventa para lograr sus objetivos. El espectáculo da inicio cuando una compañía de actores llega a una plaza y anuncia la representación.

EPantalone quiere casar a su hija Rosaura con Il Dottore porque está en bancarrota, lo cual es falso. Il Dottore, que sí lo está, aunque lo disimule, quiere casar a su hija Angélica con el Señor Pantalone. Las hijas logran liberarse de su destino con la ayuda de sus sirvientes, que no dejan de enredar y desenredarlo todo. Finalmente, triunfa el amor y se hace justicia. Las mujeres ven coronados sus sueños de que se  respete su dignidad y los sirvientes, su panza y los viejos pagan sus faltas.

Secretos prohibidos expresa con gracia y picardía, situaciones muy divertidas que presentan diversas crítica sociales como la crisis económica y el hambre.

 

En Puerto Rico, pocas veces se ha presentado este género. Para nosotros es importante hacerlo y darle continuidad. La meta de ¡A la porra! es presentar este trabajo en espacios alternos (abiertos y cerrados) alrededor de la Isla y fuera de ésta. Además, crear un taller de actores-creadores.

 

Sobre la compañía ¡A la porra!

En 2012, Rosabel Otón y Maritza Martínez, fundaron ¡A la porra!, con la intención de entrenar a un grupo de estudiantes y profesionales en las técnicas de la comedia del arte italiana. Desde el 2007, Otón, directora artística de ¡A la porra!, ofrece  un curso de un año de commedia dell’arte en el Departamento de Drama de la Universidad de Puerto Rico (UPR), Recinto de Río Piedras. En el 2009 dirigió su primera producción en este estilo,  Arlequín, vendedor de palizas. La obra, basada en un texto para teatro de títeres inglés del siglo XIX, contó con la colaboración de las reconocidas artistas y maestras Gilda Navarra y Nana Hudo.

El siguiente montaje fue  La muerta viva (2010), basada en un argumento del Teatro de las Fábulas Representadas de Flaminio Scala (1611). La obra, que se estrenó en el Recinto de Río Piedras de la UPR, viajó hasta los pueblos de Cayey y Guayama, y se presentó en el Teatro Ramón Frade y en el Teatro Calimano, respectivamente. En el 2011, la reposición de la obra se llevó a cabo en el Teatro Experimental Julia de Burgos del Departamento de Drama de la UPR.  Con La muerta viva dio inicio el trabajo colaborativo entre Rosabel Otón y Maritza Martínez quien, además de educadora y coreógrafa, fue miembro del desaparecido Taller de Histriones.

En el  2012, tocó el turno a Los cómicos del arte, una serie de canovacci (argumentos breves)  del siglo XVI, en el Teatrito Experimental de la UPR de Río Piedras y luego en el Teatro de la Universidad Interamericana, Recinto de Bayamón. En 2013 dirigió el primer acto de  Isabella afortunada, de Flaminio Scala, como parte del programa de un maratón artístico, organizado por la profesora y coreógrafa Petra Bravo, directora de la compañía de danza contemporánea, Hincapié.

Los talleres pedagógicos de ¡A la porra! dieron inicio en septiembre  2011, bajo la dirección de Rosabel Otón y Maritza Martínez. Desde entonces, un grupo de actores profesionales en unión a una selección de  estudiantes entrenados en commedia dell’arte, ha desarrollado un pequeño e intenso laboratorio de investigación teatral, basado en el arte de la improvisación y en los argumentos y las  máscaras de la commedia dell’arte. Entre los artistas colaboradores se encuentran: Julio Ramos, Ramfis González e Iliana García. Secretos prohibidos es el segundo texto escrito por Tere Marichal, inspirado en la commedia dell’arte. ¡A la porra!, una compañía teatral que nace del trabajo de un grupo de actores profesionales y estudiantes, asume el reto de montarla y agradece la confianza de la autora y de todos los artistas que se han unido al proyecto.  

 

Otras obras dirigidas por Rosabel Otón, directora de Secretos prohibidos

2007-presente Taller de Teatro Esmeralda, Universidad  Interamericana Recinto de Bayamón

Ø  Uno, dos, tres de Myrna Casas

Ø  Historias para ser contadas de Osvaldo Dragún

Ø  Tres Reinas de Oriente de Rosabel Otón

Ø  La venta del bacalao rebelde de Lydia Milagros González

Ø  Antígona de Bertolt Brecht

Ø  El retablo de Maese Sancho de José Luis Ramos Escobar

Ø  El juicio a Hostos de María Butter

1999 – 2002 Tres Reinas de Oriente –Producción de Teatro Taller La Camándula

1995 – 2002 Cuentos con invento de los cuentacuentos – Producción de Teatro Taller La Camándula

 

 

Forbidden Secrets is the first play done by the theatre company: A la Porra! Inspired by Italian Commedia dell' arte, their masks and arguments, however, it will be developed in the Caribbean. 

The Story begins at a harbor in San Juan at which arrives a company of actors who have travelled around all America presenting their show. Forbidden Secrets addresses topics such as feminism and economical crisis, all of them in a humorous way. Forbidden Secrets is a pretext to carry on Commedia dell' arte to every corner of Puerto Rico, and also train actors and develop a theatrical work that will last. The Cast consists of a group of experienced actors along with a new generation of actors.

Ramfis González

Julio Ramos

Geraldo Ortíz

Iliana García

Glenn Zayas

Evelyn Rosario

Leslie Van Zandt

Joe-alis Filipetti

Yaiza Figueroa

Jonathan Amaro

Thaís María

Juan "Rosko" Jaime

The author is Tere Marichal-Lugo, who is a recognized playwright, story writer and Puerto Rican educator, who has been awarded national and internationally. The Costume design will be handled by Vilma Martínez, who has more than 30 years of experience working in theatre, film and T.V. The set design belongs to Master José "Checo" Cuevas, who for over 38 years has been one of the most recognized set designers in Puerto Rico.

Forbidden Secrets is part of the 55th Puerto Rican Theatre Festival held by the Institute of Puerto Rican Culture. It is the play that ends the festival. We feel honored for being able to count on a team with this level of experience and professionalism.

In order to complete all production expenses we need you to help us... that's why we are here.
story_txt:
Teatro Libre,
Inc.
y ¡A la porra!,
Inc.
presentan 
 
55to
Festival de Teatro Puertorriqueño del Instituto de Cultura Puertorriqueña
 
Secretos
prohibidos de Tere Marichal Lugo
Teatro
Victoria Espinosa
16, 17, 18,
23, 24, y 25 de mayo de 2013
Boletos: (787)
662-6947 
Secretos
prohibidos
La
obra
  Secretos Prohibidos es una obra de teatro basada en la
comedia del arte, sus máscaras y argumentos. Tere Marichal Lugo presenta una
historia en tres actos en la que el hilo conductor es el amor, la avaricia y
los secretos que cada personaje inventa para lograr sus objetivos. El espectáculo da inicio cuando una compañía de
actores llega a una plaza y anuncia la representación.
EPantalone
quiere casar a su hija Rosaura con Il
Dottore porque está en bancarrota, lo cual es falso. Il Dottore, que sí lo está, aunque lo disimule, quiere casar a su
hija Angélica con el Señor Pantalone.
Las hijas logran liberarse de su destino con la ayuda de sus sirvientes, que no
dejan de enredar y desenredarlo todo. Finalmente, triunfa el amor y se hace
justicia. Las mujeres ven coronados sus sueños de que se  respete su dignidad y los sirvientes,
su panza y los viejos pagan sus faltas.
Secretos prohibidos expresa con gracia y picardía,
situaciones muy divertidas que presentan diversas crítica sociales como la crisis
económica y el hambre.
 
En Puerto Rico, pocas
veces se ha presentado este género. Para nosotros es importante hacerlo y darle
continuidad. La meta de ¡A la porra! es presentar este trabajo en espacios
alternos (abiertos y cerrados) alrededor de la Isla y fuera de ésta. Además,
crear un taller de actores-creadores.
 
Sobre
la compañía ¡A la porra!
En
2012, Rosabel Otón y Maritza Martínez, fundaron ¡A la porra!, con la intención
de entrenar a un grupo de estudiantes y profesionales en las técnicas de la
comedia del arte italiana. Desde el 2007, Otón, directora artística de ¡A
la porra!, ofrece  un curso de
un año de commedia dell’arte en el
Departamento de Drama de la Universidad de Puerto Rico (UPR), Recinto de Río
Piedras. En el 2009 dirigió su primera producción en este estilo,  Arlequín,
vendedor de palizas. La obra, basada en un texto para teatro de títeres
inglés del siglo XIX, contó con la colaboración de las reconocidas artistas y maestras
Gilda Navarra y Nana Hudo. 
El
siguiente montaje fue  La muerta viva (2010), basada en un
argumento del Teatro de las Fábulas Representadas de Flaminio Scala (1611). La
obra, que se estrenó en el Recinto de Río Piedras de la UPR, viajó hasta los
pueblos de Cayey y Guayama, y se presentó en el Teatro Ramón Frade y en el
Teatro Calimano, respectivamente. En el 2011, la reposición de la obra se llevó
a cabo en el Teatro Experimental Julia de Burgos del Departamento de Drama de
la UPR.  Con La muerta viva dio inicio el trabajo colaborativo entre Rosabel
Otón y Maritza Martínez quien, además de educadora y coreógrafa, fue miembro
del desaparecido Taller de Histriones. 
En
el  2012, tocó el turno a Los cómicos del arte, una serie de canovacci (argumentos breves)  del siglo XVI, en el Teatrito
Experimental de la UPR de Río Piedras y luego en el Teatro de la Universidad
Interamericana, Recinto de Bayamón. En 2013 dirigió el primer acto de  Isabella
afortunada, de Flaminio Scala, como parte del programa de un maratón
artístico, organizado por la profesora y coreógrafa Petra Bravo, directora de
la compañía de danza contemporánea, Hincapié.
Los
talleres pedagógicos de ¡A la porra!
dieron inicio en septiembre  2011,
bajo la dirección de Rosabel Otón y Maritza Martínez. Desde entonces, un grupo
de actores profesionales en unión a una selección de  estudiantes entrenados en commedia dell’arte, ha desarrollado un pequeño e intenso
laboratorio de investigación teatral, basado en el arte de la improvisación y
en los argumentos y las  máscaras
de la commedia dell’arte. Entre los
artistas colaboradores se encuentran: Julio Ramos, Ramfis González e Iliana
García. Secretos prohibidos es el
segundo texto escrito por Tere Marichal, inspirado en la commedia dell’arte. ¡A la
porra!, una compañía teatral que nace del trabajo de un grupo de actores
profesionales y estudiantes, asume el reto de montarla y agradece la confianza
de la autora y de todos los artistas que se han unido al proyecto.  
 
Otras obras dirigidas
por Rosabel Otón, directora de Secretos prohibidos
2007-presente
 Taller de Teatro Esmeralda,
Universidad  Interamericana Recinto
de Bayamón

story:
Help us share our love of dance with a debut video! 

Who Are We?

Queensland Highland Dancers are a professional Highland dance troupe based in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Our first appearance as a group was in 2013 for the filming of “Being Canadian – The Documentary” where we welcomed director/writer Robert Cohen to the East Coast with a dance on Queensland Beach, NS.
Our performance highlights include:
  • Performing for Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall during their visit to Halifax in May, 2014
  • AUS Men's Basketball Championship Game Halftime show with Ben Rutz
  • Men's World Curling Championship Pre-Game Show

Now we are trying to make a little video of our own to help us reach a larger audience!

Highland dance originated Scotland and has been a large part of Nova Scotia's culture for generations. We strive to connect the traditional culture of Nova Scotia with the vibrant energy of Halifax by fusing traditional Highland dance with contemporary and step dance.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to make our debut video! With this video, we hope to reach a new audience and share our passion for dance with people all over Canada. Help us preserve our identity and keep Highland dance alive and well in Halifax!

Your donations will help us pay for the productions costs for our video - which includes everything from lighting, dance costumes and of course paying our wonderful videographer & editor.

If we don't reach our goal, your donations will still be put towards the making of our video. The more we raise, the more amazing this video will be!

All donations will receive our heartfelt thanks! Other great perks include a Queensland t-shirt for a donation of $100 or a t-shirt plus your name in our video as a sponsor for a donation of $200 or more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out - if you can't donate, maybe someone you know can! Send our Indiegogo campaign to your e-mail list or post it on your social media platforms. The more people who know about our project, the better!

A big thank you from all of us for taking the time to read our campaign - Slainte!

story:
Children learn the most by hacking into their toys and asking questions, they said!

But today’s children are playing with face fillers, internet algorithms, have seen self-driving cars, and whatnot! How do we break into these 21-st century toys?

Well, let children learn programming, AI, robotics, etc., and let them mimic these real-world applications with the projects they make.

How? Meet Quarky, 


A re-programmable robot by profession, and a cute learning companion by passion, that children can create dozens of real-world-inspired projects with. 

 

 

Quarky, through it’s interactive interface and engaging hands-on experience, teaches programming and robotics while introducing children to a multitude of artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts.
 

 

Quarky is pretty handy, is loaded with features allowing real-time wireless interaction via WiFi and Bluetooth, works with both block-based programming and Python, is complemented with online courses to assist students in their learning, and can be programmed using phones, tabs, or laptops.

 

 

Quarky is not just another robot with basic pre-decided activities. With its versatile features, wide variety of kits and add-ons, a child’s imagination is the only limit.

 

Because it was a HIT on Kickstarter!

And it’s on Indiegogo to further the revolution.

STEMpedia, the creator behind Quarky, has an experience of running two successful, fully-delivered crowdfunding campaigns - evive and STEMpedia on Indiegogo - with over 99% satisfaction rate.

Upon getting validation from industry experts at CES 2020, STEMpedia levelled up its efforts towards making AI education accessible to kids in every corner of the world. Since then, it has been the talk of the town with media and DIY-ers writing about, testing, and reviewing Quarky for you.

Whatever they want to, duh!

No, we are serious! Project-making experience with Quarky is proven to improve their problem-solving skills, algorithmic thinking, creative approaches, and make their thought process a little more innovative. In other words, hone their 21st-century skills. And there’s hardly any limit to what kids can make with Quarky, let’s take a look at a few of them.

 

“It’s like conceptually reverse engineering a Tesla at 1/500th the $$$$.” - Nicola Edison

 

“I'll never let you go, Keep me by your side” - Quarky Onus Blue Raye

 

“Kevin would’ve been less troublesome if he was Home Alone in 2021.” - Kevin’s Mom

 

“I wish my child was this-obedient, not disobedient” - Shin Chan’s Mom

 

“Mirror mirror on the wall, who’s child is the naughtiest of all” - Unknown Parent

 

“AI AI AI, AI AI AI, (Don’t) Let it rain over me” - Smart Anthony

 

AND MUCH MUCH MORE ... 

 

Quarky has been tested by 500+ students and 50+ educators across 20+ countries over the course of 6 months. This is what they have to say: 

 


Well, because it’s ultra-powerful, feature-packed and appropriately assisted.

This reconfigurable and reprogrammable robot kit comes with 6 Online Self-Paced Courses that allow children to delve into concepts like object detection and identification, face and voice recognition, gesture-tracking, path planning, optical character recognition, machine learning, and much more, via dozens of interactive activities.

 

 

 

Learn to code with Scratch and Python within a single, omni-platform programming interface - PictoBlox and let your imaginations go wild. With PictoBlox, kids can code their palm-sized buddy, anytime and anywhere.

 

 

Messy wires, breadboards, soldering things together, etc. can be a nightmare at a tender age. But should we let this scare kids from getting their hands dirty? No way! That’s why Quarky comes with tons of built-in electromechanical components like LEDs, motors, sensors, buzzers, etc., so that making AI projects never gets tedious.

 

 

 

Quarky is not a product, it’s a feeling, an indulgence, a wholesome learning ecosystem in itself. It keeps things simple and interesting, so that kids never want to stop playing and learning, making every day a brand-new DIY-ing experience.

 

 

 

Wondering what’s the secret behind Quarky’s endless capabilities?

Based on ESP32, Quarky is a reprogrammable robot with built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. Despite being pocket-sized, it packs a plethora of on-board elements that make it easy for kids to integrate with programming platforms to work on AI and IoT projects. Take a look for yourself-
 

 

Let us highlight it again, Quarky is not just a product, but a carefully crafted learning ecosystem that guides children from zero to being an AI hero!

Each Quarky kit is accompanied by up to 6 Online Self-Paced STEM.ORG certified courses. They help start a child’s AI journey while covering all the aspects step-by-step.

 

Quarky is available as two basic variants - the Innovator Kit that facilitates hands-on AI activities with 2-robot variations, includes an arena, recognition cards, etc.; and the Ultimate Kit that includes everything from the Innovator Kit, and packs more mechanical parts for 10-robot variations, includes an additional arena, extra electronic components, and much more. Read more below:

 

 

Add-Ons are additional boxes of electro-mechanical parts that will help children dive deeper into a specific concept. These are meant to be used in addition to the basic variants above, and enable children to experiment with complex robot types/families, like the Mars Rover or a Humanoid, or add more flavor to the playfulness with more avatars for your projects with the Creatives pack, or maybe explore swarm robotics with additional Quarky boards (i.e. the Explorer). Read more below:

 

 

Based on NASA's 2020 Perseverance Rover‘s design, this pack adds 10+ variations of a celestial robo-marvel to your Quarky Army. With rocker-bogie and differential-arm mechanisms, this baby got all-terrain moves!

 

 

No Army could be complete without bi-pedal soldiers marching on the frontlines. And when they’re this cute and cuddly and have got all the necessary moves, they are never losing a war for you.

 

 

If looks could kill, Quarky Army would be the deadliest out there! They are a cultural revolution, you have to include folks from all shapes and colors. Grab a set of 12+ avatars for your robots and projects and make your Quarky Army look majestic!

 

 

Get an additional set of Quarky board (+accessories) to add more Quarkiness to your projects. Technically, this add-on enables swarm robotics flavor to the AI & robotics adventure.

Introduce students to Artificial Intelligence with our specially designed AI classroom bundles consisting of ultra-modern Quarky kits and teaching resources for an all-around STEM education experience. With the kits being so affordable, you can get one for every student in the class and take them on a one-to-one immersive AI learning journey!

 

 

The Mini Classroom Bundle is the most affordable way to bring AI learning to your classroom. Most suitable for makerspaces, after-school-activity-centers, etc. with upto 5 teams learning at once (i.e. 5 students for a 1-to-1 setting or 5 teams for a many-to-1 setting), while providing access to online courses and PictoBlox for 50 students.

 

 

The Classroom Bundle is the best value for money way to bring AI learning to your classroom. Most suitable for makerspaces, after-school-activity-centers, etc. with upto 10 teams learning at once (i.e. 10 students for a 1-to-1 setting or 10 teams for a many-to-1 setting), while providing access to online courses and PictoBlox for 120 students.

 

 

The AI Lab is an affordable way to bring AI learning to your school/ educational institution. Most suitable for schools that are looking to establish a new AI teaching facility at their premises. It is suitable for upto 15 teams learning at once (i.e. 15 students for a 1-to-1 setting or 15 teams for a many-to-1 setting), while providing access to online courses and PictoBlox for 250 students.

*Please note that, if you are a school that wants to add Quarky to an existing (not new) lab/ facility, the Classroom Bundles above will be a more suitable choice.

Quarky is not just a wonderful learning companion for students, it’s also a great TEACHING companion for educators! Quarky makes it easy to teach AI and robotics in an engaging manner and improves learning outcomes.

For the love of teachers, we have several means to handhold you and prepare you to take AI teaching to even the remotest part of the planet. For you, we’ve dedicated teacher-training sessions, open-houses, modular curricula, comprehensive teaching resources (lecture slides, session plans, activity sheets, etc.).

These materials and teacher-training programs have been tested with 50+ teachers across the globe, Take a look at the experiences they have to share:

Does AI seem too tough to grasp when young? No no, hold on, we’ve got a secret that makes it pretty easy and engaging too (read productively addictive). Quarky introduces you to coding through a complete hands-on approach with PictoBlox, an intuitive Scratch-like graphical/ block-based programming interface with advanced AI tools.

PictoBlox not only allows children to code with blocks, but includes a Python interface as well, making it the only (afaik) application to handhold children through the block-to-syntax transition in their skill to code.

 

 

Quarky comes complemented with a series of online courses that guide children step-by-step through the learning process. From conceptual depths to challenging capstone projects, from quizzes/ assessments to real-world challenges, everything that a child may need help with comes included.

The curricula designed for Quarky is accredited by STEM.ORG, one of the oldest STEM education research and credentialing organizations in America, and has been beta-tested by 500+ students across 20+ countries.

 

As of the day of launching this InDemand Campaign, about 2,000 Quarky kits have been manufactured and beta-tested from the first production run. Another 2,000 Quarky kits are under production to meet the pre-orders via Kickstarter and the InDemand campaigns.

Quarky is all prepared to greet you, and so shall you be, to bring the future of AI learning to your home!

 

 

 

 

Quarky is the brainchild of STEMpedia, a globally-renowned EdTech startup and creator of the famous all-in-one electronics prototyping platform evive. STEMpedia is head-quartered in Ahmedabad, India, and manages international operations via its subsidiary, STEMpedia Inc., California.

We’ve served 100,000+ students across 60+ countries, have worked with several government initiatives in India and across the globe such as the Atal Innovation Mission, AI Step-Up Module, Close the Gap, etc., and hosted 2020’s biggest international AI and coding competition for kids, Codeavour 2020 AI, that saw the participation of 5000+ teams across 90+ countries.

We ran two successful campaigns previously - one in 2016 and another in 2019 - and fulfilled all the orders on time. And we intend to do so this time as well. Pinky promise. The entire team of STEMpedia has put in all of their mind, body, and soul into bringing Quarky to life and can’t wait for you to get one for yourself!

 

This section includes raw and unedited footage of Quarky’s functionalities, and demonstrates different aspects of the product’s real-life applications.

Unboxing the Quarky Innovator Kit and demonstrating object-identification.

 

 

Demonstrating face-expression recognition and mimicking with Quarky robot. 

 

 

We are working continuously to improve the experience of learning AI and robotics via hands-on activities for children, and we need your support to make this a huge success.

Read more below:
 

 


Add-Ons are additional boxes of electro-mechanical parts that will help children dive deeper into a specific concept. These are meant to be used in addition to the basic variants above, and enable children to experiment with complex robot types/families, like the Mars Rover or a Humanoid, or add more flavor to the playfulness with more avatars for your projects with the Creatives pack, or maybe explore swarm robotics with additional Quarky boards (i.e. the Explorer). Read more below:
 

 
Based on NASA's 2020 Perseverance Rover‘s design, this pack adds 10+ variations of a celestial robo-marvel to your Quarky Army. With rocker-bogie and differential-arm mechanisms, this baby got all-terrain moves!
 

 
No Army could be complete without bi-pedal soldiers marching on the frontlines. And when they’re this cute and cuddly and have got all the necessary moves, they are never losing a war for you.
 

 
If looks could kill, Quarky Army would be the deadliest out there! They are a cultural revolution, you have to include folks from all shapes and colors. Grab a set of 12+ avatars for your robots and projects and make your Quarky Army look majestic!
 

 
Get an additional set of Quarky board (+accessories) to add more Quarkiness to your projects. Technically, this add-on enables swarm robotics flavor to the AI & robotics adventure.

Introduce students to Artificial Intelligence with our specially designed AI classroom bundles consisting of ultra-modern Quarky kits and teaching resources for an all-around STEM education experience. With the kits being so affordable, you can get one for every student in the class and take them on a one-to-one immersive AI learning journey!
 

 
The Mini Classroom Bundle is the most affordable way to bring AI learning to your classroom. Most suitable for makerspaces, after-school-activity-centers, etc. with upto 5 teams learning at once (i.e. 5 students for a 1-to-1 setting or 5 teams for a many-to-1 setting), while providing access to online courses and PictoBlox for 50 students.
 

 
The Classroom Bundle is the best value for money way to bring AI learning to your classroom. Most suitable for makerspaces, after-school-activity-centers, etc. with upto 10 teams learning at once (i.e. 10 students for a 1-to-1 setting or 10 teams for a many-to-1 setting), while providing access to online courses and PictoBlox for 120 students.
 

 
The AI Lab is an affordable way to bring AI learning to your school/ educational institution. Most suitable for schools that are looking to establish a new AI teaching facility at their premises. It is suitable for upto 15 teams learning at once (i.e. 15 students for a 1-to-1 setting or 15 teams for a many-to-1 setting), while providing access to online courses and PictoBlox for 250 students.
*Please note that, if you are a school that wants to add Quarky to an existing (not new) lab/ facility, the Classroom Bundles above will be a more suitable choice.
Quarky is not just a wonderful learning companion for students, it’s also a great TEACHING companion for educators! Quarky makes it easy to teach AI and robotics in an engaging manner and improves learning outcomes.
For the love of teachers, we have several means to handhold you and prepare you to take AI teaching to even the remotest part of the planet. For you, we’ve dedicated teacher-training sessions, open-houses, modular curricula, comprehensive teaching resources (lecture slides, session plans, activity sheets, etc.).
These materials and teacher-training programs have been tested with 50+ teachers across the globe, Take a look at the experiences they have to share:


Does AI seem too tough to grasp when young? No no, hold on, we’ve got a secret that makes it pretty easy and engaging too (read productively addictive). Quarky introduces you to coding through a complete hands-on approach with PictoBlox, an intuitive Scratch-like graphical/ block-based programming interface with advanced AI tools.
PictoBlox not only allows children to code with blocks, but includes a Python interface as well, making it the only (afaik) application to handhold children through the block-to-syntax transition in their skill to code.
 
 


Quarky comes complemented with a series of online courses that guide children step-by-step through the learning process. From conceptual depths to challenging capstone projects, from quizzes/ assessments to real-world challenges, everything that a child may need help with comes included.

The curricula designed for Quarky is accredited by STEM.ORG, one of the oldest STEM education research and credentialing organizations in America, and has been beta-tested by 500+ students across 20+ countries.
 





As of the day of launching this InDemand Campaign, about 2,000 Quarky kits have been manufactured and beta-tested from the first production run. Another 2,000 Quarky kits are under production to meet the pre-orders via Kickstarter and the InDemand campaigns.
Quarky is all prepared to greet you, and so shall you be, to bring the future of AI learning to your home!
 

 




 

 

Quarky is the brainchild of STEMpedia, a globally-renowned EdTech startup and creator of the famous all-in-one electronics prototyping platform evive. STEMpedia is head-quartered in Ahmedabad, India, and manages international operations via its subsidiary, STEMpedia Inc., California.
We’ve served 100,000+ students across 60+ countries, have worked with several government initiatives in India and across the globe such as the Atal Innovation Mission, AI Step-Up Module, Close the Gap, etc., and hosted 2020’s biggest international AI and coding competition for kids, Codeavour 2020 AI, that saw the participation of 5000+ teams across 90+ countries.
We ran two successful campaigns previously - one in 2016 and another in 2019 - and fulfilled all the orders on time. And we intend to do so this time as well. Pinky promise. The entire team of STEMpedia has put in all of their mind, body, and soul into bringing Quarky to life and can’t wait for you to get one for yourself!
 


This section includes raw and unedited footage of Quarky’s functionalities, and demonstrates different aspects of the product’s real-life applications.
Unboxing the Quarky Innovator Kit and demonstrating object-identification.
 
 
Demonstrating face-expression recognition and mimicking with Quarky robot. 
 
 
We are working continuously to improve the experience of learning AI and robotics via hands-on activities for children, and we need your support to make this a huge success.

story:
Picture a dog-shaped quadruped robot that can hop, trot, and run around, supporting 12-DOF, ROS (Robot Operating System) SLAM, Navigation, and OpenCV AI functions—while being inexpensive. Mini Pupper is the dream sidekick for you to learn and experiment with robotics, exploring advanced functions of a dynamic robot that would typically not be available at this price point.  

In June 2021, MangDang released Mini Pupper on the Stanford Pupper website in collaboration with Nathan Kau, the original creator of Stanford Pupper, to bring to market a commercial and reasonably priced educational quadruped robot that anyone could engagingly use for fun robotics research and experiments. 

 

Mini Pupper’s design was based on the feedback we received from our existing customers. The ease of use, assembly and disassembly are the result of precious feedback from users that allowed us to keep improving what ultimately came to be a user-centric robot that you can easily understand, explore, learn from, and play with—and for a price that most can afford!

Mini Pupper is a dog-shaped robot that is aimed at stimulating and empowering your creativity. That’s why we are not presenting it as a closed project that can’t evolve from here. On the contrary, Mini Pupper leverages Ubuntu and ROS to operate its FSN (Full Self-Navigation) System.

Mini Pupper supports not only Melodic but also Noetic. ROS2 is also in our pipeline.  

SLAM

MiniPupper supports SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), it can map its environment and learn in real-time from things around using Lidar or a camera sensor.   

Navigation

With the map, Mini Pupper can answer "where am I? Where am I going?" you can call it self-driving technology.  

 

Mini Pupper is an open-source dog robot you can explore whatever you want! 

Mini Pupper's software is compatible with Robot Operating System (ROS) using a forked version of Champ Quadrupedal Framework led by Juan Miguel Jimeno. The software stack runs on a customized hardware based on Stanford's Pupper project. Many thanks to the open source community for making Mini Pupper a reality. 

Mini Pupper is an open-source dog robot you can explore whatever you want! 

Mini Pupper's software is compatible with Robot Operating System (ROS) using a forked version of Champ Quadrupedal Framework led by Juan Miguel Jimeno. The software stack runs on a customized hardware based on Stanford's Pupper project. Many thanks to the open source community for making Mini Pupper a reality. 

  • Software

Gait Performance

You can use Mini Pupper to explore many gait performances, such as Trot (diagonal pairs), Pace (lateral pairs), and the Bound (front and rear pairs). 

'

Facial Animation

You can easily custom your own facial animation, mechanical shell, and your own algorithms, we will supply enough guide documents and videos to make it easy. Here are three preset animations, you can change and make your own set by just one click!  

Hardware

You can DIY and customize a UNIQUE MiniPupper in the world.  Check out those MiniPuppers created by our fans!  

Mini Pupper supports OpenCV's latest 3D camera module, named OAK-D LITE, it brings the superpowers of Spatial AI to the price-point necessary to unlock all sorts of applications. With the module, Mini Pupper can run face detect, recognition, object detect, recognition, etc.  

With OAK-D-Lite vision, it's now your Border-Collie-level smart robotic dog. Border Collies are amazing because they can learn very specific hand signals (and they're neurotic about them). Now Mini Pupper can be just as amazing (and neurotic)!  

 

Custom servo

Servo is the key component to a robot dog. We've got high torque custom servos which allows it to go fast and stable. We didn't just choose the cheapest option, we chose the right option. We wanted it to have personality and be approachable. and draw people in.  

12DOF

Most robots of this category feature an 8 DOF (degree of freedom), which translates into less organic movements. We were not happy with the idea of limiting Mini Pupper to these constraints, so, after extensive debate within our team and research, we were eventually able to create our quadruped robot with a 12 DOF that allows it to follow biological movements but at an affordable price point that isn’t made inaccessible to the average consumer.  

Iteration

You can find our Mini Pupper Prototype, on Dec 2020, we used more than 8+ months to make Mini Pupper stable and more perfect for you to use.  

 Raspberry Pi 

Based on Raspberry Pi, MiniPupper is super expandable. You can explore more with MiniPupper!  

How to use it?

You can use the controller to enjoy and explore Mini Pupper's many features. Besides that, you can easily custom your own facial animation and algorithms by PC, we will supply enough guide documents and videos to make it easy.   

While Mini Pupper provides an exciting journey into the world of robotics for anyone, there’s a central educational mission that this unique robot needs to accomplish. Mini Pupper wants to help you learn about robotics and experiment with this brave new world in a fun way. 

 

That’s why we’re also organizing an online course series that is tied to understanding and exploring Mini Pupper—namely the mechanical, hardware, ROS, SLAM, navigation, AI, and other angles of the robot. In other words, for you, this is the robotic educational experience of a lifetime!

Open source: Mini Pupper is inspired by Stanford Pupper open source project. You can find and download the design files and source code from the Mini Pupper Github project link. Mini Pupper was featured by Hackaday, Hackster, Make, won a Hackaday Prize. We got so much help from the Hackaday community, such as project reviews from Majenta and Mitch, Hack Chat support from Dan Maloney. Really really thanks for all the open source communities. 

HackChat

It’s our pleasure to share all that we know, if you have any questions, please join the Robot Dogs #HackChat, Wednesday, Sept. 29th at Noon Pacific. Click here to join! 

With the OpenCV 3D camera module, named OAK-D LITE, Mini Pupper can track hands and/or full body pose in full 3D coordinates. It's endless possibilities. Many thanks to  Brandon Gilles's great help from the OpenCV and Luxonis communities. 

 
 

Mini Pupper can run on Ubuntu and ROS, now the ROS version is Melodic, updating to Noetic, ROS2 is also on our pipeline. It can support SLAM, Navigation and other ROS features. On 6th Oct. will host an interview with Kat Scott from the ROS & Open Robotics community. We got much help and support from Kat, really appreciate Kat’s great help.

 
 

Founded in 2020, MangDang Technology Co., Limited (MangDang) specializes in the research, development, and production of robot products that make people’s lives better.  

MangDang is headquartered in Hong Kong. We are a global team with members from many countries such as the United States, Japan, Canada, Poland, and China.

For the detailed BOM list information, please refer to Mini Pupper BOM List.

Package Recommendation:

 Research Basic Kit: For deep custom users, you need to prepare: soldering iron, 3D printed machine, battery, charger, controller, Raspberry Pi, SD card.

 Research Kit:  You only need to prepare: Controller, Raspberry Pi, SD card.

 Complete kit： Includes all the parts and tools to build and program.

 Full Mini Pupper: Everything you will need to run and program your Mini Pupper Robot right out of the box.  All software is installed and calibration has been completed.

 Add-Ons: 

Lidar module: If you want to explore ROS SLAM, Navigation functions based on Lidar, you also need a Lidar module. We can ONLY ensure the Lidar module can work well based on our source code, and NOT ensure that you get from other channels. We fixed some software problems based on our source code, and if you like, we can also share with you our ROS2 driver for this Lidar. Definitely, we will supply a user guide to let you use it easily. We already tested some Lidar modules, such as, PRLidar A1, YDLidar X2L, and LD06. For Mini Pupper, we refer to LD06 as it is smaller. LD06 Lidar module price is same as their campaign price, but we will ship one additional Mini Pupper servo as a gift.

 Camera module: For potential security issues, the camera module is not included in our default package. If you want to explore camera AI functions, you can choose a normal USB camera module, of course, a 3D camera module is better for study. If try the 3D camera module, we recommend you OpenCV's latest 3D camera module, named OAK-D LITE, comes from OpenCV&Luxonis. We will supply a user guide to let you use it easily.

story:
Timeline

 

           Languages

English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano, Suomi, 日本語

 

Team

Supported by:

Free Demo Version 0.98 Direct Download

release date: 5. March 2021

Windows

https://www.bacco.co.at/download/1005/

Apple - OSX

https://www.bacco.co.at/download/1010/

Linux

https://www.bacco.co.at/download/1012/

iOS

https://www.bacco.co.at/swre

Android

https://www.bacco.co.at/swre

아래 한국어, 中文 见下文, Deutsch, siehe unten, Español, véase más abajo.

English

Short Summary

For every student-musician, the exercising period without the help of a teacher is by far the largest one. Depending on the learning level, practice takes between 70-95% of the total playing time. This overwhelming period is spent on his/her own.

However, all pupils invest a lot of growth potential in the exercise period, the progress stays small and stagnant. As a consequence, there is a lack of pleasure and exercise demolitions are not seldom.

As a solution, a software system is needed, which can transfer the quality of the lesson under the teacher’s control into the practicing period on alone.

The music educational software Accento combines frequency, rhythm and timbre recognition techniques accompanied by a didactically built collection of music pieces. The students of all performance levels would be able to use the software, especially at home during the practice hours.

A musician plays the notes marked on the screen and receives feedback about the correctly or incorrectly played notes after it. In the second step, the program runs the appropriate exercises suggested and selected according to the student's errors to correct and practice them. All exercises are performed at appropriate speeds and small increases in tempo, so that at the end of the correction unit (2nd step) the play is guaranteed to be mastered.

The instrument educational material is designed by top musicians and consist of well-known and self-composed songs, exercises and etudes. The music pieces are integrated into the didactic learning concept and are coordinated with each other. The different levels of difficulty are combined with the different music styles so that one can choose from many different music sheets of different styles. Thus, the learning path is individually adapted to the needs of a student.

The quality and the intensity of personal instrumental lessons with a teacher are to be transferred to the exercise period. In this way, the musician has to be optimally looked after, especially during the practicing period - which takes more than 80% of the total playing time.

It is also very important to hold the body correctly while playing an instrument. Our program will also give feedback to the users according to their body position.

Two target groups will achieve significant benefits with the use of Accento:

STUDENTS:

  • Students will increase learning speed.
  • Students will have fun with their instruments through permanent learning. The drop-out rate of the students will go down.
  • Through the interaction with the program and different tempos, a learner will have a constant metric guidance, which will develop an inner metric.
  • The musicians will learn and practice only the correct and necessary skills and won’t consolidate the wrong habits.
  • Students / parents will save time and money in the long term!

TEACHERS:

  • Teachers will teach more successfully.
  •  A student will develop an exercise discipline, which is designed by the trained instrument specialists.
  • He/she will be better prepared for the lesson, will not make unnecessary exercising and mistakes, which will simplify weekly exercises, since it will be possible to work on the music problems instead on the constant correction of the learnt habits.
  • Teachers' reputation will be enhanced by the successes of their students.
  • We are going to start with the following instruments: piano, guitar, flute and violin

The software is open, each user will be able to use his/her own music material.

A Free Demo Program (Version 0.98) for WIndows, Apple MacOS, iOS and Linux (Android coming soon)  is available for download on our website

Description: the current demo supports the following instruments: piano (record is only  possible with a Midi Device), guitar, flute and violin (record is only possible over the built in microphone). Support for microphone recording with piano and midi record with guitar is going to be added in the next releases.

English Website: https://www.accento.app

Free Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/swre

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoApp

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoapp/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/AccentoApp

FAQ

Devices: If you want to buy a "perk" you should choose at least 3 different devices.This happened because Indiegogo does not allow us to dynamically configure this selection.  After we have finished the software, you will receive a download code to install the software. You can choose between 3 devices (eg 2 tablets and a mobile phone or 2 mobile phones and 1 desktop PC, etc.).

Language: it's not a problem if you choose the false language. At the time of download, you can choose the correct language.Please contact us if your desired language is not listed.

Payments: Please contact us if you have  any problems to make the payments to : office@bacco.co.at , or if you have any doubts or further questions. You can contact us over our Facebook, Instagram or via Twitter.

Perks:

You will receive the product in different combinations (see Perks) for a reduced price (44% discount).

The software will run on iOS, OSX, Android, Windows and Linux (all Distributions), on PCs, tablets or mobile phones, in English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (Cooming Soon: Suomi, 日本語,  other languages on request).

Android is supported since version 5.0.

  • The software will be available in the following languages: English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (Cooming Soon: Suomi, 日本語, other languages on request).
  • € 50, 1 license (3 devices, PC, tablet or mobile phone freely selectable) plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
  • € 100, 2 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
  • € 150, 3 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
  • Bronze Sponsor: € 500, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Dutch and Spanish for 1 year. 4 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
  • Silver Sponsor: € 1000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Dutch, Chinese and Korean for 1 year. 5 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
  • Gold Sponsor: € 2000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Dutch and Chinese and Korean for 2 years. 6 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
  • Platinum Sponsor: € 5000, your name will appear on our products in English, German, Spanish, Dutch,  Chinese and Korean for 3 years. 7 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.

中文

简介

对于每个学音乐的人来说，在没有老师帮助下的练习是最漫长的。 根据学习水平，练习的时间会占70-95％，这意味着学生大部分时间都要孤军奋战。

因此，学生花费大量时间来提高他们的技能，但进展可能缓慢或停滞，这或许会导致其失去兴趣或在某些情况下放弃。

因此，我们需要一个软件系统，使个人的练习达到在老师指导下一样的质量。

音乐软件ACCENTO是一个将音乐作品与频率、节奏和语音识别技术相结合的教育系统，所有水平的学生都可以在自己的练习中使用该软件。

首先，学生弹奏屏幕上的音符，软件继而向用户给出相应评价，包括是否正确和错误。第二步，软件将向用户提供适当的练习，以校正用户弹错的部分。 整个训练基于适当的速度，并循序渐进来提升速度，因此学生将能够在第二步中完全掌握该部分。

该软件的培训材料由顶级音乐家设计，包括著名歌曲、自编歌曲和练习曲。 这些曲目根据教学方法，结合不同难度和音乐风格。用户可以选择各种音乐作品， 因此，这种学习方法将满足每个学生的需求。

通过教师辅导而获得的质量和强度，也可以在个人的练习当中实现。个人练习对音乐学生来说非常重要，所以学生需要很明智地运用练习时间。

以正确的姿势演奏乐器也非常重要，该软件还将提供学生姿势的反馈。

使用ACCENTO时，这两组人群将获得相当大的好处：

学生

  • 您可以更快地提高演奏技能。
  • 学习变得更有趣了，学生辍学率大幅减少。
  • 通过和程序的互动，如改变速度，学生可以培养自己的内在乐感。
  • 您不会养成错误的习惯，因为您只学习、练习正确和必要的方法。
  • 长远角度看，学生/家长可以节约时间、减少开销。

教师：

  • 教师将提高教学质量。
  • 学习体系会提升，因为练习方式是由顶尖专家设计的。

  • 学生将更好地为课程做好准备，不会做不必要的练习、犯不必要的错误，这使每周的课程更有效率；学生会解决音乐问题，而不是不断纠正学习习惯。

  • 学生的成功将提高教师的声誉。

  • 我们将从以下乐器开始：钢琴，吉他，长笛和小提琴

该软件是开放的，每个用户将能够使用他/她自己的音乐素材。

한국어

짧은 요약

음악을 배우는 학생들에게 있어서 교사의 도움 없이 홀로 연습하는 시간은 각자의 수준에 따라 대략 70-95%로 나타나며 이는 대부분의 시간을 혼자서 보낸다는 것을 의미합니다.

이처럼 학생들은 많은 시간을 실력 향상을 위해 투자하지만 진전이 더디거나 정체될 수 있으며 이는 결과적으로 흥미를 잃거나 경우에 따라 도중에 포기하게 되는 원인이 되기도 합니다.

따라서 해결책으로, 레슨의 질을 연습으로 고스란히 이어줄 시스템이 필요합니다.

음악 소프트웨어인 ACCENTO는 음악 작품들과 주파수, 리듬, 음색 인식 기술이 결합된 교육 시스템이며 모든 수준의 학생들이 본인의 연습에서 이 소프트웨어를 사용할 수 있습니다.

사용자는 화면에 표시된 음표(연주 과제)를 연주한 뒤 올바르게 연주한 부분과 잘못 연주한 부분에 대한 피드백을 받게 되며 두번째 단계에서는 프로그램이 사용자가 잘못 연주한 부분을 바로잡을 수 있는 적절한 연습 방법을 제시합니다. 전체적인 훈련은 적절한 속도와 점진적인 템포의 증가를 바탕으로 이루어지므로 이 두번째 단계를 거치면 해당 부분을 완전히 숙달할 수 있게 될 것입니다. 

이 프로그램의 교육 자료들은 최고의 음악가들이 디자인 하였으며 잘 알려진 곡들을 포함하여 자체적으로 제작한 곡들, 연습방법, 그리고 에튀드 등으로 구성되어 있습니다. 이 곡들은 교육학적인 수업방안에 따라 구성 되었으며 각기 다른 난이도와 음악 스타일과 결합되었으므로 모든 레벨에서 다양한 음악 작품을 선택할 수 있습니다. 따라서 이 학습은 사용자의 요구를 충족시킬 것입니다.

사람과의 개인 교습을 통해 얻을 수 있는 퀄리티와 강도는 연습 시간으로도 이어져야 합니다. 음악가에게 있어서 연습은 매우 중요하므로 이를 잘 관리할 필요가 있습니다.

또한 올바른 자세로 악기를 연주하는 것도 굉장히 중요하며 이 프로그램은 사용자의 자세에 대한 피드백도 제공할 것입니다.

두 그룹은 ACCENTO를 사용시 상당한 이점을 얻을 것입니다.

학생 :

더 빠른 속도로 실력을 향상시킬 수 있습니다.

지속적으로 교육을 재미있게 할 수 있기 때문에 도중에 포기할 염려를 줄일 수 있습니다.

프로그램과 다양한 상호 작용을 통해 본인만의 연습 체계를 만들어 나갈 수 있습니다.

정확하고 필요한 기술들만을 배우고 연습하기 때문에 잘못 된 습관을 가지지 않을것입니다.

돈을 절약할 수 있습니다.

교사:

교육의 질을 향상시킬 수 있습니다.

교사의 명성은 학생들의 성공으로 인하여 향상됩니다.

학생들은 특별히 숙련 된 전문가가 디자인 한 실습을 통해 본인의 연습 시스템을 향상시킬 것입니다.

학생들이 더욱 준비된 상태로 수업에 임하게 되어 불필요한 작업이 줄어들고 더욱 더 효과적인 수업으로 이어지게 될 것입니다.

우리는 다음과 같은 악기부터 시작합니다 : 피아노, 기타, 플룻, 그리고 바이올린

소프트웨어는 공개되어있으며 모든 사용자가 자신의 음악 재료들을 사용할 수 있습니다.

Windows, Apple MacOS, iOS 및 Linux (Android는 곧 제공됨) 용 무료 데모 프로그램 (버전 0.98)은 당사 웹 사이트에서 다운로드 할 수 있습니다.

설명 : 현재 데모는 피아노 (레코드는 미디 장치에서만 가능), 기타, 플루트 및 바이올린 (내장 마이크를 통해서만 레코딩 가능)과 같은 악기를 지원합니다. 다음 릴리스에서는 피아노와 기타로 녹음 된 미디 레코드에 대한 지원이 추가 될 예정입니다. 앱 사용법은 마지막 동영상에 설명되어 있습니다.

Deutsch

Kurzbeschreibung

Für jeden Musiker stellt die Übungszeit ohne Lehrer den weitaus größten Musizierzeitraum dar. Je nach Niveau nimmt die Übungszeit zwischen 70-95% der gesamten Spielzeit ein. Diese weitaus überwiegende Zeit verbringt der Musiker ohne seinen Lehrer, er/sie ist auf sich allein gestellt.

Allerdings verschenken Schüler in der Übungszeit sehr viel Entwicklungspotenzial, wodurch der Fortschritt kleiner ist, oder stagniert. Die Folge ist mangelnde Lust und nicht selten der Abbruch.

Als Lösung ist ein System notwendig, welches die Qualität des Unterrichts in die Übungszeit überträgt.

Die Musik-Lernsoftware Accento kombiniert Frequenz,  Rhythmus und Klangfarbe-Erkennungs-Technik begleitet mit einem umfassend didaktisch aufgebauten System von Musikstücken. Musikschüler aller Leistungsstufen sollen die Software vor allem zu Hause in den Übungsstunden verwenden.
Der Musiker spielt die am Bildschirm/Display markierten Noten (Spielaufgabe) und erhält nach dem Spiel eine Rückmeldung über richtig und falsch gespielte Noten. Im zweiten Schritt durchläuft das Programm mit dem Schüler passende Übungen – vorgeschlagen vom Programm und je nach Fehlerstellen des Schülers vom Programm ausgewählt - um die gespielten Fehler zu korrigieren. Sämtliche Übungen erfolgen in passenden Spielgeschwindigkeiten und kleinen Temposteigerungen, sodass am Ende der Korrektureinheit (2. Schritt) die Spielaufgabe garantiert bewältigt wird.

 Das Notenmaterial wird von Spitzenmusikern konzipiert und besteht aus bekannten und selbst komponierten Liedern, Übungen, Etüden. Die Musikstücke sind in ein didaktisches Lernkonzept eingebunden und aufeinander abgestimmt. Verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade werden mit verschiedenen Musikstilen kombiniert, sodass auf jedem Niveau viele Musikstücke unterschiedlichster Art gewählt werden können. Somit wird der Lernweg individuell den Bedürfnissen des Schülers angepasst.

Die Qualität und Intensität des persönlichen Instrumentalunterrichts mit dem Lehrer soll auf die Übungszeit übertragen werden. Damit soll der Musiker vor allem in der Übungszeit - welche den weitaus größten Teil der gesamten Spielzeit ausmacht - optimal betreut werden.

Auch die Körperhaltung beim Spielen eines Instrumentes ist sehr wichtig, unser Programm wird auch ein Feedback  diesbezüglich den Benutzern geben

Zwei Zielgruppen erzielen mit der Verwendung von Accento einen erheblichen Nutzen:

SCHÜLER:

  • Der Schüler steigert die Lerngeschwindigkeit.
  • Die Schüler haben durch dauerhafte Lernerfolge Spaß mit ihrem Instrument. Die Abbruchsquote der Schüler sinkt.
  • Die Schüler/Eltern sparen langfristig Zeit und Geld!
  • Durch die Interaktion mit dem Programm und den verschiedenen Tempos hat der Lernende eine konstante metrische Führung, wodurch dieser eine innere Metrik entwickeln kann.
  • Man lernt /übt nur die richtigen Fertigkeiten und man festigt nicht falsche Angewohnheiten.  

LEHRER:

  • Die Lehrer unterrichten erfolgreicher.
  • Die Reputation der Lehrer wird durch die Erfolge seiner Schüler gesteigert.
  • Der Schüler wird eine Übungsdisziplin entwickeln, welche speziell ausgebildeten Fachkräfte gestalten
  • Der Schüler kommt besser vorbereitet zur Stunde, macht weniger unnötige Fehler, was die wöchentliche Arbeit vereinfachen wird, da es möglich sein wird an den musikalischen Problemen zu arbeiten anstatt falsch gelernte Abläufe andauernd korrigieren zu müssen.

Wir beginnen mit folgenden Instrumenten: Klavier, Gitarre, Querflöte und Violine

Die Software ist offen, jeder Benutzer wird in der Lage sein sein eigenes Notenmaterial zu verwenden.

Ein kostenloses Demo-Programm (Version 0.98) für Windows, Apple MacOS ,iOS und Linux (Android in Kürze verfügbar) steht auf unserer Website zum Download bereit.

Unterstützung für Mikrofonaufnahmen mit Piano und MIDI-Aufnahme mit Gitarre wird in den nächsten Releases hinzugefügt.
