Español

Descripción

La práctica de un instrumento sin la compañía de un docente representa para cada músico el periodo más prolongado de la práctica musical. De acuerdo al nivel del instrumentista, la práctica individual representa entre el 70 y el 95% del tiempo total de ejecución. Durante todo ese tiempo cada músico ejercita su instrumento sin la presencia de su maestro, el/ella depende solo de si mismo.

No obstante la mayor parte de los estudiantes de música desperdicia una gran cantidad de potencial durante la práctica diaria, la evolución es mínima o en su defecto se produce un estancamiento. El resultado es insuficiente motivación y con mucha frecuencia el abandono de la práctica musical.

Como solución es necesario crear un sistema que traslade la calidad de las clases a la práctica diaria.

El Software de pedagogia musical Accento combina el reconocimiento de la frecuencia, el ritmo y el timbre siendo acompañado por un sistema pedagógico de obras progresivas. Los estudiantes de todas las edades y niveles usarán el Software sobre todo en sus hogares durante la práctica de sus respectivos instrumentos. Los músicos tocarán las piezas mostradas en la pantalla de sus dispositivos, y una vez finalizada la ejecución tendrán la oportunidad de visualizar los errores realizados. A continuación el programa le sugerirá al usuario ejercicios técnicos para corregir los errores cometidos. Los ejercicios serán ejecutados con una aceleración gradual del Tempo, para garantizar de esta manera la culminación exitosa de la pieza correspondiente.

Las piezas de los métodos serán concebidas por renombrados pedagogos comprendiendo las obras más importantes de la literatura de cada instrumento, así como arreglos propios. Diferentes estilos y niveles de dificultad serán combinados de manera que en cada nivel sea posible escoger diferentes piezas, posibilitando de esta manera la elección de un recorrido individual que se adapte a las exigencias o problemas de cada alumno.

De esta forma la calidad e intensidad de las clases instrumentales serán trasladadas a la práctica diaria. Así será posible aprovecharla al máximo y acelerar considerablemente el aprendizaje musical.

La postura es también muy importante al tocar un instrumento. Nuestro programa también ofrecerá un  control sobre posibles errores de postura durante la ejecución.

Dos grupos de usuarios percibirán con el uso de Accento enormes beneficios:

ESTUDIANTES

  • El estudiante podrá aprender con más rapidez     
  • A través de su mejoría le será posible disfrutar la actividad musical.
  • Los estudiantes / padres ahorrarán tiempo y dinero.
  • Desarrolla el pulso interno, ya que al interactuar con el programa y los diferentes metros el estudiante tendrá una guía métrica constante.
  • Habrá una supervisión constante del estudio diario, con lo cual será posible ahorrar el tiempo que se pierde cuando se aprende algo mal. Solo se aprenden lecciones positivas, de esta manera el aprendizaje no se construye en base a la corrección de malos hábitos.

DOCENTES

  • Los docentes podrán mejorar la calidad de su enseñanza. Finalmente será posible trabajar los aspectos importantes de las obras durante las clases.
  • Su reputación crecerá a través de los éxitos de sus alumnos.
  •  El alumno desarrollará una disciplina de estudio pre-estructurada por especialistas y vendrá a clase con un trabajo previo carente de errores. Esto le facilitará el trabajo y le permitirá concentrarse más en temas musicales que en solucionar problemas de solfeo.

Los primeros métodos de aprendizaje disponibles serán para piano, guitarra, violín y flauta traversa. El Software es de todas maneras abierto, cada usuario podrá usar su propio material.

El programa es abierto, o sea a cada usuario le será posible usar sus propias partituras, o confeccionar sus propios métodos de aprendizaje si así lo desea.

Un programa de demostración gratuito (versión 0.98) para Windows, Apple MacOS, iOS y Linux (Android próximamente) está disponible para descargar en nuestro sitio web

Descripción: la demostración actual es compatible con los siguientes instrumentos: piano (solo se puede grabar con un dispositivo Midi), guitarra, flauta y violín (solo se puede grabar con el micrófono incorporado). El soporte para grabación de micrófono con piano y midi con guitarra se agregará en las próximas versiones.

Web en español: https://www.accento.app

Free Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/demo-es

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoApp

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoapp

Twitter: https://twitter.com/AccentoApp

Contáctenos en caso de que tenga problemas en realizar el pago bajo office@bacco.co.at

Perks:

Vosotros recibiréis el producto en diferentes combinaciones (véase Perks) con un descuento aproximado del 44%

El Software será realizado para iOS, OSX; Android (Android 5 o más elevado), Windows y Linux (todas las distribuciones) y funcionará en computadoras, tabletas y teléfonos móviles. La primera versión será lanzada en English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (próximamente: Suomi, 日本語, otros idiomas a petición).

  • El Software estará disponible en los siguientes idiomas:  English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (próximamente: Suomi, 日本語, otros idiomas a petición).
  • €50 1 licencia (3 dispositivos, PC, tableta y teléfono móbil) así como un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
  • €100 2 licencias y un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
  • €150 3 licencias y un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
  • Bronze Sponsor: €500, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés y alemán por 1 año, además de ello recibirá 4 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
  • Silver Sponsor: €1000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 1 año, además de ello recibirá 5 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
  • Gold Sponsor: €2000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 2 años, además de ello recibirá 6 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
  • Platinum Sponsor: €5000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 3 años, además de ello recibirá 7 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
story_txt:
Timeline            LanguagesEnglish, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano, Suomi, 日本語 TeamSupported by:Free Demo Version 0.98 Direct Downloadrelease date: 5. March 2021Windowshttps://www.bacco.co.at/download/1005/Apple - OSXhttps://www.bacco.co.at/download/1010/Linuxhttps://www.bacco.co.at/download/1012/iOShttps://www.bacco.co.at/swreAndroidhttps://www.bacco.co.at/swre아래 한국어, 中文 见下文, Deutsch, siehe unten, Español, véase más abajo.EnglishShort SummaryFor every student-musician, the exercising period without the help of a teacher is by far the largest one. Depending on the learning level, practice takes between 70-95% of the total playing time. This overwhelming period is spent on his/her own.However, all pupils invest a lot of growth potential in the exercise period, the progress stays small and stagnant. As a consequence, there is a lack of pleasure and exercise demolitions are not seldom.As a solution, a software system is needed, which can transfer the quality of the lesson under the teacher’s control into the practicing period on alone.The music educational software Accento combines frequency, rhythm and timbre recognition techniques accompanied by a didactically built collection of music pieces. The students of all performance levels would be able to use the software, especially at home during the practice hours.A musician plays the notes marked on the screen and receives feedback about the correctly or incorrectly played notes after it. In the second step, the program runs the appropriate exercises suggested and selected according to the student's errors to correct and practice them. All exercises are performed at appropriate speeds and small increases in tempo, so that at the end of the correction unit (2nd step) the play is guaranteed to be mastered.The instrument educational material is designed by top musicians and consist of well-known and self-composed songs, exercises and etudes. The music pieces are integrated into the didactic learning concept and are coordinated with each other. The different levels of difficulty are combined with the different music styles so that one can choose from many different music sheets of different styles. Thus, the learning path is individually adapted to the needs of a student.The quality and the intensity of personal instrumental lessons with a teacher are to be transferred to the exercise period. In this way, the musician has to be optimally looked after, especially during the practicing period - which takes more than 80% of the total playing time.It is also very important to hold the body correctly while playing an instrument. Our program will also give feedback to the users according to their body position.Two target groups will achieve significant benefits with the use of Accento:STUDENTS:
Students will increase learning speed.
Students will have fun with their instruments through permanent learning. The drop-out rate of the students will go down.
Through the interaction with the program and different tempos, a learner will have a constant metric guidance, which will develop an inner metric.
The musicians will learn and practice only the correct and necessary skills and won’t consolidate the wrong habits.
Students / parents will save time and money in the long term!
TEACHERS:
Teachers will teach more successfully.
 A student will develop an exercise discipline, which is designed by the trained instrument specialists.
He/she will be better prepared for the lesson, will not make unnecessary exercising and mistakes, which will simplify weekly exercises, since it will be possible to work on the music problems instead on the constant correction of the learnt habits.
Teachers' reputation will be enhanced by the successes of their students.
We are going to start with the following instruments: piano, guitar, flute and violin
The software is open, each user will be able to use his/her own music material.A Free Demo Program (Version 0.98) for WIndows, Apple MacOS, iOS and Linux (Android coming soon)  is available for download on our websiteDescription: the current demo supports the following instruments: piano (record is only  possible with a Midi Device), guitar, flute and violin (record is only possible over the built in microphone). Support for microphone recording with piano and midi record with guitar is going to be added in the next releases.English Website: https://www.accento.appFree Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/swreFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoAppInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoapp/Twitter: https://twitter.com/AccentoAppFAQDevices: If you want to buy a "perk" you should choose at least 3 different devices.This happened because Indiegogo does not allow us to dynamically configure this selection.  After we have finished the software, you will receive a download code to install the software. You can choose between 3 devices (eg 2 tablets and a mobile phone or 2 mobile phones and 1 desktop PC, etc.).Language: it's not a problem if you choose the false language. At the time of download, you can choose the correct language.Please contact us if your desired language is not listed.Payments: Please contact us if you have  any problems to make the payments to : office@bacco.co.at , or if you have any doubts or further questions. You can contact us over our Facebook, Instagram or via Twitter.Perks:You will receive the product in different combinations (see Perks) for a reduced price (44% discount).The software will run on iOS, OSX, Android, Windows and Linux (all Distributions), on PCs, tablets or mobile phones, in English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (Cooming Soon: Suomi, 日本語,  other languages on request).Android is supported since version 5.0.
The software will be available in the following languages: English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (Cooming Soon: Suomi, 日本語, other languages on request).
€ 50, 1 license (3 devices, PC, tablet or mobile phone freely selectable) plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
€ 100, 2 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
€ 150, 3 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
Bronze Sponsor: € 500, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Dutch and Spanish for 1 year. 4 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
Silver Sponsor: € 1000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Dutch, Chinese and Korean for 1 year. 5 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.

中文简介对于每个学音乐的人来说，在没有老师帮助下的练习是最漫长的。 根据学习水平，练习的时间会占70-95％，这意味着学生大部分时间都要孤军奋战。因此，学生花费大量时间来提高他们的技能，但进展可能缓慢或停滞，这或许会导致其失去兴趣或在某些情况下放弃。因此，我们需要一个软件系统，使个人的练习达到在老师指导下一样的质量。音乐软件ACCENTO是一个将音乐作品与频率、节奏和语音识别技术相结合的教育系统，所有水平的学生都可以在自己的练习中使用该软件。首先，学生弹奏屏幕上的音符，软件继而向用户给出相应评价，包括是否正确和错误。第二步，软件将向用户提供适当的练习，以校正用户弹错的部分。 整个训练基于适当的速度，并循序渐进来提升速度，因此学生将能够在第二步中完全掌握该部分。该软件的培训材料由顶级音乐家设计，包括著名歌曲、自编歌曲和练习曲。 这些曲目根据教学方法，结合不同难度和音乐风格。用户可以选择各种音乐作品， 因此，这种学习方法将满足每个学生的需求。通过教师辅导而获得的质量和强度，也可以在个人的练习当中实现。个人练习对音乐学生来说非常重要，所以学生需要很明智地运用练习时间。以正确的姿势演奏乐器也非常重要，该软件还将提供学生姿势的反馈。使用ACCENTO时，这两组人群将获得相当大的好处：学生
您可以更快地提高演奏技能。
学习变得更有趣了，学生辍学率大幅减少。
通过和程序的互动，如改变速度，学生可以培养自己的内在乐感。
您不会养成错误的习惯，因为您只学习、练习正确和必要的方法。
长远角度看，学生/家长可以节约时间、减少开销。
教师：
教师将提高教学质量。
学习体系会提升，因为练习方式是由顶尖专家设计的。
学生将更好地为课程做好准备，不会做不必要的练习、犯不必要的错误，这使每周的课程更有效率；学生会解决音乐问题，而不是不断纠正学习习惯。
学生的成功将提高教师的声誉。
我们将从以下乐器开始：钢琴，吉他，长笛和小提琴
该软件是开放的，每个用户将能够使用他/她自己的音乐素材。适用于Windows，Apple MacOS和, iOS和 Linux（Android即将推出）的免费演示程序（版本0.98）可在我们的网站上下载。说明：当前演示支持以下乐器：钢琴（仅可使用Midi设备录音），吉他，长笛和小提琴（仅可通过内置麦克风录音）。 在下一个版本中将添加支持使用钢琴和midi录制吉他的麦克风录音。我们的上一个视频中描述了该用法。主页：https://www.accento.appFree Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/demo-zhFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoAppInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoapp/推特：https://twitter.com/AccentoApp如果您有任何问题，请与我们联系： office@bacco.co.at权限您可以以折扣价格购买各种产品组合（请参阅权限）。该软件兼容iOS，OSX，Android，Windows和Linux（所有发行版)，可以在电脑、平板或者手机上运行，并且提供英语、德语、西班牙语、荷兰语、中文和韩语（其他语种按照需求提供）版本。安卓系统从5.0版开始支持。
该软件将提供以下语言版本：英语、德语、西班牙语、荷兰语、韩语和中文（可根据要求提供其他语言）。
50欧元，1个许可证（3个设备，可自由选择PC、平板电脑或智能手机）+一次升级到Accento 2.0。
100欧元，2个许可证+一次升级到Accento 2.0。
150欧元，3个许可证+一次升级到Accento 2.0.
铜牌赞助商：500欧元，您的名字将用德语、英语和西班牙语在产品上显示一年。 同时获得4个许可证和1次升级。
银牌赞助商：1000欧元，您的名字将用德语、英语、西班牙语、荷兰语、中文和韩语在产品上显示一年。 同时获得5个许可证和1次升级。
金牌赞助商：2000欧元，您的名字将用德语、英语、西班牙语、荷兰语、中文和韩语在产品上显示两年。 同时获得6个许可证和1次升级。
白金赞助商：5000欧元，您的名字将用德语、英语、西班牙语、荷兰语、中文和韩语在产品上显示三年。 同时获得7个许可证和1次升级。
 한국어짧은 요약음악을 배우는 학생들에게 있어서 교사의 도움 없이 홀로 연습하는 시간은 각자의 수준에 따라 대략 70-95%로 나타나며 이는 대부분의 시간을 혼자서 보낸다는 것을 의미합니다.이처럼 학생들은 많은 시간을 실력 향상을 위해 투자하지만 진전이 더디거나 정체될 수 있으며 이는 결과적으로 흥미를 잃거나 경우에 따라 도중에 포기하게 되는 원인이 되기도 합니다.따라서 해결책으로, 레슨의 질을 연습으로 고스란히 이어줄 시스템이 필요합니다.음악 소프트웨어인 ACCENTO는 음악 작품들과 주파수, 리듬, 음색 인식 기술이 결합된 교육 시스템이며 모든 수준의 학생들이 본인의 연습에서 이 소프트웨어를 사용할 수 있습니다.사용자는 화면에 표시된 음표(연주 과제)를 연주한 뒤 올바르게 연주한 부분과 잘못 연주한 부분에 대한 피드백을 받게 되며 두번째 단계에서는 프로그램이 사용자가 잘못 연주한 부분을 바로잡을 수 있는 적절한 연습 방법을 제시합니다. 전체적인 훈련은 적절한 속도와 점진적인 템포의 증가를 바탕으로 이루어지므로 이 두번째 단계를 거치면 해당 부분을 완전히 숙달할 수 있게 될 것입니다. 이 프로그램의 교육 자료들은 최고의 음악가들이 디자인 하였으며 잘 알려진 곡들을 포함하여 자체적으로 제작한 곡들, 연습방법, 그리고 에튀드 등으로 구성되어 있습니다. 이 곡들은 교육학적인 수업방안에 따라 구성 되었으며 각기 다른 난이도와 음악 스타일과 결합되었으므로 모든 레벨에서 다양한 음악 작품을 선택할 수 있습니다. 따라서 이 학습은 사용자의 요구를 충족시킬 것입니다.사람과의 개인 교습을 통해 얻을 수 있는 퀄리티와 강도는 연습 시간으로도 이어져야 합니다. 음악가에게 있어서 연습은 매우 중요하므로 이를 잘 관리할 필요가 있습니다.또한 올바른 자세로 악기를 연주하는 것도 굉장히 중요하며 이 프로그램은 사용자의 자세에 대한 피드백도 제공할 것입니다.두 그룹은 ACCENTO를 사용시 상당한 이점을 얻을 것입니다.학생 :더 빠른 속도로 실력을 향상시킬 수 있습니다.지속적으로 교육을 재미있게 할 수 있기 때문에 도중에 포기할 염려를 줄일 수 있습니다.프로그램과 다양한 상호 작용을 통해 본인만의 연습 체계를 만들어 나갈 수 있습니다.정확하고 필요한 기술들만을 배우고 연습하기 때문에 잘못 된 습관을 가지지 않을것입니다.돈을 절약할 수 있습니다.교사:교육의 질을 향상시킬 수 있습니다.교사의 명성은 학생들의 성공으로 인하여 향상됩니다.학생들은 특별히 숙련 된 전문가가 디자인 한 실습을 통해 본인의 연습 시스템을 향상시킬 것입니다.학생들이 더욱 준비된 상태로 수업에 임하게 되어 불필요한 작업이 줄어들고 더욱 더 효과적인 수업으로 이어지게 될 것입니다.우리는 다음과 같은 악기부터 시작합니다 : 피아노, 기타, 플룻, 그리고 바이올린소프트웨어는 공개되어있으며 모든 사용자가 자신의 음악 재료들을 사용할 수 있습니다.Windows, Apple MacOS, iOS 및 Linux (Android는 곧 제공됨) 용 무료 데모 프로그램 (버전 0.98)은 당사 웹 사이트에서 다운로드 할 수 있습니다.설명 : 현재 데모는 피아노 (레코드는 미디 장치에서만 가능), 기타, 플루트 및 바이올린 (내장 마이크를 통해서만 레코딩 가능)과 같은 악기를 지원합니다. 다음 릴리스에서는 피아노와 기타로 녹음 된 미디 레코드에 대한 지원이 추가 될 예정입니다. 앱 사용법은 마지막 동영상에 설명되어 있습니다.웹 :  https://www.accento.appFree Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/demo-ko페이스북: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoAppInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoapp트위터: https://twitter.com/AccentoApp만일 결제에 문제가 있으면 office@bacco.co.at로 연락하십시오.특전 :당신은 다양하게 조합 된 상품들을 (특전참조) 할인된 가격으로 만나보실 수 있습니다.이 소프트웨어는 iOS, OSX, Android, Windows 및 Linux (모든 배포판)과 호환되며 영어, 독일어, 스페인어, 중국어와 한국어 (요청시 다른 언어) 등으로 데스크탑, 태블릿 PC, 스마트폰에서 실행하실 수 있습니다.Android는 버전 5.0부터 지원됩니다.50유로, 라이센스 1개 (3개의 기기, PC와 태블릿, 스마트 폰에서 자유롭게 선택 가능) + Accento 2.0 으로의 주요 업그레이드가 한번 제공됩니다.100유로, 2개의 라이센스와Accento 2.0 으로의 주요 업그레이드가 한번 제공됩니다.150유로, 3개의 라이센스와Accento 2.0 으로의 주요 업그레이드가 한번 제공됩니다.Bronze Sponsor: 500유로, 귀하의 이름은 독일어, 영어 및 스페인어로 1년간 제품에 명시되며. 4 개의 라이센스와 1 개의 주요 업그레이드가 포함되어 있습니다.Silver Sponsor: 1000유로, 귀하의 이름은 독일어, 영어 및 스페인어로 1년간 제품에 명시되며. 5 개의 라이센스와 1 개의 주요 업그레이드가 포함되어 있습니다.Gold Sponsor: 2000유로, 귀하의 이름은 독일어, 영어, 스페인어,  중국어 및 한국어로 2년간 제품에 명시되며. 6개의 라이센스와 1 개의 주요 업그레이드가 포함되어 있습니다.Platinum Sponsor: 5000유로, 귀하의 이름은 독일어, 영어, 스페인어,  중국어 및 한국어로 3년간 제품에 명시되며. 7개의 라이센스와 1 개의 주요 업그레이드가 포함되어 있습니다.DeutschKurzbeschreibungFür jeden Musiker stellt die Übungszeit ohne Lehrer den weitaus größten Musizierzeitraum dar. Je nach Niveau nimmt die Übungszeit zwischen 70-95% der gesamten Spielzeit ein. Diese weitaus überwiegende Zeit verbringt der Musiker ohne seinen Lehrer, er/sie ist auf sich allein gestellt.Allerdings verschenken Schüler in der Übungszeit sehr viel Entwicklungspotenzial, wodurch der Fortschritt kleiner ist, oder stagniert. Die Folge ist mangelnde Lust und nicht selten der Abbruch.Als Lösung ist ein System notwendig, welches die Qualität des Unterrichts in die Übungszeit überträgt.Die Musik-Lernsoftware Accento kombiniert Frequenz,  Rhythmus und Klangfarbe-Erkennungs-Technik begleitet mit einem umfassend didaktisch aufgebauten System von Musikstücken. Musikschüler aller Leistungsstufen sollen die Software vor allem zu Hause in den Übungsstunden verwenden.Der Musiker spielt die am Bildschirm/Display markierten Noten (Spielaufgabe) und erhält nach dem Spiel eine Rückmeldung über richtig und falsch gespielte Noten. Im zweiten Schritt durchläuft das Programm mit dem Schüler passende Übungen – vorgeschlagen vom Programm und je nach Fehlerstellen des Schülers vom Programm ausgewählt - um die gespielten Fehler zu korrigieren. Sämtliche Übungen erfolgen in passenden Spielgeschwindigkeiten und kleinen Temposteigerungen, sodass am Ende der Korrektureinheit (2. Schritt) die Spielaufgabe garantiert bewältigt wird. Das Notenmaterial wird von Spitzenmusikern konzipiert und besteht aus bekannten und selbst komponierten Liedern, Übungen, Etüden. Die Musikstücke sind in ein didaktisches Lernkonzept eingebunden und aufeinander abgestimmt. Verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade werden mit verschiedenen Musikstilen kombiniert, sodass auf jedem Niveau viele Musikstücke unterschiedlichster Art gewählt werden können. Somit wird der Lernweg individuell den Bedürfnissen des Schülers angepasst.Die Qualität und Intensität des persönlichen Instrumentalunterrichts mit dem Lehrer soll auf die Übungszeit übertragen werden. Damit soll der Musiker vor allem in der Übungszeit - welche den weitaus größten Teil der gesamten Spielzeit ausmacht - optimal betreut werden.Auch die Körperhaltung beim Spielen eines Instrumentes ist sehr wichtig, unser Programm wird auch ein Feedback  diesbezüglich den Benutzern gebenZwei Zielgruppen erzielen mit der Verwendung von Accento einen erheblichen Nutzen:SCHÜLER:
Der Schüler steigert die Lerngeschwindigkeit.
Die Schüler haben durch dauerhafte Lernerfolge Spaß mit ihrem Instrument. Die Abbruchsquote der Schüler sinkt.
Die Schüler/Eltern sparen langfristig Zeit und Geld!
Durch die Interaktion mit dem Programm und den verschiedenen Tempos hat der Lernende eine konstante metrische Führung, wodurch dieser eine innere Metrik entwickeln kann.
Man lernt /übt nur die richtigen Fertigkeiten und man festigt nicht falsche Angewohnheiten.  
LEHRER:
Die Lehrer unterrichten erfolgreicher.
Die Reputation der Lehrer wird durch die Erfolge seiner Schüler gesteigert.
Der Schüler wird eine Übungsdisziplin entwickeln, welche speziell ausgebildeten Fachkräfte gestalten
Der Schüler kommt besser vorbereitet zur Stunde, macht weniger unnötige Fehler, was die wöchentliche Arbeit vereinfachen wird, da es möglich sein wird an den musikalischen Problemen zu arbeiten anstatt falsch gelernte Abläufe andauernd korrigieren zu müssen.
Wir beginnen mit folgenden Instrumenten: Klavier, Gitarre, Querflöte und ViolineDie Software ist offen, jeder Benutzer wird in der Lage sein sein eigenes Notenmaterial zu verwenden.Ein kostenloses Demo-Programm (Version 0.98) für Windows, Apple MacOS ,iOS und Linux (Android in Kürze verfügbar) steht auf unserer Website zum Download bereit.Beschreibung: Die aktuelle Demo unterstützt die folgenden Instrumente: Klavier (Aufnahme nur mit einem MIDI-Gerät möglich), Gitarre, Flöte und Violine (Aufnahme nur über das eingebaute Mikrofon möglich). Unterstützung für Mikrofonaufnahmen mit Piano und MIDI-Aufnahme mit Gitarre wird in den nächsten Releases hinzugefügt.Web: https://www.accento.appFree Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/demo-deFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoAppInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoappTwitter: https://twitter.com/AccentoAppBitte kontaktieren Sie uns unter office@bacco.co.at falls sie Probleme haben um die Zahlung durchzuführen.Perks:Ihr bekommt die Software in verschiedenen Kombinationen (siehe Perks)  gegen einen ermäßigten Preis (44% Rabatt).Die Software wird für iOS, OSX, Android, Windows und Linux - (alle Distros) -und es wird auf Computer, Tablets oder Handys laufen, vorerst auf English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (bald verfügbar: Suomi, 日本語, andere Sprachen nach Anfrage).Android wird ab Version 5.0 unterstützt.
Sprachen: English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (bald verfügbar: Suomi, 日本語,  andere Sprachen nach Anfrage).
€50, 1 Lizenz(3 Geräte, PC, Tablet oder Handy frei wählbar) plus 1 major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
€100, 2 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
 €150, 3 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
Bronze Sponsor: €500, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch und Spanisch für 1 Jahr. 4 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
Silver Sponsor: €1000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 1 Jahr. 5 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
Gold Sponsor: €2000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 2 Jahre. 6 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
Platinum Sponsor: €5000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 3 Jahr. 7 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
EspañolDescripciónLa práctica de un instrumento sin la compañía de un docente representa para cada músico el periodo más prolongado de la práctica musical. De acuerdo al nivel del instrumentista, la práctica individual representa entre el 70 y el 95% del tiempo total de ejecución. Durante todo ese tiempo cada músico ejercita su instrumento sin la presencia de su maestro, el/ella depende solo de si mismo.No obstante la mayor parte de los estudiantes de música desperdicia una gran cantidad de potencial durante la práctica diaria, la evolución es mínima o en su defecto se produce un estancamiento. El resultado es insuficiente motivación y con mucha frecuencia el abandono de la práctica musical.Como solución es necesario crear un sistema que traslade la calidad de las clases a la práctica diaria.El Software de pedagogia musical Accento combina el reconocimiento de la frecuencia, el ritmo y el timbre siendo acompañado por un sistema pedagógico de obras progresivas. Los estudiantes de todas las edades y niveles usarán el Software sobre todo en sus hogares durante la práctica de sus respectivos instrumentos. Los músicos tocarán las piezas mostradas en la pantalla de sus dispositivos, y una vez finalizada la ejecución tendrán la oportunidad de visualizar los errores realizados. A continuación el programa le sugerirá al usuario ejercicios técnicos para corregir los errores cometidos. Los ejercicios serán ejecutados con una aceleración gradual del Tempo, para garantizar de esta manera la culminación exitosa de la pieza correspondiente.Las piezas de los métodos serán concebidas por renombrados pedagogos comprendiendo las obras más importantes de la literatura de cada instrumento, así como arreglos propios. Diferentes estilos y niveles de dificultad serán combinados de manera que en cada nivel sea posible escoger diferentes piezas, posibilitando de esta manera la elección de un recorrido individual que se adapte a las exigencias o problemas de cada alumno.De esta forma la calidad e intensidad de las clases instrumentales serán trasladadas a la práctica diaria. Así será posible aprovecharla al máximo y acelerar considerablemente el aprendizaje musical.La postura es también muy importante al tocar un instrumento. Nuestro programa también ofrecerá un  control sobre posibles errores de postura durante la ejecución.Dos grupos de usuarios percibirán con el uso de Accento enormes beneficios:ESTUDIANTES
El estudiante podrá aprender con más rapidez     
A través de su mejoría le será posible disfrutar la actividad musical.
Los estudiantes / padres ahorrarán tiempo y dinero.
Desarrolla el pulso interno, ya que al interactuar con el programa y los diferentes metros el estudiante tendrá una guía métrica constante.
Habrá una supervisión constante del estudio diario, con lo cual será posible ahorrar el tiempo que se pierde cuando se aprende algo mal. Solo se aprenden lecciones positivas, de esta manera el aprendizaje no se construye en base a la corrección de malos hábitos.
DOCENTES
Los docentes podrán mejorar la calidad de su enseñanza. Finalmente será posible trabajar los aspectos importantes de las obras durante las clases.
Su reputación crecerá a través de los éxitos de sus alumnos.
 El alumno desarrollará una disciplina de estudio pre-estructurada por especialistas y vendrá a clase con un trabajo previo carente de errores. Esto le facilitará el trabajo y le permitirá concentrarse más en temas musicales que en solucionar problemas de solfeo.
Los primeros métodos de aprendizaje disponibles serán para piano, guitarra, violín y flauta traversa. El Software es de todas maneras abierto, cada usuario podrá usar su propio material.El programa es abierto, o sea a cada usuario le será posible usar sus propias partituras, o confeccionar sus propios métodos de aprendizaje si así lo desea.Un programa de demostración gratuito (versión 0.98) para Windows, Apple MacOS, iOS y Linux (Android próximamente) está disponible para descargar en nuestro sitio webDescripción: la demostración actual es compatible con los siguientes instrumentos: piano (solo se puede grabar con un dispositivo Midi), guitarra, flauta y violín (solo se puede grabar con el micrófono incorporado). El soporte para grabación de micrófono con piano y midi con guitarra se agregará en las próximas versiones.Web en español: https://www.accento.appFree Demo-Program: https://www.bacco.co.at/demo-esFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/AccentoAppInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/accentoappTwitter: https://twitter.com/AccentoAppContáctenos en caso de que tenga problemas en realizar el pago bajo office@bacco.co.atPerks:Vosotros recibiréis el producto en diferentes combinaciones (véase Perks) con un descuento aproximado del 44%El Software será realizado para iOS, OSX; Android (Android 5 o más elevado), Windows y Linux (todas las distribuciones) y funcionará en computadoras, tabletas y teléfonos móviles. La primera versión será lanzada en English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (próximamente: Suomi, 日本語, otros idiomas a petición).
El Software estará disponible en los siguientes idiomas:  English, Deutsch, Castellano, 中文, 한국어, Dansk, Norsk, Svenska, Français, Nederlands, Português, Italiano (próximamente: Suomi, 日本語, otros idiomas a petición).
€50 1 licencia (3 dispositivos, PC, tableta y teléfono móbil) así como un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
€100 2 licencias y un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
€150 3 licencias y un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
Bronze Sponsor: €500, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés y alemán por 1 año, además de ello recibirá 4 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
Silver Sponsor: €1000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 1 año, además de ello recibirá 5 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
Gold Sponsor: €2000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 2 años, además de ello recibirá 6 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
Platinum Sponsor: €5000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 3 años, además de ello recibirá 7 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.

story:
This book consists of nursery rhymes and fairy tales next to beautiful full-page illustrations.  Why is it unique?  These classic tales are written as Python programs! 

Python is one of the most popular programming languages in the world. Don’t worry if you’re not familiar with Python- you’ll learn all the basics in this book, with no programming experience required!  If you’ve already gotten started with Python, reinforce your knowledge and logical thinking with more code examples!

 

When you run the book’s Python programs on your computer, you’ll see the nursery rhymes and fairy tales printed out on your screen! Each spread in the book consists of a code page next to a full-page illustration depicting the scene.

Each code page has a full nursery rhyme or partial fairy tale (spread over multiple code pages) written in English above its associated Python program. The program’s code is explained below it.

Before this program, Goldilocks tries the three bowls of porridge and the three chairs…you know the story! :) 

Most of the nursery rhymes output the original verse word-for-word on the screen, while some output the story in a slightly different manner (ex. Piggy #1 instead of This little piggy).

This program outputs The Muffin Man word-for-word.

Each program demonstrates one or more new Python concepts.  You can run all the programs on your computer! Python is free to download and install. You can also use a free online Python interpreter.

The programs print output to the screen with print functions.

You can modify the code and see how the story changes (ex. turn The Muffin Man into The Cupcake Man)!

 

 

You’ll also enjoy the whimsical art depicting the classic stories!

Python is a popular, easy to learn programming language. It’s used in many fields including data science, scientific computing, AI, machine learning, web development, and game development. It’s also used to program educational/hobbyist hardware platforms like the Raspberry Pi and micro:bit boards.

Programming enhances important life skills including logical thinking, planning, organization, problem solving, and creativity.

This book is for all ages! Older readers will enjoy revisiting classic nursery rhymes and fairy tales in a new (logical!) light.

Hi, I‘m Shari Eskenas! I'm passionate about being creative and inventing useful consumer products.  I started Sundae Electronics with the mission of bringing innovative product ideas to life.   

Learn Python through Nursery Rhymes and Fairy Tales is the third book I’m creating.  I’ve had two successful Kickstarter campaigns for programming books: A Day in Code (C programming, 2020) and A Day in Code: Python (2021).

These books tell a continuous story (written in code, of course!) about a fun day. They have been released on Amazon and other retailers. Here are some reviews of A Day in Code- Python:

"I am very impressed with A Day in Code: Python and highly recommend it for anyone wanting to learn Python as well as those who want to expose children to important life skills they can acquire through learning computer coding." - Michael Knight, GeekDad

"What a unique idea for a children's book. It takes the most popular software teaching language and makes it accessible to younger kids." - Michael Kennedy, Host of the Talk Python to Me and Python Bytes podcasts

"This book provides an overview of many constructs in the Python programming language in a fun way through the eyes of kids and would be a great supplement for anyone interested in learning Python. The examples are centered around two kids who are writing programs to document their day. For anyone learning Python, both adults and kids, this book helps to show practically how to think like a computer as a person walks through everyday activities." - Jeffrey Miller, Professor of Computer Science Practice, University of Southern California (USC)

The concept of Learn Python through Nursery Rhymes and Fairy Tales is similar to these books- but you already know the stories. :) I can't wait to bring these classic cherished tales into a new form and deliver a beautiful book to you.

Books will be made in the USA and shipped via USPS. International backers will be responsible for any import duties/fees and VAT tax that may be levied.

Digital copies are included for all rewards (the PDF and e-books in MOBI and EPUB formats).

If you would like to pre-order more than four books, please contact us at hello@sundaelectronics.com

 

Questions or comments? We’d love to hear from you! Send us a message, leave a comment, or email us at hello@sundaelectronics.com

story:
DIPLE - The Revolutionary Microscope for Any Smartphone 

This easy to use, compact, and portable kit transforms any smartphone and tablet into a POWERFUL microscope. Whether you use it for research, education, or just for fun, from the observation of microorganisms or cells to mineralogy and materials science, with DIPLE anyone can access the microworld in detail!

 

3 different objective lenses for 3 different levels of magnification and related applications

Since Spring 2021, all our kits are ready to ship; if we do not ship your DIPLE within 12 days from the order, you can get the full refund.

Here are some of the first messages from our supporters:

DIPLE is capable of giving you 1000x magnification using your smartphone or tablet as a monitor. Set up takes seconds - all you need to do is place your camera on the optical system. You can even take pictures and videos in HD!

Pollen grains on DIPLE Grey - courtesy of Margaret Frank, Cornell University

Water bear on DIPLE Grey

To make sure that DIPLE is truly portable for exploration on the go, we have designed it to easily withstand being dropped - even from the third floor of a building (yes, we did the test!). Available in single or coupled lenses depending on the level of magnification required, such an advanced system has never been used for microscopy on smartphones (it is patent pending). DIPLE provides an unprecedented quality of image for a budget microscope.

DIPLE (prototype version 2019) for observing human blood cells - Photo courtesy of Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia

Here is the first feedback from our beta-testers:

The concept

After the great success of the BLIPS kits, our team needed something to get deeper into the microworld. DIPLE is the answer - a completely NEW CONCEPT, to overcome the limits of Blips for microscopic inspection at a smaller scale.

We’ve come back to Kickstarter after three years of development and we can’t wait to bring our community a new view of the world. 

 

Key features

LIGHT, COMPACT, AND PORTABLE: The whole DIPLE system can be taken anywhere. Measuring in at 17,6cm length, 10cm width and 4cm in height, it’s actually smaller than the box your smartphone came in!

EXTREMELY POWERFUL: You can clearly see cellular details, and even bacteria! Thanks to its great optical power, you can digitally zoom the image for achieving an overall MAGNIFICATION OF 1000X before getting any pixelation (with optical resulution below 1 micron).

OBJECTIVE LENS: Unlike other products, having the objective lens separate to the phone camera ensures an easier way to find the ideal focal distance, even for EXTRA THIN samples (e.g. blood cells). It also means that it does not depend on the shape of your phone, so it works with all types.

IMMERSION MICROSCOPY: The flat surfaces of the magnifying objective lenses can work when immersed in transparent liquids.

MODULAR: This means that you can upgrade your system in the future, getting new single spare parts, or use it for your own optical improvements.

DURABLE: The innovative objective lens of DIPLE is made with metal, meaning the objective lens can drop from 10 meters (33 ft) without issue.

NO FUSS:  To keep set up as simple hassle free as possible, you don’t need to remove your phone / tablet case as you would with other products

EXTRA-FINE REGULATION (SUB-MICRON) OF THE FOCAL DISTANCE: A purposefully designed mechanical system allows you to move toward or away from your sample with extreme precision, always obtaining the perfect focus.

 

ORIGINAL DESIGN: The patent pending design is unique, you do not have to add or clamp anything to the body of your phone.

CARRYING BOX: It’s not just a container, but a functional part of the product. It is the mechanical support for all the components when you are using the product.

AFFORDABLE PRICE: How many portable microscopes allowing you to see bacteria are sold at about 100USD? 

People who love DIPLE

 

 

Find your perfect DIPLE

There are three versions of DIPLE objective lenses for microscopy in transmitted light + the new DIPLE LUX for exploring the microscopic details of opaque surfaces.

 

 

DIPLE RED, providing 35x REAL magnifications - resolution of 3 micron, field of view of around 1 mm - to see cells, microorganisms (protozoans, rotifers, water bears...);

DIPLE GREY, providing 75x REAL magnifications - resolution of 1 micron - to see bacteria, cells, protozoans…

DIPLE BLACK, providing 150x REAL magnifications - resolution of 0,7/0,8 micron - to see cell details, bacteria…

These values must then be multiplied by the digital zoom of your device, allowing for magnification of even more than 1000x (without pixelation) and the ability to see details of less than 1 micron (1/1000 mm) in size.

DIPLE LUX is made up of a DIPLE objective lens, plus a compact EXTRA LIGHT SOURCE for lateral illumination of the samples; a new system specifically designed to work on opaque subjects to observe the tiniest details of their surfaces, out of the DIPLE box.

This version of DIPLE has been released during the Kickstarter campaign for responding the requests of many backers that asked for a DIPLE model to check microscopic details of thick, or non-transparent samples. DIPLE LUX has a light source connected to the objective tile and it does not need to be attached to the phone; these two features make DIPLE LUX a product compatible with all the phone models. Here you can see the current product and the original prototype.

 Diple Lux on a microfiber cloth

How DIPLE works

DIPLE is a compact and portable box containing a light source, a stage for samples/microscope, slides and a sturdy metal plate with an optical system.

It’s straightforward to use, just lay your phone or tablet over the box, focusing the camera into the lighting hole. With the help of a magnetic guide, the objective lens and light source are automatically placed in the proper position. 

Stage types

There are two different sample stages for you to pick from:

The standard stage: a simple mechanical support for your samples, where you can shift your slide manually for scanning your sample under the DIPLE lens.

( DIPLE ITEMS WITH STANDARD STAGE ARE READY TO SHIP, RIGHT NOW! )

OR

The fine stage: the slide can be shifted by mechanical screws, for a precise search of microscopic targets. The box has lateral V-shaped apertures, for allowing an easy handling of the samples, or for scanning slides over a large field.

 

What you can see with DIPLE

There are loads of reasons for using DIPLE, whether you're using it for research, learning, or just to see more of the world! From the observation of microorganisms or cells to mineralogy and materials science, with DIPLE, anyone can observe the microworld in detail and save it directly to your phone, in high definition.

 

Here are some ideas for what you could use it for:

1. See your own blood cells 

Take a tiny drop of blood and smear it on a plain glass slide. You should see only a light pink shadow. Cover it with a thin transparent plastic foil. Observe it like a standard prepared slide. You should process these cells with staining and fixing steps to get them to stay on the glass for a long time, and keep the red color. However, you are able to see the fresh cells for some minutes after their deposition even without more complex procedures.

In this short video you will see how to conduct this experiment to see your own red blood cells. In case you wanted to replicate this experiment please be careful: work in a proper environment and use only sterile lancets.

 

2. Micro-organisms

Collect some moss, keeping its roots in tact and with the dirt on, and place the sample in a small container, with a little water. Let it rest in the water for 1-2 days, in a warm climate. Take a drop of dirty water from the moss and put it on a glass slide. Take your 35x objective (in some cases also 75x will work fine) and lay it on the water. The objective can work in immersion, i.e. in direct contact with the water, or you can lay a plastic foil upon the liquid sample to keep it thin. Scan the sample under the objective, until you see some micro-organisms moving around, then you can zoom in to watch them in detail. When you've finished your observations, clean the objective lens with a wet tissue.

3. Bacteria

Create your own colony of bacteria by placing a mixture of nutrients (the most common is agar agar, usually mixed with meat broth) in a petri dish. Then, you can help the colonies grow by swabbing a place rich in bacteria like your mouth, your hands, or a handful of dirt and then swabbing the bacteria on the petri dish together with the nutrients. After doing this, you need to close the dish to avoid contamination and put it in a warm, safe place. After a few days (or, in some cases, even a few hours), you will get a nice collection of bacteria colonies, ready to be observed in detail. 

The particulate matter emitted by many car engines can be observed on DIPLE. In this video you will see this simple test, conducted by our team. We put a plain microscope slide near the exhaust tube of a car, stepped on the gas and then observed the result on our DIPLE set. The result is outstanding. 

 

 Actual magnification 

Most low-budget microscopes declare false or exaggerated magnifications; see this comparison between DIPLE Red, the version which provides the lower magnification (35x REAL magnifications, multiplied by digital zoom) and a standard USB microscope (with maximum declared magnification 1000x, according to the manufacturer). In this video the two microscopes examine the same prepared slide, a botanical section. You will notice that there is a huge difference in detail, quality of the image, and definition.

 
 

HOW to use DIPLE - set up in SECONDS

In this short video tutorial we show how to use DIPLE, with Standard Stage:

And here you can see a tutorial of DIPLE with Fine Stage: 

Timeline

  •  Spring 2015 - Our first venture in microscopy begins with the creation of the initial Blips prototype
  •  January 2016 - The final prototype of Blips is complete
  •  February 2016 - SmartMicroOptics officially launches as a company
  •  Mid-2016 - Our Blips campaign goes live on Kickstarter
  •  August 2016 - The first Blips lenses are shipped to our backers
  •  Mid-2017 - The first DIPLE prototype is created
  •  First months of 2018 - The DIPLE project is developed with constant improvements on optical performance, reliability, and design
  •  End of 2018/first months of 2019 - The first complete prototypes are finished and sent to beta-testers
  •  Fall 2019 - Based on the feedback from beta-testers, the complete, fully-functional version of DIPLE, is ready to enter the global market, and our Kickstarter/Indiegogo campaigns good to go!
  •  January 2020 - DIPLE’s manufacturing phase begins
  •  May 2020 - DIPLE is ready for shipping!
  • September 2020 - First batches of DIPLE shipped worldwide!

Our journey so far

Following the launch of Blips, the SMO team wanted to push the magnification on mobile devices to an even higher level. In the last three years, we have worked on the development of a completely different system, based on a new design, combining very powerful micro-lenses with an aluminium cast that protects them from any damage.

A mosquito head on a prepared slide, on DIPLE Red&Standard

We have built prototypes, and they have been tested by scientists and researchers from top colleges and research institutions around the world, including Harvard University and the University of Cambridge.

We have also tested the durability of DIPLE. The objectives can withstand a 10-meter fall and still work perfectly! We conducted tests and launched one of our lenses from the second floor, then we used it to see red blood cells. Everything worked perfectly, as if nothing had happened! You can see the full footage of this test HERE. 

 

The Team

SmartMicroOptics S.r.l. (SMO) is a spin-off of the Italian Institute of Technology (IIT). Founded in 2016, the company made a breakthrough in the field of mobile microscopy thanks to a brand new technology, the Blips lenses & labkits, which we launched on Kickstarter in mid-2016.

Our team is young and made up of diverse personalities, with a variety of experience and skills. We’ve got the perfect combination of creativity, technical, and commercial abilities to ensure we create only high-quality products as well as deliver a reliable customer service.

 

ALL PICTURES AND VIDEOS OF THE MICRO-WORLD ON THIS CAMPAIGN WERE TAKEN WITH DIPLE LENSES AND COMMON SMARTPHONES

story:
Petoi Bittle is a tiny but powerful robot that can play tricks like real animals. We fine-tuned every bit to fit agile maneuverability into a palm-sized robot pet. You can bring Bittle to life by assembling its puzzle-like frame and downloading our demo codes on GitHub. You can also teach it new skills to win prizes in our community challenges. Bittle makes a perfect tool for learning, teaching, researching, or a surprising gift to impress your family and friends. Bittle is not a toy for small kids. We recommend parental guidance to appreciate its rich content and avoid damage or injury.

 

Bittle walking on the desk

Evolving with an open-source gene, Bittle is an open platform to fuse multiple makers' gadgets into one organic system. With our customized Arduino board coordinating all instinctive and sophisticated movements, you can clip on various sensors to bring in perception. You could also inject artificial intelligence capabilities by mounting a Raspberry Pi or other AI chips through wired/wireless connections.

Ball tracking with an intelligent camera mounted on the head
 

Bittle is the second product of OpenCat, sibling of Nybble. Backed by a worldwide user group, you can find many tutorials and project ideas on the Internet. We make constant but tiny progresses every day. You can follow our social media (Instagram/Twitter @PetoiCamp) to get more frequent updates than newsletters. By posting on our forum, you can contribute to the community or simply make your wishes heard. We are always drawing the blueprint for futuristic robots! 

 

Self-righting after falling from a slope (triggered by an infrared remote)

 

Bittle is a palm-sized robot that moves with four legs rather than wheels. Legged motion gives it more freedom to navigate unstructured terrains, and expresses the joy of life whenever it moves. Such dynamic maneuverability was only seen on a few luxury robots from the best labs or tycoon companies previously, such as Boston Dynamics Spot or Sony Aibo. We came up with a grassroots solution to simplify the system to make it affordable and mass-producible.

 

Walk the dog. Click the image to see a longer clip.

 

Bittle is a compact system of five major components: body frame, actuator, electronics, battery, and the software to coordinate all the hardware to perform varied tasks. 

Body frame

We designed Bittle's interlocking frame as a 3D puzzle with very few screws involved. Most body parts are symmetric for simplicity and aesthetics. 

Puzzle-like body frame. Click the image for the full assembling animation.

It's a pleasure to assemble and disassemble Bittle for teaching or maintenance. On average, it takes about one hour to put together the body from scratch.

 

Build a robot dog on your own!

Each piece has gone through tens of iterations with 3D printing. We then use high strength injection-molded plastic to provide the best protection from collision and dust (it's NOT waterproof!). In the stress tests, the assembled robot can take an adult's stepping without breaking any components (do NOT try this at home!).  

 

Rolling down a step. Click the image for the full review video.

We also designed Bittle to be soft. Besides the elasticity of the material, the spring-loaded upper legs flatten the shock on joint servos to protect their gears. Bittle usually survives regular collisions. In the extreme cases, it will disintegrate at the designated "weak link in the chain", which is easy and cheap to reinstall or replace.

 

Passive compliant joints

We designed the frame to be compatible with most 9g servos. You could order the "Bittle Shell" perk alone to compile your spare servos into a beautiful action figure!

Actuator

We visited several servo manufacturers and iterated many times to find the optimized parameters. It will be model P1S, a slim, fast servo with a controllable angle of 270 degrees.

P1S servo

We use nine P1S servos to actuate Bittle. Eight of them are for walking joints, and one is for head panning. We will also include one spare servo for replacement, as brushed motors are consumable after a certain period of wearing. You may order the "Bittle Servo Set" perk if you expect to use Bittle intensively for teaching or researching.

Electronics

Bittle is driven by NyBoard V1, a customized Arduino board with rich peripherals. We fully utilized the chip of a regular Arduino Uno to coordinate sophisticated motions. The board can drive at least 12 PWM servos, and an IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) is used for balancing. It stores "muscle memory" and detects body status (orientation and acceleration) for balancing. We provide an infrared remote to trigger basic movements. The board also listens to string commands from the serial port, such as "walk", "sit", or more detailed instructions for individual joints. 

NyBoard V1

NyBoard V1 is a revision of NyBoard V0 that has been driving 2000 Nybbles all over the world. We continue to provide a 2x5 socket on NyBoard V1 for mounting Raspberry Pi. It powers the Pi and communicates with it through the serial or I2C network. The Pi gives Bittle the ability to analyze more sensory data, get connected to the Internet, and make decisions by itself. Due to Bittle's small size, it best fits Pi Zero and Pi 3A+. For larger Pi models, you will need to tilt the Pi and 3D print some supporting structures. 

Raspberry Pi 3 A+ and Pi camera on Bittle

Thanks to the Arduino and Raspberry Pi community, you can find many customization ideas for Bittle. There are four Seeed Grove sockets on NyBoard V1 for extensible modules. To make installation easier, we designed Bittle's head as a clip to bite on those modules. That explains why we created a dog out of OpenCat this time. There's also a screw hole inside Bittle's head for fixing additional modules. 

Extensible modules

We developed a Bluetooth dongle for wirelessly uploading codes and controlling Bittle from PC or smartphone Apps. We also developed a WiFi dongle for wirelessly communicating with Bittle. You can play with Bittle without messing around with cables. Wireless is also essential when you are studying balancing related motion planning. You can even utilize the computational power of a remote "brain" without being constrained by Bittle's size and cargo capacity. The dongles are compatible with our previous Nybble model. 

Bluetooth and WiFi dongles

Furthermore, we are developing an ESP32 development board with native Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity. We have made a functional beta version called the "BiBoard V0" perk for developers. We expect a considerable performance boost, and you are welcome to join our exploration.

BiBoard V0

Software

Bittle is driven by our OpenCat code. It has 3K lines of Arduino codes excluding 3rd party libraries. It defines the minimal data structure and algorithms for performing quadruped motion. We also provide example commander and parser in Python so that you can send instructions from other devices. The code is already running on thousands of small quadruped robots, including many variants of OpenCat.  

The OpenCat codes are open source on Github

You can program Bittle at different levels in various coding environments, such as C in Arduino IDE and Python in the terminal. We are collaborating with TinkerGen, a STEM education company that kindly developed Codecraft (a graphical coding environment) for Bittle. They will also provide a free curriculum for you to learn programming in Codecraft and create a wide array of educational and fun projects with it!

 

You can code in Arduino IDE, Python, Codecraft, and many other environments

We plan to refactor Bittle's code between the production and release it before Bittle's delivery. You may start to explore the current OpenCat repository on GitHub to get familiar with the framework. We will announce new community challenges with huge prizes in the community section!   

 

Bittle climbing up a step under realtime instructions sent through Bluetooth

Battery

We designed a Li-ion battery pack with a built-in charging and protection circuit. It can slide into the track underneath Bittle and tune its center of mass. It can power Bittle for at least one hour of continuous walking. It also has an RGB LED to indicate the battery's status.

Li-ion battery with onboard charging and protection circuit

With the slide-in installation mechanism and an anti-reverse plug, it's not too hard to switch batteries. You may order extra batteries for uninterrupted researching or playing. With some reconfiguration, it can also power our previous Nybble models.

You can check this 30-min interview by Hackster.io for all the cool features. 

 

Bittle is a perfect example to show "small is big". We wanted to encourage people to free their creativity and make wonderful things from limited resources. We have a growing community since the release of the OpenCat demo. We have @petoicamp on social media to update our fans about the progress of the project. After the launch of Nybble, we built the forum on our site (petoi.com) to discuss the project, showcase DIY models, and add function modules. 

Petoi Camp, the OpenCat forum

Looking back at all the challenges we went through, the community was the most significant support that encouraged us to continue. We got thousands of backers to bring Nybble to life. Fans all around the world volunteered to translate our documentation into their languages. And many developers added new features to OpenCat. We cannot wait to see what Bittle will bring to us!  

 

An Android App (Code&Robots) developed by one of our fans

To make our community more productive, educational, and rewarding, we will launch an online challenge for all OpenCat users. You can find our proposed rules in this forum post and give suggestions before it officially starts. In short, we will define several tasks that can be measured quantitatively, e.g., programing Bittle to get onto the highest step. You have to both demo your solution and teach others to validate your entry. On the first day of each month, we will announce the world's record-breaker and gift a free Bittle or Nybble to the winner!

Who will be the first Bittle backflipper and enter our Hall of Fame?

Bittle standing on my fingers

Bittle is 20cm x 11cm x 11cm in dimension. It weighs less than 280g but can carry up to 450g cargo under its belly. With proper programming and calibration, It can run faster than two body lengths per second. Bittle can remember tens of instinctive motion patterns and can perform more fancy tricks with realtime instructions. 

 

Bittle (250g) trotting with an iron cargo (465g)

P1S servo uses a coreless motor, alloy gears, ball bearing, and plastic case. It's 8.4V compatible, high speed, and has a controllable range of 270 degrees.  

Bittle on a treadmill

NyBoard V1 has an Atmega328P with 16MHz CPU, 2K SRAM, and 32K flash. We also added an 8K I2C EEPROM, an IMU, a servo driver for 12 PWM servos, an infrared receiver, and a buzzer. It has a 2x5 socked to mount on a Raspberry Pi. 

BiBoard V0 has an ESP32 with 240MHz dual-core CPU, 520KB SRAM, and up to 16M flash. It has built-in WiFi/Bluetooth, 12 PWM servo pins, an IMU, an infrared receiver, an audio amplifier, and a speaker. It has several communication ports to connect to other devices.  

The Bluetooth dongle is compatible with Windows, macOS, and Android. It can also work on IOS with some auxiliary software. It can be used for uploading Arduino sketch or communicating with the NyBoard. The WiFi module can host a simple WebUI and communicate with the NyBoard. 

BiBoard V0, NyBoard V1 with Raspberry Pi 3 A+, and NyBoard V1 with a Bluetooth dongle

The intelligent camera module is our ODMed product. It integrates multiple vision recognition algorithms running on its ESP32 dual-core processor. It can return recognized human body, objects, and symbols through serial/I2C/WiFi at a rate of 25fps or 50fps. It can even stream video through WiFi. We will also include a deck of symbol cards. You can refer to this link for more information.

Intelligent camera module and the symbol deck

We have been residing in the factory for six months and commit to staying until we start to ship Bittles.    

 

Spark Erosion Machining (EDM) for making precise molds

We have finished 95% percent of the injection molds of the body frame. The lead time for injection production is one week. More funds are required to make the mold for the optional silicone tail and paws. The lead time is one month. We will provide their 3D printing files if they cannot catch up in time. We are still optimizing the parameters of servos for longer life-span. The lead time is at least two months. NyBoard V1 and battery are production-ready, and the suppliers are waiting for down payments for mass production. The lead time is 45 days to 50 days. We also need to design a sturdy and compact packaging box for international shipping. The lead time is one month. 

OpenCat started as the founder Rz Li's pet project in 2016. After the demo video went viral in 2018, he devoted all his time and resources to bring this sophisticated and cute robot to the public. He founded Petoi and successfully crowdfunded the Nybble project in 2018. All the earnings have been put into the fulfillment of Nybble and the R&D of Bittle.

We are still fulfilling Nybble orders for a worldwide audience

Our mission is to bring affordable robotic pets from fiction to reality. We grew from a single maker to a company that can collaborate and negotiate with manufacturers to get the best solutions to our needs. We have many more cool ideas in mind, and Bittle is another small step towards our ideal shape of household robots.

Nybble and Bittle

You can help to bring this project to life by backing a wide selection of perks. The main perk for this campaign is the Bittle kit. 

Bittle kit (the final contents are subject to change)

You can pick your base perk, then choose your add-on items during checkout. You will also need to pay the shipping of your base perk during checkout. We will cover the increased shipping fees of add-on items as a discount. 

We will ship your packages from our Chinese factory with reliable international couriers. Your government will collect the customs tax/fees upon delivery. Note: It can be expensive for some countries and areas. We are very grateful for your support and hope to bring you a unique product ASAP!

  • Dr. Rongzhong Li (Rz)

        Founder and CEO

Rz is a physics PhD and computer science master. He previously taught computer science at Wake Forest University.

Rz is a maker with broad interests in art, literature, and science. He started the OpenCat project in 2016 and successfully launched Nybble in 2018. Devoted to bringing robotic pets to more people, Bittle is his second gift to the world.

  • Lingqing Pi (Len)

        System Engineer

Len has a master's degree in computer communication systems. He has been running various STEM camps over the past five years.

Len likes to try out new electronic products and excels in remembering their parameters. He designed the variant PCBs and communication modules to make Bittle more extensible and user friendly.

  • Kai Mai

        Advisor

Kai is an alumnus of UC Berkeley and Carnegie Mellon University(CMU). He served as the chapter president of Berkeley & CMU alumni network in Shanghai and is the co-president of the Berkeley Chinese Alumni International Association, Silicon Valley Chapter.  He was the VP of Engineering for ALO7, a leading English language learning education technology company in China.

Kai has rich experiences and expertise in startup bootstrapping/fundraising/scaling and project/product/engineering management.  He helps supervise Petoi's management and development.

Hardware products are especially "hard" to deliver compared to pure software products. After two years of experience with Nybble, we foresee the following risks and are working hard to mitigate them. 
 
* Supply chain, cash flow, and inventory management
Any delay in the supply chain could halt production at any stage. We try to solve this by carefully estimating the lead time and divide sequential dependency into parallel processes, and moving the most challenging tasks to our top priority. 

This time we include batteries to avoid users' confusion in picking the right ones. However, the production for 2S Li-ion batteries requires an MOQ of 5000 units. It's a sizeable one-time investment, and the storage of many batteries is also risky. We will rent a dedicated room to store the batteries. We will also optimize the production process to reduce the lagging period between stocking and shipping the batteries. 

* Certificates and international shipping 
Bittle needs to go through several standard tests for importing and exporting certifications. The tests may take up to two months after we send the final products. We took the advice from our experienced manufacturers that the specifications should not be too exceptional. We will reserve Bittle's full dynamic potential to make it a more stable product. 

The breakout of COVID-19 is adding another layer of uncertainty for production and shipping. The factories are subject to close should any case was reported in the area. The international couriers are also having a hard time arranging oversea shipments. There may be a longer wait time between our shipping date and the delivery on your side. 
 
We will ship Bittles worldwide through international couriers that can provide reliable tracking. Backers will be responsible for paying customs and duties. The amount varies by country or region. We may have a few customers canceling their orders if the fees upon delivery are too high. So we want to make sure everyone knows about the shipping policy before they order. 

* Team development
We currently have two people working full-time on the project. We managed to push it to the current stage and will scale up the team in time for the massive amount of work towards fulfilling your orders.
story_txt: Petoi Bittle is a tiny but powerful robot that can play tricks like real animals. We fine-tuned every bit to fit agile maneuverability into a palm-sized robot pet. You can bring Bittle to life by assembling its puzzle-like frame and downloading our demo codes on GitHub. You can also teach it new skills to win prizes in our community challenges. Bittle makes a perfect tool for learning, teaching, researching, or a surprising gift to impress your family and friends. Bittle is not a toy for small kids. We recommend parental guidance to appreciate its rich content and avoid damage or injury. Bittle walking on the deskEvolving with an open-source gene, Bittle is an open platform to fuse multiple makers' gadgets into one organic system. With our customized Arduino board coordinating all instinctive and sophisticated movements, you can clip on various sensors to bring in perception. You could also inject artificial intelligence capabilities by mounting a Raspberry Pi or other AI chips through wired/wireless connections.Ball tracking with an intelligent camera mounted on the head Bittle is the second product of OpenCat, sibling of Nybble. Backed by a worldwide user group, you can find many tutorials and project ideas on the Internet. We make constant but tiny progresses every day. You can follow our social media (Instagram/Twitter @PetoiCamp) to get more frequent updates than newsletters. By posting on our forum, you can contribute to the community or simply make your wishes heard. We are always drawing the blueprint for futuristic robots!  Self-righting after falling from a slope (triggered by an infrared remote) Bittle is a palm-sized robot that moves with four legs rather than wheels. Legged motion gives it more freedom to navigate unstructured terrains, and expresses the joy of life whenever it moves. Such dynamic maneuverability was only seen on a few luxury robots from the best labs or tycoon companies previously, such as Boston Dynamics Spot or Sony Aibo. We came up with a grassroots solution to simplify the system to make it affordable and mass-producible. Walk the dog. Click the image to see a longer clip. Bittle is a compact system of five major components: body frame, actuator, electronics, battery, and the software to coordinate all the hardware to perform varied tasks. Body frameWe designed Bittle's interlocking frame as a 3D puzzle with very few screws involved. Most body parts are symmetric for simplicity and aesthetics. Puzzle-like body frame. Click the image for the full assembling animation.It's a pleasure to assemble and disassemble Bittle for teaching or maintenance. On average, it takes about one hour to put together the body from scratch. Build a robot dog on your own!Each piece has gone through tens of iterations with 3D printing. We then use high strength injection-molded plastic to provide the best protection from collision and dust (it's NOT waterproof!). In the stress tests, the assembled robot can take an adult's stepping without breaking any components (do NOT try this at home!).   Rolling down a step. Click the image for the full review video.We also designed Bittle to be soft. Besides the elasticity of the material, the spring-loaded upper legs flatten the shock on joint servos to protect their gears. Bittle usually survives regular collisions. In the extreme cases, it will disintegrate at the designated "weak link in the chain", which is easy and cheap to reinstall or replace. Passive compliant jointsWe designed the frame to be compatible with most 9g servos. You could order the "Bittle Shell" perk alone to compile your spare servos into a beautiful action figure!ActuatorWe visited several servo manufacturers and iterated many times to find the optimized parameters. It will be model P1S, a slim, fast servo with a controllable angle of 270 degrees.P1S servoWe use nine P1S servos to actuate Bittle. Eight of them are for walking joints, and one is for head panning. We will also include one spare servo for replacement, as brushed motors are consumable after a certain period of wearing. You may order the "Bittle Servo Set" perk if you expect to use Bittle intensively for teaching or researching.ElectronicsBittle is driven by NyBoard V1, a customized Arduino board with rich peripherals. We fully utilized the chip of a regular Arduino Uno to coordinate sophisticated motions. The board can drive at least 12 PWM servos, and an IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) is used for balancing. It stores "muscle memory" and detects body status (orientation and acceleration) for balancing. We provide an infrared remote to trigger basic movements. The board also listens to string commands from the serial port, such as "walk", "sit", or more detailed instructions for individual joints. NyBoard V1NyBoard V1 is a revision of NyBoard V0 that has been driving 2000 Nybbles all over the world. We continue to provide a 2x5 socket on NyBoard V1 for mounting Raspberry Pi. It powers the Pi and communicates with it through the serial or I2C network. The Pi gives Bittle the ability to analyze more sensory data, get connected to the Internet, and make decisions by itself. Due to Bittle's small size, it best fits Pi Zero and Pi 3A+. For larger Pi models, you will need to tilt the Pi and 3D print some supporting structures. Raspberry Pi 3 A+ and Pi camera on BittleThanks to the Arduino and Raspberry Pi community, you can find many customization ideas for Bittle. There are four Seeed Grove sockets on NyBoard V1 for extensible modules. To make installation easier, we designed Bittle's head as a clip to bite on those modules. That explains why we created a dog out of OpenCat this time. There's also a screw hole inside Bittle's head for fixing additional modules. Extensible modulesWe developed a Bluetooth dongle for wirelessly uploading codes and controlling Bittle from PC or smartphone Apps. We also developed a WiFi dongle for wirelessly communicating with Bittle. You can play with Bittle without messing around with cables. Wireless is also essential when you are studying balancing related motion planning. You can even utilize the computational power of a remote "brain" without being constrained by Bittle's size and cargo capacity. The dongles are compatible with our previous Nybble model. Bluetooth and WiFi donglesFurthermore, we are developing an ESP32 development board with native Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity. We have made a functional beta version called the "BiBoard V0" perk for developers. We expect a considerable performance boost, and you are welcome to join our exploration.BiBoard V0SoftwareBittle is driven by our OpenCat code. It has 3K lines of Arduino codes excluding 3rd party libraries. It defines the minimal data structure and algorithms for performing quadruped motion. We also provide example commander and parser in Python so that you can send instructions from other devices. The code is already running on thousands of small quadruped robots, including many variants of OpenCat.  The OpenCat codes are open source on GithubYou can program Bittle at different levels in various coding environments, such as C in Arduino IDE and Python in the terminal. We are collaborating with TinkerGen, a STEM education company that kindly developed Codecraft (a graphical coding environment) for Bittle. They will also provide a free curriculum for you to learn programming in Codecraft and create a wide array of educational and fun projects with it! You can code in Arduino IDE, Python, Codecraft, and many other environmentsWe plan to refactor Bittle's code between the production and release it before Bittle's delivery. You may start to explore the current OpenCat repository on GitHub to get familiar with the framework. We will announce new community challenges with huge prizes in the community section!    Bittle climbing up a step under realtime instructions sent through BluetoothBatteryWe designed a Li-ion battery pack with a built-in charging and protection circuit. It can slide into the track underneath Bittle and tune its center of mass. It can power Bittle for at least one hour of continuous walking. It also has an RGB LED to indicate the battery's status.Li-ion battery with onboard charging and protection circuitWith the slide-in installation mechanism and an anti-reverse plug, it's not too hard to switch batteries. You may order extra batteries for uninterrupted researching or playing. With some reconfiguration, it can also power our previous Nybble models.You can check this 30-min interview by Hackster.io for all the cool features.  Bittle is a perfect example to show "small is big". We wanted to encourage people to free their creativity and make wonderful things from limited resources. We have a growing community since the release of the OpenCat demo. We have @petoicamp on social media to update our fans about the progress of the project. After the launch of Nybble, we built the forum on our site (petoi.com) to discuss the project, showcase DIY models, and add function modules. Petoi Camp, the OpenCat forumLooking back at all the challenges we went through, the community was the most significant support that encouraged us to continue. We got thousands of backers to bring Nybble to life. Fans all around the world volunteered to translate our documentation into their languages. And many developers added new features to OpenCat. We cannot wait to see what Bittle will bring to us!   An Android App (Code&Robots) developed by one of our fansTo make our community more productive, educational, and rewarding, we will launch an online challenge for all OpenCat users. You can find our proposed rules in this forum post and give suggestions before it officially starts. In short, we will define several tasks that can be measured quantitatively, e.g., programing Bittle to get onto the highest step. You have to both demo your solution and teach others to validate your entry. On the first day of each month, we will announce the world's record-breaker and gift a free Bittle or Nybble to the winner!Who will be the first Bittle backflipper and enter our Hall of Fame?Bittle standing on my fingersBittle is 20cm x 11cm x 11cm in dimension. It has several communication ports to connect to other devices.  The Bluetooth dongle is compatible with Windows, macOS, and Android. It can also work on IOS with some auxiliary software. It can be used for uploading Arduino sketch or communicating with the NyBoard. The WiFi module can host a simple WebUI and communicate with the NyBoard. BiBoard V0, NyBoard V1 with Raspberry Pi 3 A+, and NyBoard V1 with a Bluetooth dongleThe intelligent camera module is our ODMed product. It can return recognized human body, objects, and symbols through serial/I2C/WiFi at a rate of 25fps or 50fps. It can even stream video through WiFi.
