story:
Nybble is not only a robotic cat that walks, it's a new type of pet - an advanced robotic kitten that YOU bring to life with a small computer, customizable software, a basic components kit, and whatever upgrades you can imagine!

Nybble's motion is driven by an Arduino compatible micro-controller. It stores instinctive "muscle memory" to move around. An optional AI chip, such as Raspberry Pi can be mounted on top of Nybble's back, to help Nybble with perception and decision. You can program in your favorite language, and direct Nybble walk around simply by sending short commands, such as "walk" or "turn left"!

Follow the instructions, or don’t.

You can check the most current tutorial. We also have a tutorial playlist with detailed instructions.

Stick with the included software, find hacks and customizations from the worldwide community, or push the envelope and write your own mods.

Think up your own look and bring it to life with paint, craft supplies, 3D printing, or whatever else feels right.

Join our growing community on our website www.petoi.com, make friends, challenge each other and each other’s kittens.

WOW! Look at all the press our little kitten has gotten! TechCrunch! IEEE Spectrum! Steemhunt! MagPi!  

We are also very grateful to Indiegogo for helping us reach our goal and featuring us in their newsletter!

 

Features

3D puzzle frame

Nybble's frame is an easily assemble-able puzzle. The wooden frame is a retro design in honor of its popstick framed ancestor. The wisdom of traditional Chinese woodwork was borrowed to make the major frame screw-free. Detailed assembling instructions will be available. Or...challenge yourself and try to solve the puzzle on your own!

NyBoard

We have designed an all-in-one controller we call the NyBoard V0 to ease the wiring and future development. Besides the ATmega328P chip (the same one on Arduino Uno), we used a faster crystal and added external EEPROM for storing more instincts. It has on-board power management with tunable output, various communication and controlling ports, and an optimized layout.

We pushed the layout precision to 0.25mm, to fit the geometry not only for Nybble, but also for Raspberry Pi and your favorite extension boards. It was designed to avoid all the tall components on Pi that may conflict with installation. Its 2x5 communication socket accepts the pins on Pi. It powers Pi, listens to Pi, and there’s a jumper switch for changing I2C master. If you have another preferred chip to ATmega328P, just take full control of the board! The on-board chip can still watch the battery level for you. You do need to design an installation mount if the optional screw holes don’t match your board. By attaching a Pi or other AI chips, you will be able to add more talents to Nybble, make it listen, see, and think.

We upgraded NyBoard V0 to NyBoard V1_0 with better connectivity and stability, and started to ship them in January 2021,

We also include Bluetooth and WiFi dongles in the standard Nybble kit. You can program and control Nybble wirelessly, free from the cables!

Joint tuner

Nybble is adorable, but it’s still a precise instrument. To make it walk, it takes patience and precision. To help you through the challenges, we also include a nice gadget, the “L” tuner for calibrating your Nybble at times. Just turn Nybble to calibration mode and align the observation windows, type proper calibrations, and Nybble will remember them at once.

Learn programming with Nybble

After assembling Nybble, some entry-level computer skills are required to upload the code and tune Nybble to walking order. You'll need a little willingness to learn and teach it new tricks! 

The bigger picture behind Nybble

Over the 2.5 years’ evolution of OpenCat, a rough framework is becoming clearer. It started from a Raspberry Pi kit, introduced an Arduino as the central pattern generator, and will accept any extensions that are needed. As long as you have a precise and powerful actuator, you can scale Nybble up to a dog, a horse, or even an elephant!

Check out our GitHub repository at https://github.com/PetoiCamp/OpenCat and you're invited to build it together!

Nybble is for everyone!  If you like graceful cats, tiny computers, hackable software, customizable models, or connecting with new friends around the world, back this project!

If you’re flying solo and just want to enjoy making Nybble yours, you can hack, reprogram, paint, decorate and pose your Nybble in any way you can imagine.  If you’re looking for a fun and meaningful group project for your family or classroom, this tiny kitten brings out the best in people, unlocking curiosity and joy.

We know that with Nybble, we can break the barrier between those million-dollar quadruped robots and individual makers. Nybble will also be less intimidating to kids who want to learn about robotics, programming, and making in general.

Impressed with Boston Dynamics robots? Why not try Nybble first?

 

As in 2021 Summer, We have a better inventory management and are keep shipping out Nybbles! 

Nybble is a small step that an individual maker takes to overcome obstacles and bring his creation to the world. Nybble is also a bridge to fuse cool technologies and connect the developers around it. Your support will define Nybble's future!

There's a more technical post on Hackster.io on the code release:

https://www.hackster.io/RzLi/petoi-nybble-944867

We need your help! Nybble can accomplish great things if given the freedom to do so. This is a one-time investment with a worldwide community always adding its values.

By starting out on Indiegogo, we’re avoiding a lot of the problems that companies usually have when they start something new. We are highly interested in your feedback on how you train Nybble, how you customize your kitten, and how you hack it!

We don’t want to tell you what Nybble is. You tell us.

Indiegogo is also a platform that reaches many different kinds of people with varying interests. In order to get a full assessment of what Nybble can do and what it can become, we need everyone to pitch in and give their feedback. From the highest levels of engineering to the youngest kids playing with Nybble, we can't wait to see the outcome!

We would like to scale up production, bring down manufacturing costs with higher order volumes and smarter processes. The more Nybbles find a home, the more affordable we can make our kits!

Below is a snapshot of the Nybble kit. Nothing special, right? Note some parts may subject to change as I finalize every bit, such as color, length, and the number of screws.

Parts not included are 2 x 14500 3.7 V Li-ion batteries and a smart charger. Be careful with fake batteries that claim more than 850mAh capacity. I've been using EBL 14500 3.7V 800mAh batteries and they work well. If you are out of the US and find a working battery in your area, please share your knowledge with our community! 

More sets of batteries will allow you to play longer with Nybble by swapping. I usually keep programming all night with one pair of batteries, but they would die out quickly if you just play with Nybble as a remote-controlled toy.

Rongzhong (Rz) Li

Founder and CEO

Rz is a physics PhD and computer science master. He was previously an educator at Wake Forest University.

Rz is a maker, photographer, poet, interdisciplinary explorer. 

 

Wenxiao Huang

Co-founder

Wenxiao is a PhD in physics and master in computer science. He is currently a researcher at Stanford University. Nothing special, just a crazy scientist. 

 

Jian Yu

PCB designer

PhD student in computer vision.

Jian has a ton of experience working in the embedded system industry and skilled in hardware design and has strong interests in robotics.

 

Olga Pogoda

Project Manager

Olga has a background in marketing, robotics, and crowdfunding. Olga likes to make stuff with her kids and eat cheesecake.

 

Scot MacTaggart

Project Manager

Scot's background is in process improvement, sales, and marketing. Scot likes his coffee really, really black, and he can't wait to see robot cat videos start popping up on YouTube.
story_txt: Nybble is not only a robotic cat that walks, it's a new type of pet - an advanced robotic kitten that YOU bring to life with a small computer, customizable software, a basic components kit, and whatever upgrades you can imagine!Nybble's motion is driven by an Arduino compatible micro-controller. It stores instinctive "muscle memory" to move around. An optional AI chip, such as Raspberry Pi can be mounted on top of Nybble's back, to help Nybble with perception and decision. You can program in your favorite language, and direct Nybble walk around simply by sending short commands, such as "walk" or "turn left"!Follow the instructions, or don’t.You can check the most current tutorial. We also have a tutorial playlist with detailed instructions.Stick with the included software, find hacks and customizations from the worldwide community, or push the envelope and write your own mods.Think up your own look and bring it to life with paint, craft supplies, 3D printing, or whatever else feels right.Join our growing community on our website www.petoi.com, make friends, challenge each other and each other’s kittens.WOW! Look at all the press our little kitten has gotten! TechCrunch! IEEE Spectrum! Steemhunt! MagPi!  We are also very grateful to Indiegogo for helping us reach our goal and featuring us in their newsletter! Features3D puzzle frameNybble's frame is an easily assemble-able puzzle. The wooden frame is a retro design in honor of its popstick framed ancestor. The wisdom of traditional Chinese woodwork was borrowed to make the major frame screw-free. Detailed assembling instructions will be available. Or...challenge yourself and try to solve the puzzle on your own!NyBoardWe have designed an all-in-one controller we call the NyBoard V0 to ease the wiring and future development. Besides the ATmega328P chip (the same one on Arduino Uno), we used a faster crystal and added external EEPROM for storing more instincts. It has on-board power management with tunable output, various communication and controlling ports, and an optimized layout.We pushed the layout precision to 0.25mm, to fit the geometry not only for Nybble, but also for Raspberry Pi and your favorite extension boards. It was designed to avoid all the tall components on Pi that may conflict with installation. Its 2x5 communication socket accepts the pins on Pi. It powers Pi, listens to Pi, and there’s a jumper switch for changing I2C master. If you have another preferred chip to ATmega328P, just take full control of the board! The on-board chip can still watch the battery level for you. You do need to design an installation mount if the optional screw holes don’t match your board. By attaching a Pi or other AI chips, you will be able to add more talents to Nybble, make it listen, see, and think.We upgraded NyBoard V0 to NyBoard V1_0 with better connectivity and stability, and started to ship them in January 2021,We also include Bluetooth and WiFi dongles in the standard Nybble kit. You can program and control Nybble wirelessly, free from the cables!Joint tunerNybble is adorable, but it’s still a precise instrument. To make it walk, it takes patience and precision. To help you through the challenges, we also include a nice gadget, the “L” tuner for calibrating your Nybble at times. Just turn Nybble to calibration mode and align the observation windows, type proper calibrations, and Nybble will remember them at once.Learn programming with NybbleAfter assembling Nybble, some entry-level computer skills are required to upload the code and tune Nybble to walking order. You'll need a little willingness to learn and teach it new tricks! The bigger picture behind NybbleOver the 2.5 years’ evolution of OpenCat, a rough framework is becoming clearer. It started from a Raspberry Pi kit, introduced an Arduino as the central pattern generator, and will accept any extensions that are needed. As long as you have a precise and powerful actuator, you can scale Nybble up to a dog, a horse, or even an elephant!Check out our GitHub repository at https://github.com/PetoiCamp/OpenCat and you're invited to build it together!Nybble is for everyone!  If you like graceful cats, tiny computers, hackable software, customizable models, or connecting with new friends around the world, back this project!If you’re flying solo and just want to enjoy making Nybble yours, you can hack, reprogram, paint, decorate and pose your Nybble in any way you can imagine.  If you’re looking for a fun and meaningful group project for your family or classroom, this tiny kitten brings out the best in people, unlocking curiosity and joy.We know that with Nybble, we can break the barrier between those million-dollar quadruped robots and individual makers. Nybble will also be less intimidating to kids who want to learn about robotics, programming, and making in general.Impressed with Boston Dynamics robots? Why not try Nybble first? As in 2021 Summer, We have a better inventory management and are keep shipping out Nybbles! Nybble is a small step that an individual maker takes to overcome obstacles and bring his creation to the world. Nybble is also a bridge to fuse cool technologies and connect the developers around it. Your support will define Nybble's future!There's a more technical post on Hackster.io on the code release:https://www.hackster.io/RzLi/petoi-nybble-944867We need your help! Nybble can accomplish great things if given the freedom to do so. This is a one-time investment with a worldwide community always adding its values.By starting out on Indiegogo, we’re avoiding a lot of the problems that companies usually have when they start something new. We are highly interested in your feedback on how you train Nybble, how you customize your kitten, and how you hack it!We don’t want to tell you what Nybble is. You tell us.Indiegogo is also a platform that reaches many different kinds of people with varying interests. In order to get a full assessment of what Nybble can do and what it can become, we need everyone to pitch in and give their feedback. From the highest levels of engineering to the youngest kids playing with Nybble, we can't wait to see the outcome!We would like to scale up production, bring down manufacturing costs with higher order volumes and smarter processes. The more Nybbles find a home, the more affordable we can make our kits!Below is a snapshot of the Nybble kit. Nothing special, right? Note some parts may subject to change as I finalize every bit, such as color, length, and the number of screws.Parts not included are 2 x 14500 3.7 V Li-ion batteries and a smart charger. Be careful with fake batteries that claim more than 850mAh capacity. I've been using EBL 14500 3.7V 800mAh batteries and they work well. If you are out of the US and find a working battery in your area, please share your knowledge with our community! More sets of batteries will allow you to play longer with Nybble by swapping. I usually keep programming all night with one pair of batteries, but they would die out quickly if you just play with Nybble as a remote-controlled toy.Rongzhong (Rz) LiFounder and CEORz is a physics PhD and computer science master. He was previously an educator at Wake Forest University.Rz is a maker, photographer, poet, interdisciplinary explorer.  Wenxiao HuangCo-founderWenxiao is a PhD in physics and master in computer science. He is currently a researcher at Stanford University. Nothing special, just a crazy scientist.  Jian YuPCB designerPhD student in computer vision.Jian has a ton of experience working in the embedded system industry and skilled in hardware design and has strong interests in robotics. Olga PogodaProject ManagerOlga has a background in marketing, robotics, and crowdfunding. Olga likes to make stuff with her kids and eat cheesecake. Scot MacTaggartProject ManagerScot's background is in process improvement, sales, and marketing. Scot likes his coffee really, really black, and he can't wait to see robot cat videos start popping up on YouTube.

story:
Internet of Things(IoT) has become part of our life. From small devices such as a smart phone to a large device such as an airplane, everything is connected to the internet today. It is estimated that there will be more than to 21 billion IoT devices by 2025. 

How cool is it to develop an IoT project in less than 10 minutes?

You might wonder whether it's really possible. Yes, have have developed  a tiny computer called Magicbit which can be programmed to create different innovative applications easily by anyone.

It's a STEM tool, DIY builder, learning aid and a platform for creative thinkers.

 

 

Magicbit has a development environment with cloud based IoT platform called Magicblocks and a mobile app which can be seamlessly connected for to create innovative solutions.

 

 

Magicbit is packed with a wide of feature range. It has an ESP32 module in it's core together with sensors, actuators and connectivity modules built in. The idea is to minimize the additional components required when developing solutions. This makes the life easy, even for a beginner.

 

 

We remove the barriers of entry for a newbie to electronics with pluggable modules and built in features. So there's no need of jumper wires, breadboards and soldering to develop an application.

 

Programming is another hurdle for a beginner in innovation. Our visual code builder with block programming enables everyone to develop a solution even without programming knowledge.  

Therefore it's easy to use and fast to learn.  If you are an expert in coding and electronics we have plenty of options in Magicbit which you can find as you scroll down.

 

 

Magicbit is  made for EVERYONE. Students and kids can use it as a STEM tool to learn innovation with technology in a practical way. Developers and researches can use it to capture data and prototype solutions. Hobbyists can use Magicbit to find solutions for problems they are keen to solve in the world.

 

 

 As we introduce Magicbit as a STEM tool, we carefully designed it to be friendly for children.

 

 

Magicbit is not operating alone. While we have our own cloud based software -Magicblocks, we made Magicbit cross compatible with  all popular platforms out there. For example if you are familiar with Arduino or MicroPython, you can program in the same way using Magicbit. 

It works like Magic with other cloud platforms too. Which means you can try out real world applications with any cloud platform you like.

 

 

Magicblocks.io is a cloud based IoT platform we developed with inbuilt device manager and visual code builder based on Node-RED.  This hides the complexity of hardware, firmware and protocols. We want to encourage innovators to focus on logic and creativity.

The platform supports to learn basic concepts more quickly with a simplified learning process ( i.e - 10 minutes to develop a simple application). However this has the capability to build complex applications with hardware,  customized coding and third party integrations. 

 Best part is we have made it FREE for everyone for learning purposes.

 

 

Have you ever thought of the number of sensors in your smart phone?  Magicblocks mobile app brings the inbuilt sensors and the capabilities of the mobile phone to the solution development environment of Magicbit. This enables to get sensor data from the phone and use the phone as an input or an output device.

1. Using sensors and input data from mobile - GPs, accelerometer, gyroscope, compass, light , proximity, camera, temperature, pressure

2. Using mobile as an output device - Push notification

 

 Again best part is it's also made FREE for anyone to use. You can download it from google play store and our iOS version is under development.

 

 

 Not only IoT, Magicbit is a single platform to learn and practice any area below.

Internet of Things ( IoT) : Develop IoT applications and automations  in minutes with web/mobile dashboards.

Computer programming : Programming is more fun with a hardware platform. Practice coding with C, Python or Scratch.

Robotics : Master the basics of Robotics  such as obstacle avoiding, line following and WiFi & Bluetooth control.

Electronics : Learn the basics of electronics with digital I/O, analog I/O, communications etc. 

 

 

Now, let's think for a moment. With a platform with all these features what can you possibly do?

 You will be amazed, if you do a quick search on the internet, to see the number of applications you  can do with all these futures. Actually it's LIMITLESS.

Let's see few example applications done with Magicbit.

Plant watering

Automate watering your plants based on soil moisture.

 

 

Pet Feeder

Feed your pets remotely using mobile.

 

Phone and Arm movement

Use your mobile as an input device for projects.

 

Create Games

 Try out fun projects you see on the internet.

 

Pulse Oximeter

 Monitor oxygen level in blood using your own device.

 

Robots

 Build different types of awesome robots.

 

 As students, we also used popular platforms to develop solutions. While all the competitive products in the market helped us to inspire to develop our own platform, we developed Magicbit specifically to address issues we all have like low features, cross compatibility problems, need to buy different modules for applications, difficulty for use for a beginners and the cost.

Magicbit standout with ease of use and cost effectiveness when compared with others.

 

 

Below front and back layouts gives the picture of the composition of features on board.

 

 Pluggable Modules in Magicbit Pro Kit.

 

Our team has been dedicated to create quality content free for learners. From setting up to practical implementation, everything is available in our website. New projects are created frequently by Magicbit community and updated in the website.

 

Student projects done with Magicbit are documented in commonly known platforms such as hackster.io.

You can check every project with details in websites.

 

YouTube channel provides constant updates to give creative ideas for everyone interested.

 

 

Magicbit Indiegogo perks are priced with great discounts for the early supporters of Magicbit.

 

 

After the pilot product launch, We have received numerous achievements in education and community service sector in Sri Lanka. Below awards are yet another proof of the powerful design and concept of Magicbit.

 

 

Project Magicbit was realized with the support of many private and government organizations across the world.

 

 

You can find our projects and articles available on popular tech and news sites.

 

 

Our journey started 2 years back and we will be sending out Indiegogo perks from November 2021 onwards.

 

While there are many who contributed for the success of Magicbit. It's a project started by three friends. 

 

 

Magicbit has been developed with over a period of 2 years, by testing out different prototypes . After our beta launch in September 2020, we improved Magicbit with every production batch. We have sold about 500 units in the local market in Sri Lanka.

Since the Magicbit design is tested and used, we can guarantee that this is merely not a prototype but a robust product.

 

 

 

 

Your support means a lot to us. Please help to spread the news about Magicbit in social media.

story:
Birth of Kash-In

Classroom economies or token systems are used to combat both issues of classroom behaviors and student engagement. Teachers everywhere create these systems using stickers, a "points" system or paper money. Often times the classroom economies use physical tokens,  are hard to manage, and can't be implemented consistently.  These reward and motivation systems help:

  • Lower student detentions and out-of-school suspensions 
  • Students show academic growth
  • School culture and student engagement
  • Serve as an intervention tool for behavior and academics

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

PROGRESS & TEAM

 

The Modern Scholars are asking for $40,000. Your support will be used primarily for continued platform development via software and apps plus hosting expenses.

Below is a breakdown of how the funding will be used.

If all contributions are not reached, any funding will go to app and software development.  

The Modern Scholars would like to show their appreciation by thanking you in advance and please take advantage of our perks. Just know being a part of something like Kash-In, your support will not go unnoticed.

 

Your Impact

Ease teachers stress and Build students to success!

Students and teachers everywhere need you. With your help we can address many issues associated with teachers leaving the profession and the high level of At-Risk students. With this management, motivation, and engagement learning platform, in one, we are helping to build a better equipped teacher and a more productive student. Your help will assist the Modern Scholars change how the world educates and motivates.

 

Any Help will do…

Just sharing our campaign is support. So…SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!  Other ways to support:

  • Share with teacher acquaintances 
  • Forward information to your network of people that can assist
  • Follow our social media pages and like/comment/share

 

 

Website: www.kash-in.com

Kash-In: www.kashinapp.com

Feature: http://voyagehouston.com/interview/meet-latasha...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/KashInApp2/    

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/the_modernscholars/ 

Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/modern_scholars

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/the-modern-scholars

YouTube: The Modern Scholars channel

story:
Short Summary

My name is B. Sharise Moore. I am an educator, born and raised in New Jersey. I now reside in Baltimore, MD. I am currently a certified 6th grade English/Language Arts teacher with 11 years of classroom teaching experience. I am also an author.  My short stories and poetry have been published in anthologies and literary magazines such as The City and Fiyah Literary Magazine. My forthcoming YA magical realism novel, Dr. Marvellus Djinn's Odd Scholars will be published by MV Media in early fall, 2020.  I am currently pursuing an MS in Curriculum and Instruction with a focus in Writing for Young Adults and Children at McDaniel College. I also host Moore Books with B. Sharise, a diverse book reviewing channel on Youtube. 

I've always been fascinated by curriculum and materials of instruction. As a speculative writer and educator, I'd like to combine two of my passions: Afrofuturism and education. Ytasha L. Womack, author of Afrofuturism: The World of Black Sci-fi and Fantasy Culture,  describes Afrofuturism as "an intersection of imagination, technology, the future, and liberation." The Conjuring Worlds textbook will feature original works (short stories, poetry, non-fiction articles, and artwork) commissioned from Black creators. Each work will be accompanied by extension activities appropriate for middle school students. Conjuring Worlds will be an interdisciplinary teaching tool, with activities covering subjects across the curriculum.

 

Why This? Why Now?

Why not? M.D. Anderson states the following in The Radical Self-Reliance of Black Homeschooling, “the homeschooling population in the United States is predominantly white and concentrated in suburban or rural areas. In 2016, black children accounted for 8 percent of the 1.7 million homeschooled students nationally, according to U.S. Department of Education statistics." As the risks of COVID 19 remain and distrust/disappointment/ disillusionment in the public school system continues, homeschool collectives continue to search for more inclusive, diverse, and easy to use teaching tools and instructional materials. Conjuring Worlds can become a go-to tool for homeschoolers, educators, and parents with a desire to feed the vast imaginations of their students and children. 

 

What We Need

It is important that the writers and artists involved in this project are compensated fairly.  Please see the proposed budget below:

8 Short Stories @ $150 each = $1200

8 poems @ $100 each = $800

6 nonfiction articles @ $100 each = $600

10 works of art @ $150 each= $1500

Cover art = $350

75 hours of labor for curriculum/extension activity creation @$25.00 per hour = $1,875

Lightning Source Print On Demand Set-up Fee: $120.00 (publishing cost)

ISBN & Barcode: $130.00 (publishing cost)

Book Layout= $350.00

Total Cost of Project: $6, 925.00

 

Why Me? 

In my eleven year teaching career, I have sponsored drama, poetry, and newspaper clubs. During the 2019-2020 school year, I was appointed to the Board of Advanced Academics and in the past I've been a part of a Materials of Instruction Committee. In 2019, I was selected to write curriculum for my school district. I am a current member of SCBWI (Society of Children Book's Writers and Illustrators) and NCTE (National Council of Teachers of English). In addition, I am active in the speculative writing community. I have appeared on several speculative and Afrofuturism panels at Sci-fi & Fantasy conventions up and down the east coast.  

Unlike any other textbook, Conjuring Worlds will encourage young people to think critically while examining illusory worlds and topics relevant to the world we live in. Who better to spearhead this project than an award winning author and veteran teacher of English/Language Arts? 

 

Risks & Challenges

Will I be able to attract quality artists and authors at the rates listed above? Yes. I hope that the authors and artists I approach will see the value in exposing young people to speculative worlds that connect literature, science, history, geography, math, music, government, and art.

There is no educational text for young people that centers Afrofuturism and Black Speculative art in this way. We will be the first. It is my hope that creating an educational text centering Afrofuturism will push the genre forward and inspire young artists and writers to continue in the tradition of Tananarive Due, N.K. Jemisin, Colson Whitehead, and Junior Tomlin.

Can't donate? No problem. Please share this campaign far and wide using the Indiegogo share tools!

10 works of art @ $150 each= $1500
Cover art = $350
75 hours of labor for curriculum/extension activity creation @$25.00 per hour = $1,875
Lightning Source Print On Demand Set-up Fee: $120.00 (publishing cost)
ISBN & Barcode: $130.00 (publishing cost)
Book Layout= $350.00
Total Cost of Project: $6, 925.00

 
Why Me? 
In my eleven year teaching career, I have sponsored drama, poetry, and newspaper clubs. During the 2019-2020 school year, I was appointed to the Board of Advanced Academics and in the past I've been a part of a Materials of Instruction Committee. In 2019, I was selected to write curriculum for my school district. I am a current member of SCBWI (Society of Children Book's Writers and Illustrators) and NCTE (National Council of Teachers of English). In addition, I am active in the speculative writing community. I have appeared on several speculative and Afrofuturism panels at Sci-fi & Fantasy conventions up and down the east coast.  
Unlike any other textbook, Conjuring Worlds will encourage young people to think critically while examining illusory worlds and topics relevant to the world we live in. Who better to spearhead this project than an award winning author and veteran teacher of English/Language Arts? 

 
Risks & Challenges
Will I be able to attract quality artists and authors at the rates listed above? Yes. I hope that the authors and artists I approach will see the value in exposing young people to speculative worlds that connect literature, science, history, geography, math, music, government, and art.
There is no educational text for young people that centers Afrofuturism and Black Speculative art in this way. We will be the first. It is my hope that creating an educational text centering Afrofuturism will push the genre forward and inspire young artists and writers to continue in the tradition of Tananarive Due, N.K. Jemisin, Colson Whitehead, and Junior Tomlin.
Can't donate? No problem. Please share this campaign far and wide using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello, thank you for your consideration in supporting me to attend this Worship internship program at Red Rocks Church in Colorado. 
  • My name is Ililo Bisee, I am 23 years old and I am a Sr. at Grace Christian University in Grand Rapids Michigan. I am completing my Bachelor of Music, Worship Arts and Technology. In order to complete my undergraduate studies, I am required to complete an internship program in my field of study. After many applications, the Lord opened the door to an opportunity for me to do my internship at Red Rocks Church in Colorado.  

RED ROCKS WORSHIP INTERNSHIP

  • The Red Rocks worship internship is a 9-month commitment (August 6th, 2021 – May 15th, 2022). During this time, I will be serving 40 hours a week including Sunday experiences. This is an unpaid internship. With that notion, interns are NOT allowed to work part-time jobs or attend school because of the interference with the ministry hours at RRC. With that in mind, each intern should raise or have pledged a suggested $10,000 before entering the program. Thanks to the generosity of the Lakes Church, I only have to raise $5000 more.

WHY IS THIS INTERNSHIP IMPORTANT TO ME?

  • God has placed a call to Worship ministry on my heart. As many of you know, I love music, and I love to use that gift as a tool to draw people closer to God. This internship is important to me because I will gain ministry experience at a multi-site church on a campus level. I will learn how to facilitate worship environments in a variety of avenues, ranging from Youth, Young Adults, and Weekend services. Here I will utilize technology to create connections for the congregation. I will learn in an atmosphere that values production, personal songwriting, and recording. Throughout the internship there will be many opportunities to serve the worship department for all events such as prayer nights, ministry events, writing retreats, worship nights, etc. During this internship I will grow in skill, technicality, spiritually, songwriting, efficiently leading volunteer musicians, and humbly serving The Church. 

RRC INTERSHIP PURPOSE:

  • The purpose of the RRC Internship Program is focused on developing the call God has put on my life to pursue church ministry. Their goal is to then help deploy the called toward the path God may be leading them. Through this process I will grow as a leader, a person, and as a follower of Christ. This program will provide ministry training and experience as well as leadership and spiritual development.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP ME ACHIEVE.

  • Due to the high demand on ministry focused mentality, Interns at Red Rocks are not allowed to have a part time job. Your contribution will help me be able to sustain myself for 9 months without a job. These funds will go toward the cost of living as I am unable to have a separate income. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • If you are unable to help me financially, please keep me in your prayers for I believe that prayer is an essential part of ministry and day to day life.
  • You can help out by simply sharing this with others who would be interested in helping financially or through prayers.

story:
My name is Marshall Allen and I am showing Americans how to save big money on health care - and I need your help. 

Our health care system is taking advantage of us financially. Americans spend twice as much per person on health care than the citizens of other developed countries, but still, call its high cost their number one financial concern. Medical bills are overpriced and riddled with errors, but if you can’t pay they still come after you. About 1-in-6 Americans have medical debt in collections. And many are delaying necessary medical care because of the cost.  

I spent 15 years as an investigative journalist, including a decade at ProPublica. I’ve learned that there’s no excuse for these outrageous health care costs. We’re getting hustled. Our health care system is saddling us with overpriced and error-filled bills and the cost of treatment we don’t actually need. The system is wasting our money with its inefficient billing and administrative bloat— and it keeps coming back for more. We’ve trusted the health care industry but it’s actually preying on us financially. 

 

Bullies Watch Out

It’s time for us to get engaged and fight back. There is a lot we can do about the problem, but we need to be equipped. My new book, Never Pay the First Bill: And Other Ways to Fight the Health Care System and Win, is a how-to guide to help working Americans and employers save big money by hacking the health care system. The book has been a huge success. I’ve been featured on the national NPR shows 1A and Weekend Edition, Good Morning America, ABC News Live and dozens of podcasts. The book is being called a must-read for every American and now I’m turning it into an engaging series of health care financial literacy videos called The Never Pay Pathway (aka NPP). The topics covered include: How to identify and contest errors and overcharges in your medical bills; how to win insurance company appeals; how to avoid care you don't need; how to use hospital financial assistance policies; how to defend yourself in small claims court and much more!

 
 

Instant Impact

My book shows employers and working Americans how they can work together to push back against our overpriced health care system. And it’s already showing a tremendous return on investment for the readers who are applying its principles and tactics.

People are STANDING UP FOR THEMSELVES and saving BIG MONEY:  

  • Alexcia and her husband fought an insurance company’s denial of their claim that left them on the hook for $78,000 in bills. They successfully contested the denial and were saved from bankruptcy when the bill was reduced to zero. 
  • Andy started contesting his bills and within weeks saved $815. 
  • Josh sued his dentist in small claims court for $300 because of an unfair bill and won a quick settlement. 
  • One Amazon reviewer took my advice and went to an independent imaging center for a CT scan instead of a hospital - saving more than $1,400. 

 

Empowering All Consumers

Individual patients have so many ways to save money in health care. And when they save, they can actually lower the costs that they and their employers pay for their health plans. I show in my book how it’s already happening, and now we just need to spread the word. 

I need your help turning the empowering information in my book into The Never Pay Pathway health literacy video curriculum.

 

How Will We Use These Funds?

This Indiegogo crowdsourcing campaign will fund the production and rollout of The Never Pay Pathway videos. We have recorded more than 15 short, three-to-five minute videos and completed the production of the first one. We need to pay for the production, editing, graphics and animation to complete the series, and ensure they are as engaging as possible.

We will also create a smartphone app that will put this information into the pocket of every patient who needs it. Additional money will be used for advertising and marketing, to make sure we reach a wider audience. 

Will you please join this campaign to take on one of the biggest financial problems facing Americans? Your donation will help equip and empower the hundreds of millions of Americans who are being preyed upon financially by the health care system.

 

Grateful For You

We have come up with a lot of great rewards (including this fresh AHA swag) for your partnership. Your generosity will make a real difference.

 

Allen Health Academy Swag (see Perks for details)

 

Please help protect yourself and others from becoming financially victimized by the health care system.

Thank you for partnering with us!

story:
That is why we designed the LoCoMoGo Train - the toy that teaches children aged 4-12 coding through play.

 

 

This exciting journey takes children from basic code logic to true code mastery, all while playing. Children can start having fun right away with the LoCoMotive by creating their unique train tracks using tape. The Color Car then enables them to learn basic code logic, entirely screen-less. Each additional train car adds a new function and is programmable through the LoCoMoGo app, therefore, creating more and more fun opportunities to play and code with.

 

Finally, the LoCoMoGo Train can be extended with many more Train Cars. Each additional Train Car adds a new functionality, enabling more and more fun opportunities to play and code with. With LoCoMoGo there will always be a new car to add to your collection, as we continuously work with you to come up with best ideas to expand the LoCoMoGo experience.

 

 

LoCoMoGo's fresh approach to making coding accessible for all has turned heads around the world. For instance, LoCoMoGo has been selected as one of the top-50 most innovative Dutch technology startups to exhibit at CES 2020.

 

 

As our world rapidly digitalizes, the skill of programming has become increasingly important.The enormous increase in demand for jobs that require coding skills is a strong sign of that. At LoComogo we believe every child should have the opportunity to learn these important skills. In this, we do not stand alone: research shows that 91% of parents want their children to learn how to code [Google/Gallup, 2015].

Unfortunately, there aren't enough teachers with the knowledge to teach children the skills of coding. Educational Technology (EdTech) toys have the potential to be a great way to fill this gap. However, these toys tend to focus entirely on learning how to code first, forgetting the fun-loving nature inherent in every child. As a consequence, kids that don’t already have an affinity to engineering or robotics might miss out on the borderless opportunities brought by coding.

Learning should be joyful, and science has proven that children learn best through play [VVOB, 2018]. That is why LoCoMoGo teaches coding through play, because 91% of parents might want their child to learn how to code, but 100% want them to have fun.

 

 

At LoCoMoGo we want to inspire the innovators of tomorrow. That is why in naming our train sets we took inspiration from some of the great innovators of the past.

All the rewards include a set of conventional electrical insulation tape, so you can start making the track of your dreams right out of the box! In case you run low on tape, you can find the inexpensive tape at most convenience stores and definitely any hardware store! 

With the LoCoMoGo Train, the only limitation is your imagination! 

 

 

When we set out to design the LoCoMoGo Train, we wanted to create an educational toy that is not only fun and great in use, but also looks great in your living room. At the same time, there is a lot of sophisticated hardware to take into account for production. Therefore we collaborated with some of the best designers in Amsterdam.

Our team of three renowned designers has worked on multiple prestigious projects for international clients such as Heineken, Adidas, Warby Parker, Ace & Tate, and Hermes. They have created numerous successful products and have gotten global recognition for their talents. Together they have given the LoCoMoGo Train its unique iconic colorful design combining classic wood and new recycled materials into a highly detailed, innovative and timeless collection. We are grateful that they are part of the journey.

Long-lasting design​

The LoCoMoGo Train is build for longevity and will grow with you for many years. You are able to continuously expand with new Train Cars which (re)ignite the playful learning experience. In addition the fun challenges in the LoCoMoGo app enable you to master coding step by step.

 

Check out the video below if you want to get a glimpse of some of the design iterations. 

 
 

We are on the journey to provide every child with the opportunity to learn coding through play, but we can’t do it alone. 

This is the home of an amazing community of early backers. You are not afraid to take big steps towards the future and that is why you have stayed ahead of the curve of new technology and design. Your feedback and support is the most valuable aspect of this journey.

LoCoMoGo has and will continue to be a community effort. We have already come such a long way and we are ready for production. However, we are not a giant toy making corporation and we know there will be bumps along the way. Therefore the estimated shipping date is at the end of Q1 2021/beginning of Q2 2021. In this way we want to make absolutely sure that there are no compromises on quality and that you will receive the best educational toy that is out there.

 

 

In the journey leading up to our crowdfunding campaign, we have focused more on the development of hardware rather than the app software. We can always send a software update for our app, but hardware is permanent. Our goal has always been that the train you receive has a place in your home for many years. That being said, the core hardware and software integration has been thoroughly tested. You can see an example of the integration below.

 
Following our successful campaign, our team has already started working on the LoCoMoGo app and implementing teaching packages. Ensuring you will have plenty of fun coding challenges once you receive the train!
 
 
 
 
Check out what experts-in-fun have to say for themselves!
 

Listen what the director of the Poko Loko Day care center and her colleague had to say about the LoCoMoGo Train. 

 
In our experience not only kids, parents and teachers are excited about LoCoMoGo.

 

 

 

 

 

Interested in covering the LoCoMoGo journey? Check out our PR Kit.


Designing and developing hardware is challenging, luckily we enjoy it a great deal. It also doesn't hurt that we have developed products for (mass) production before. So we are familiar with the common pitfalls and especially the (infamous) delivery times. Having said that we didn't take in account a COVID-19 pandemic.

Therefore the new estimated shipment date is at the end of Q1 2021/beginning of Q2 2021. We believe this will provide us enough time to make sure that there are no comprises on quality and that you will receive the best educational toy that is out there. 

Every pledge is contributing to the journey of providing every child with the opportunity to learn coding through play. That's why we hope you will join our journey and help us put the kids of today, on the right track towards tomorrow.

story:
Short Summary

 

Ejaad is an empowerment project that fosters social change for semi-literate and literate disadvantaged Afghan women and girls by providing economic and educational opportunities.

Our goal is to raise funds to build a workshop and learning center in a safe and discreet neighborhood where our artisans can meet and collaborate in making traditional embroidery and have access to personalized learning and education classes.    

With the design help of Architect Without Frontiers (AWF), your funds will go towards building a well-designed, two-story collaborative space. This will consist of an embroidery workshop and storage area, a classroom for literacy, computer classes, and online learning, an office, and a small library. As well there will be a kitchen, bathroom, and rooftop to be used as a place to have tea and gather in the fresh air.

It is important for our artisans to have a collaborative place where they can meet more easily and systems can be better organized. Up until now, the women have been working from their own homes, making meeting together very difficult. Some of our artisans live in rural villages, they will now be able to stay at the center. 

It is essential during this time of transition in Afghanistan that our project provides a safe space for the women to embroider, especially now that many are the main income earners for their families. 

We wholeheartedly advocate for the rights of women and girls to receive an education.  The Workshop and Learning Center will provide classes for the women and girls with limited education and also for those with higher learning who desire more challenging opportunities. 

 

It will allow 25 women to realize their goals and aspirations and ultimately impact their families in a positive way.   

*We also want to acknowledge the difficulties many of our Ejaad families are facing at this particular time of unrest. Over 70% are without an income due to the loss of livelihoods. Part of the donations made will go towards supporting each family.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least US $15,000 to complete the building structure before winter. There are 3 phases to the Ejaad Learning Center project.

In 2017, we did a fundraiser on Indigogo and raised US $5,000 to buy sewing machines. One of our cofounders went to Afghanistan to start the project. 

1- Learning Center Phase 1:  In 2019, we bought land with a matching grant in a secluded compound in a suburb of Kabul to prepare to build the Learning Center.

2 - Learning Center Phase 2: Currently (2021) we collaborated with architects at the NGO Architects Without Frontiers AWF and will complete the building structure. (Now)

3- Learning Center Phase 3: In 2022, add we will engage in additional crowdfunding for tablets, computers, additional sewing machines, and materials, books for the library, improved internet facilities, and teacher salaries.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will make a real difference in the lives of our artisans and their families by providing:

  •  a proper working space making collaboration and learning easier 
  •  better systems for monitoring orders 
  •  space for our rural artisans to stay at while working 
  •  access to literacy, online learning, and computer/technology classes
  •  paid positions for project coordinators & teachers
  •  employment of 17 local workers to build the center 

In their own words

Our artisans have expressed how thankful they are that we can help them sell their embroidery internationally.  For many, it is the first time in their life they have earned their own money.  They have also shared with us how excited they are for the easy access to a safe neighborhood learning center, where cultural and family restrictions otherwise prevent them from attending public education facilities in Kabul.  They are extremely excited about the opportunities of receiving education at our center.

F. said " Before my father used to give me money. Now for the first time I have money on my own." A. said, "I want to improve my English skills and become better at communication."  S. said, I want to be a teacher and Study Dari." Z. said "I want to be a nurse."

 

Risks & Challenges

 

This project is especially important now.  We are a local grassroots social enterprise directly connected to a small, conservative community, which is unlikely to draw attention. Embroidery has always been a valued and acceptable craft for women in Afghan society.  As Afghanistan undergoes change, it is more important than ever to be advocates for education which creates peace, international-mindedness, and understanding.  Even in the darkest times, the education of girls and women will not stop. Let's rise up and stand by what is just and right, and be advocates for women who might not have any opportunities.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contact us @EjaadAfghanistan on FB and instagram

See our website https://ejaadafghanistan.weebly.com

https://www.facebook.com/tifacafe/

https://www.architectswithoutfrontiers.com.au/

 

Please contact us if you would like to help us get these beautiful embroideries and their stories out into the world and/or work with us to create awareness and campaign for the rights of women in Afghanistan. 

Ejaad was founded on a dream by Mr. Abdul, a substitute teacher and Osaka University Scholarship recipient. He teamed up with Andrea Morris and Jennifer Henbest Calvillo, two international educators who met in Myanmar.  Then, along with Yuriko Tsutsui from TIFA, who has 15 years of experience with women's projects in rural Nepal, they made Ejaad - a reality.  We are grateful to the many people who have helped us on our journey. Our worldwide community has been generous. Teachers and students around the world are important to our Learning Center. The students and teachers of Osaka and Senri International School in Osaka, Japan have been a vital part of our Project.  The Ejaad club at SOIS has grown, and their understanding of the challenges faced by uneducated Afghan women and girls, has deepened. The reciprocal impact that this type of service brings to students as they learn more about people empowered by our program -is enlightening.   We have international schools and friends  working with us in China, Japan, Korea, New Zealand, Saudi, Austria and Sweden. 

 

With a foundation in place, perseverance, and belief in what we were doing, we have begun to actualize our goals and vision. Let's work together with creativity and help our Ejaad artisans realize their dreams. We would love to hear from you!

 

“There is no tool for development more effective than the empowerment of women.”

-Kofi Annan
story_txt:
Short Summary
 
Ejaad is an empowerment project that fosters social change for semi-literate and literate disadvantaged Afghan women and girls by providing economic and educational opportunities.
Our goal is to raise funds to build a workshop and learning center in a safe and discreet neighborhood where our artisans can meet and collaborate in making traditional embroidery and have access to personalized learning and education classes.    
With the design help of Architect Without Frontiers (AWF), your funds will go towards building a well-designed, two-story collaborative space. This will consist of an embroidery workshop and storage area, a classroom for literacy, computer classes, and online learning, an office, and a small library. As well there will be a kitchen, bathroom, and rooftop to be used as a place to have tea and gather in the fresh air.
It is important for our artisans to have a collaborative place where they can meet more easily and systems can be better organized. Up until now, the women have been working from their own homes, making meeting together very difficult. Some of our artisans live in rural villages, they will now be able to stay at the center. 
It is essential during this time of transition in Afghanistan that our project provides a safe space for the women to embroider, especially now that many are the main income earners for their families. 
We wholeheartedly advocate for the rights of women and girls to receive an education.  The Workshop and Learning Center will provide classes for the women and girls with limited education and also for those with higher learning who desire more challenging opportunities. 
 
It will allow 25 women to realize their goals and aspirations and ultimately impact their families in a positive way.   
*We also want to acknowledge the difficulties many of our Ejaad families are facing at this particular time of unrest. Over 70% are without an income due to the loss of livelihoods. Part of the donations made will go towards supporting each family.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need at least US $15,000 to complete the building structure before winter. There are 3 phases to the Ejaad Learning Center project.
In 2017, we did a fundraiser on Indigogo and raised US $5,000 to buy sewing machines. One of our cofounders went to Afghanistan to start the project. 
1- Learning Center Phase 1:  In 2019, we bought land with a matching grant in a secluded compound in a suburb of Kabul to prepare to build the Learning Center.
2 - Learning Center Phase 2: Currently (2021) we collaborated with architects at the NGO Architects Without Frontiers AWF and will complete the building structure. (Now)
3- Learning Center Phase 3: In 2022, add we will engage in additional crowdfunding for tablets, computers, additional sewing machines, and materials, books for the library, improved internet facilities, and teacher salaries.
 

The Impact
Your contribution will make a real difference in the lives of our artisans and their families by providing:

 a proper working space making collaboration and learning easier 
 better systems for monitoring orders 
 space for our rural artisans to stay at while working 
 access to literacy, online learning, and computer/technology classes
 paid positions for project coordinators & teachers
 employment of 17 local workers to build the center 

In their own words
Our artisans have expressed how thankful they are that we can help them sell their embroidery internationally.  For many, it is the first time in their life they have earned their own money.  They have also shared with us how excited they are for the easy access to a safe neighborhood learning center, where cultural and family restrictions otherwise prevent them from attending public education facilities in Kabul.  They are extremely excited about the opportunities of receiving education at our center.
F. said " Before my father used to give me money. Now for the first time I have money on my own." A. said, "I want to improve my English skills and become better at communication."  S. said, I want to be a teacher and Study Dari." Z. said "I want to be a nurse."
 

Risks & Challenges
 
This project is especially important now.  We are a local grassroots social enterprise directly connected to a small, conservative community, which is unlikely to draw attention. Embroidery has always been a valued and acceptable craft for women in Afghan society.  As Afghanistan undergoes change, it is more important than ever to be advocates for education which creates peace, international-mindedness, and understanding.  Even in the darkest times, the education of girls and women will not stop. Let's rise up and stand by what is just and right, and be advocates for women who might not have any opportunities.  
 
Other Ways You Can Help

Contact us @EjaadAfghanistan on FB and instagram
See our website https://ejaadafghanistan.weebly.com
https://www.facebook.com/tifacafe/
https://www.architectswithoutfrontiers.com.au/
 
Please contact us if you would like to help us get these beautiful embroideries and their stories out into the world and/or work with us to create awareness and campaign for the rights of women in Afghanistan.

He teamed up with Andrea Morris and Jennifer Henbest Calvillo, two international educators who met in Myanmar.  Then, along with Yuriko Tsutsui from TIFA, who has 15 years of experience with women's projects in rural Nepal, they made Ejaad - a reality.  We are grateful to the many people who have helped us on our journey. story:
English after Arabic

:عن صاحب المشروع

انا ورد كيال من حيفا عمري 26 سنة، في هاي الأيام عم بنهي السنة الرابعة والأخيرة في مجال السينما في كلية "منشار" للفنون. بالأضافة لنشاطي السياسي والاجتماعي، عم بشتغل من سنين في مجال الإنتاج والتصوير. اشتغلت وتطوعت في العشرات من المشاريع والحملات في الكثير من المجالات، انتاج، تصوير، اخراج وتمثيل أحيانا. بالإضافة أخرجت ثلاثة أفلام قصيرة خلال فترة التعليم. في هاي الفترة عم بشتغل على فيلم التخرج في مجال الإخراج، في هذا المشروع ومن أشهر عديدة عم برافقني العديد من الأصدقاء الرائعين والمهنيين في مجال السينما والإنتاج، حتى اقدر .أوصل لفترة تصوير الفيلم في الصيف القريب مع اكثر الإمكانيات المهنية والفنية ليكون فيلم انطلاقتي في هذا العالم
بورتفوليو المخرج


عن الإنتاج المستقل في مسيرتي التعليمية والمهنية
في هذا المشروع ومثل مشاريع سابقة قررت اني اخوض تجربة أخرى من الإنتاج الفلسطيني المستقل وما اقدم للصناديق الإسرائيلية الي بتدعم أفلام الطلاب في البلاد رغم عدد الطاقم الكبير والعمل الصعب لمدة اشهر ما قبل التصوير. وبسبب الظروف المركبة وايماني بالخطوط الحمراء للتطبيع ما بقدر اقدم لصناديق في العالم العربي كونه المشروع متعلق في مشروع تخرجي من الكلية. لهيك قررت انه اطلق حملة دعم لإنتاج مشروع التخرج بدعم من الناس، معكو وبدعمكم راح اقدر انتج هذا الفيلم في احسن شكل واقدر اكمل في طريقي الي اعتدت عليه في الإنتاج الفني المستقل. بساعدني وبفرحني كثير دعمكم المادي بمبلغ بسيط لانتاج هذا المشروع وايمانكم فيه.

عن الفيلم
بعد أسبوعين من المرض، يعود الصياد حمزة للغابة لاصطياد الأسد الذي يبحث عنه منذ سنين طويلة. حمزة الصياد الصلب والعنيد يأخدنا برحلة في عالمة الخيالي والخاص بالبحث عن الأسد المهووس في اصطياده في الغابة ليحمي صديق قديم اقسم انه لن يخذله مره اخرى. في طريق حمزة الى الغابة، تعترض طريقة العديد من المواقف لتثنيه عن الخروج للصيد. منها شخصيات يحبونه ويخافون عليه ومنها شخصيات تستهزء به وفي عالمة الخاص. لكن حمزة الصلب والعنيد يكمل طريقة لمواجهة الأسد دون تردد.

ــــــــــــــــــــــــــــــ

صالح بكري

اسعدني العمل مع ورد كيال سابقا على فيلم "بحبش السينما"، ويسعدني جدا العمل معه مرة اخرى على فيلمه الجديد "حمزة - اسطورة الخوف"، فيلم قصير من تأليف مجد كيّال، فيلم يتناول موضوع الخوف والجرأة في تلافيف ومتاهات الوعي والوعي الباطني، نص تجريبي فيه تحد كبير صوريا وصوتيا، وفرصة للمخرج ورد كيال ولجميع العاملين على هذا الفيلم للتجريب بمعناه الفني والسينمائي وتحدي الخوف من التجريب بحد ذاته. ورد مخرج جاد ومحب للسينما، يقدّر عمل الممثل وجهده ويحاول أن يهيأ الظروف الأمثل للحدث الدرامي أن يُصوّر بشكل مبدع وخلاق ولا يخلو من البهجة الجماعية بتخليد اللحظة الحية والنابضة التي يرنو اليها الفنان الأصيل الذي يرى بالتجربة الإنسانية مصدر ومنبع الفنون كلها.


ماريا زريق

"بحبش السينما" - من إخراج ورد كيال هو من الافلام اللي حببتني اكتر واكتر بالسينما! وبأهمية صناعة الافلام المحلية. تجربة ورد بتأكد ان من الضروري انو يكون سينما مستقلة فكريا وماديا، واللي بتحكي عن قصصنا اليومية. ورد كيال بفيلمه "بحبش السينما"، سلط الضوء وبطريقة فكاهية، على معاناة الفنانين والسينمائيين الفلسطينيين بكل ما يخص موضوع تمويل الافلام المستقلة. دورنا ندعم الفن على اشكاله، ونعطي منصة لشاباتنا وشبابنا من فنانين انو يحكو قصصهن وتجاربهن - دعمكم اليوم، منشوفه بالفن بكرا.
 

عامر حليحل

تابعت ورد كيال منذ كان صبياً يعمل من خلف الكواليس في إنتاج وتسويق العروض الفنية، وافلام السينما في فلسطين. شغفه في هذا العالم قاده منذ الصغر الى الإخراج السينمائي. شاركت مؤخراً في فلم قصير من إخراج ورد وفوجئت بالجدية والمهنية ووضوح الرؤية واللغة السينمائية لديه. بدون شك هو من الأصوات الفنية الفلسطينية الواعدة جداً.
 

 

About the project's owner:

My name is Ward Kayyal, a 26-year-old from Haifa. I am finishing my fourth and last year in the field of cinematography in Menshar School of Art. In addition to my social and political activism, I have been working in the field of production and photography. I worked and volunteered in dozens of projects and campaigns in varying fields, such as production, photography, direction and acting. I also directed three short movies during my studies. Nowadays, I am working on my graduation project in the field of production, accompanied by many professional and amazing friends working in the fields of cinematography and production, so that I will be able to film the movie in the near summertime with more professional and artistic capabilities as I launch my journey in the world.

The Director Portfolio


On independent production during my educational and professional path:

Similar to previous projects, in the current one I decided to embark upon another experience in independent Palestinian production and refrain from applying to Israeli funds that provide support for students here, in spite of the large staff and the tough work preceding the actual filming. I strongly abide by red lines with regards to normalization, therefore I refrained from applying to funds in the Arab world since this is a project related to my graduation from an Israeli institution. For this reason, I decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign to support my project. With you and your support I will be able to produce this movie in the best way possible, and proceed in the path that I am accustomed to, which is the independent art production. I would be very happy and pleased to receive from you a small amount of financial support in order to finish the project.
 

On the movie:

After two weeks of illness, Hamzah returns to the forest to hunt the lion that he has long been looking for. Hamzah, the stubborn and tenacious hunter, takes us on a journey in his private and imaginary world as he searches for the lion, one he has been obsessed with catching in order to protect an old friend which he swore not to disappoint ever again. On Hamzah's way to the forest he is faced with many situations meant to prevent him from the hunt, whether due to people who love him and worry about him, or people who mock him. However, none of these were able to deter the stubborn and tenacious Hamzah from moving forward to confront the lion

ـــــــــــــــــــــــــــــــ

Saleh Bakri:

I had the pleasure of working with Ward on the movie "Bahebesh El Cinema", and I will be happy to work with him again on his new movie "Hamzah- Ostoorat Al-Khawf" (Hamzah- The Myth of Fear), a short movie composed by Ward Kayyal which deals with the issue of fear and courage and the convolutions and mazes of the conscious and sub-conscious. It is an experimental scenario with a big challenge, both on the visual and auditory levels, and is an opportunity for Ward and all those working on the movie to artistically experiment, and challenge the fear of experimenting. Ward is a serious director, who loves cinema and appreciates the actors` work and efforts, and tries to ensure the best conditions for filming the dramatic event in a creative way, one that is full of the collective joy resulting from the perpetuation of the live moment that an original artist strives for, and who perceives the human experience as the source for all art.

 

Maria Zreik:

"Bahebesh El Cinema" (I Don't Like the Cinema)- directed by Ward- is one of the movies that ignited my love for the cinema, and my interest in the important production of local movies. Ward's experience proves our crucial need to have a financially and intellectually independent cinema, which narrates our daily stories. In his movie "Bahebesh El Cinema", Ward highlights, in a humorous manner, the suffering of Palestinian artists when it comes to financing independent movies. We have a role in supporting all kinds of arts, and providing a platform for our young artists to tell their stories and experiences- your support today will surely bear fruit.

 

Ammer Hleihel:

I followed Ward since he was younger and working behind the scenes in producing and marketing art shows and movies in Palestine. His passion in this world since he was young has led him to cinematography. I participated lately in a short movie directed by Ward and I was surprised by the amount of professionalism, the cinematic language and the clarity of vision that Ward has shown. Without a doubt he is one of the very promising Palestinian artistic voices.

_______

The Budget الميزانية:
