 CMIO Header           
  Additional Headers
SATA Port and CPU Fan Header / Controller   

Over:Performance
 
The Raspberry Pi is now a powerful and extremely capable and extendable computer and deserves a place in the mainstream market, on desks and in racks the Raspberry Pi has got something to give everyone.The Raspberry Pi 4 Compute Module

Broadcom BCM2711 quad-core Cortex-A72 (ARM v8) 64-bit SoC @ 1.5GHz
H.265 (HEVC) (up to 4Kp60 decode), H.264 (up to 1080p60 decode, 1080p30 encode) 
OpenGL ES 3.0 graphics
Options for 1GB, 2GB, 4GB or 8GB LPDDR4-3200 SDRAM (depending on variant)
Options for 0GB ("Lite"), 8GB, 16GB or 32GB eMMC Flash memory (depending on variant)
Option for fully certified radio module: 2.4 GHz, 5.0 GHz IEEE 802.11 b/g/n/ac wireless; Bluetooth 5.0, BLE;


Over:PreparedThe design is ready to go and is built up from the Raspberry Pi CMIO 4 board schematic and extended to include more PC-centric components and engineered for maximum compatibility with Mini-ITX, Micro-ATX and ATX cases and PC peripherals.
The first thing to do is to prototype the design. My intention is to get 3 manufacturers to make 6 prototype boards each. I will select the highest quality board for the pre-production run. With 2 of the boards from each manufacturer I will use them for testing, marketing and development. One board will be given away in a competition/raffle. The remaining 11 boards will be sent to Early-backers as reward for their support. To cover the cost of this the 11 boards will require a contribution of £199 each.
If any discrepancies are found or tweaks to the design are required this will then be performed prior to pre-production. I will then order 50-100 boards (depending on demand) as a trial run at production, these boards will come in prototype retail packaging with prototype documentation and an I/O backplate. To cover the cost of this stage of development the pre-production boards will need a backing contribution of £149 each. One of these boards will also be given away in a competition/raffle.
Following the successful distribution of the pre-production boards I will then (again demand permitting) order a larger quantity of boards in a full production batch. This is where I hope to get the cost down as low as possible with a target price of £99 (if it's more then backers still get it for £99). Grab it now for this guaranteed price. 
Over:EngineeredI've lost count exactly how many, but this will be about my 35th commercial electronics PCB to be manufactured, so I am no stranger to getting these things to market. That said however, this will be the first of my own venture so represents my most exciting project to date and something I feel very passionate about.
If enough other people feel as excited by the idea of this project as I do then I think getting this product to market will be straight-forward enough with their support and with the endless support of the Raspberry Pi community. The design is done, checked and double-checked and is ready for prototyping. After successful testing and (if necessary) tweaking the pre-production stage will then be used to streamline the systems and processes required for mass-production, retail and after-sales support, working closely with the chosen manufacturer on optimal selection of components (substitute for most readily available and alternatives for future runs should it become necessary) and the Raspberry Pi community for support.

With a bit of luck and hard work everyone will love their Over:Board and in-turn their Raspberry Pi PC, the communities can combine and expand even more and a whole new world of educational and enthusiast electronics will begin! 
Over:ExposureCompetition: I am giving away one of the prototype boards to the winner of the first competition. The winner will be chosen at random once the Indiegogo campaign ends. To enter the competition either:A) follow @OverDevices on Twitter and retweet the competition postB) follow @OverDevices on Instagram and share the competition post to your story
If you do both, you will be entered into the competition twice!If you'd like to see this project succeed but don't feel ready to support financially and you know someone who might, please spread the word as much as you can. If you or anyone you know can offer any other type of support then I would be more than grateful to hear from you, so please do get in touch!
Thank you for reading my campaign and stay safe.
 
* Raspberry Pi 4 Compute Module not included with Over:Board as you may already have one and they are (or will be) readily available from online retailers

story:
"We’ve cracked the “code” for Academic success and career preparation for young adults in America and we need your help to share this knowledge with the people for FREE."

 

What is Roadmap360?

 

Roadmap360, at its core, is an innovative and powerful planning tool with a focus on connecting high school students, college students, and parents with opportunities and resources to save time and money throughout their academic journey.  Imagine Roamap360 as a “GPS” guiding students from their starting point to optional paths for their education and future career. The platform offers members:

Simplicity

  • Simplified education and career planning with an easy-to-follow process.
  • Relevant information in a concise and easy to digest format.

Interactive Roadmap Plans

  • Intuitive and interactive “Roadmap Plans” tailored to each user’s profile.
  • Plans that progress and adjust based on current grade level.
  • Simulation and comparison of multiple education and career paths.

Tailored Recommendations

  • Recommendations to match students and parents with tailored opportunities and resources.
  • Specific advancement and enrichment programs to graduate early and save money on tuition.
  • Spotlight on career specific in-demand skills, certifications, and licenses.

 

How does the Roadmap360 platform work?

 

 

 

Roadmap360 for U.S high school and college students

The Roadmap360 platform is designed as a source of supplemental guidance to help students with some of the fundamental questions that they are, or should be, asking at this juncture in their lives:

  • What do I want to do with my life?
  • What school do I want to go to after high school?
  • How much does it cost?
  • What are the requirements?
  • How much can I expect to make starting out?
  • Will I be able to find jobs when I graduate?
  • How do I get from where I am to where I want to be?

Whether a student already has some ideas of the path they want to follow or they are struggling for direction, the platform’s proprietary “Roadmap Wizard” will assist in exploring those fundamental questions and develop “interactive plans”.

 

Roadmap360 makes it easier for parents and guardians to be more involved in the conversation. The platform features exclusive planning tools and content tailored specifically for parents to better assist, encourage and support their children at every step on their academic journey.

Based upon certain profile characteristics, the system will strategically show parents relevant information on requirements, deadlines, enrichment programs, scholarships, internships and other resources to help their children make more informed decisions when and where necessary.

 

What makes Roadmap360 different?

While the platform’s streamlined process and interactive plans are innovative, the real value for our members will be the A.I. (Artificial Intelligence) generated recommendations tailored to each unique “Roadmap Plan”.  

 

These recommendations will provide the most efficient and optimal steps towards each individual’s chosen path. Imagine Roadmap360 as a digital version of a high school guidance counselor dedicated solely to your best interests.

 

Our Story

The Roadmap360 concept was partially inspired by my academic and career journey. Throughout my high school matriculation, I learned about various the programs that could accelerate my studies.   However, I failed to take advantage of the available programs due to the lack of academic guidance.

As a father of two high school students, I would like my boys to experience the benefits of educational opportunities. During my undergraduate years, I earned twelve credits by taking the French College Level Examination. Therefore, the Roadmap360 platform concept was conceived. 

We at Roadmap360 have made it our mission to empower the next generation.
You may be asking, “Who is the next generation?” minorities, internationals, and disenfranchised. It is our focus at Roadmap360 to help the next generation break the cycle of student debt and take advantage of all available resources to climb the ladder of success.
 

 

 

Why Indiegogo?

We’ve spent the last four years designing the system’s architecture and all its complex data requirements. Over the last two years, we’ve built out our proof of concept and brought the vision to reality. This project, until now, has been self-funded but in order to complete our prototype and move to a freely available web site and mobile application, we need funding to cover:

We need your support to take these next steps.

 

Revenue model

Similar to many other software platforms offering free products and solutions, the Roadmap360 platform will rely primarily on ad-based and affiliate revenue models to sustain ongoing operations and growth. These models will include but are not limited to highly targeted ads to our user base from

  • Colleges and Universities
  • Trade schools
  • Content providers
  • Program providers
  • Others

 

 

 

 

 

Every dollar contributed by our backers will go towards keeping the platform FREE for all students and parents, continuing the platform’s development, adding content, and maintenance. For this reason, we’ve crafted a number of unique reward packages to limit expenses and allocate our backer’s funding where it’s needed the most, the Roadmap360 platform.

Rewards

  • Early access to the Roadmap360 Beta system
  • Listed as a supporter on the Roadmap360 Official website (if you wish)
  • Special mention on our social media (if you wish)
  • Monthly progress update until launch
  • Custom branded 5X7 Journal Notebook w/ Roamap360 logo (4 colors)
  • Handcrafted Caribbean styled kite (32”). Due to their fragile nature, shipping is not an option. They will have to be picked up in Brooklyn or I can deliver within the 5 boroughs. (Limited) 
  • Instructional Kite building video
  • Naming rights to three scholarships (Limited) 
  • Ultra Rare Original Script from the production studios of Stargate SG1 TV Show - personally signed by principal actors. (Limited)

story:
日本語の説明は英語に続きます。

Hi! We are Ahhyun, Kokoro, Len, Hinah, and Tomo, a team of five Sophia University students. We conduct self-empowerment and leadership workshops for youth across Japan.

 

RISE Mission

RISE was created by students for students. Our mission is to enable youth to become changemakers by building their creative confidence and lighting the path into the realm of unknown possibilities. 

 

Why we started RISE:

Most people care about what they leave TO the next generation. At RISE, we care about what we leave WITHIN them!

We want to inspire and help youth build the self-confidence they need to explore their purpose, pursue their passion and envision their own dream of enacting social change in their communities. 

That's why we will set out around Japan this summer to engage with young students through carefully designed self-empowerment and leadership workshops.

 

How we will create impact: 

We will be travelling across Japan for six weeks starting from August 2021 to deliver our workshops. In preparation, over the past year we have built up our skills by hosting workshops for our fellow students. For this roadtrip we have already confirmed over 10 youth communities and scheduled more than 15 workshops in 10 prefectures. 

We have partnered up with Girl Possible, an experienced US-based NPO that teaches leadership skills to young girls in the US. They have not only inspired us to do the same for young students in Japan, but have also provided us with invaluable advice on delivering our own workshops.

We are excited to expand our impact to a national level and engage with the hundreds of middle school and high school students awaiting us!! Please make a donation to help us reach them!
 

Why are we doing this? & Why does this matter?

Today we are living through fast changing and challenging times that can feel overwhelming. But this is also a time of opportunities and we want the youth to see that. RISE is a dedication to our younger selves, and those moments when we didn’t know what our future would hold for us.

All of us had role models that encouraged us at different stages to follow our own passions and strive to create impact in the communities we live in. Now, we want to do the same for the youth in Japan.

We deeply resonated with Girl Possible’s framing of this workshop. Just like them, we believe that asking young students what they want to do in the future is not the best approach. Instead we need to ask them, "What kind of change do you want to create in the world, and how can you begin to achieve that dream today?"

We also believe the design thinking mindset, method and tools have the power to enable social change. We have had the opportunity to be immersed in design thinking during our training at the Hasso Plattner Institute and the Stanford University Innovation Fellows programs and we have felt empowered by it. In the past year we have also created and conducted several design thinking workshops in our communities.
 

Design thinking is a creative process for approaching any problem. It starts with getting to know the user and moves through steps for defining the "user need" and challenge, brainstorming solutions, building prototype, and trying them out!
 

THE WORKSHOP

Adapted from our partners at Girl Possible, the two-hour-long "Find Your Drive" workshops each cater to 15-20 students from middle school or high school between the ages 13-18. Using the design thinking mindset, the workshop enables youth to uncover their unique leadership styles, discuss the issues that matter most to them, and reframe them as opportunities to make a change - all while laughing, playing, and bonding. 

Why do we need your support & What are you funding?

What do you get in return for your contribution?

This project is deeply personal, emotional and meaningful to us. By supporting one student's  dream and creating impact through our work, you too become a part of our journey. We believe this is not just about ourselves, or the youth we reach directly, the schools, or even yourself, our generous donor. This is bigger than all of us! It is about bringing positivity and hope for the future to young people in Japan and inspiring the next generation of changemakers. 

During our trip we will provide regular updates on the progress through our Instagram posts as well as on the Video Blog we will set up specifically for this purpose. We will also provide a final report at the end of our project.
 

Partners and Supporters

Testimonials

RISE TEAM:

AHHYUN ROH is a candidate for a bachelor of sociology and anthropology at Sophia University and her passion is to build a better education system, especially for the youth. She is a former Hult Prize Campus Director at Sophia University and a former video editor at the embassy of the Republic of Korea in Tokyo, Japan. She acquired a design thinking mindset through the Hasso Plattner Institute and was a delegate of the 2020 UN Peace Summit in Bangkok.

KOKORO KUROIWA is a fourth-year student in Sophia University’s Law Department, studying human rights issues. She also studies design thinking as another unique approach and mindset of problem-solving. She has a keen interest in creating an environment where everyone can explore and pursue their passion in society.

LEN YAMADA is a fourth year student in Sophia University’s Liberal Arts program focusing on International Business. Being born and raised in Hawaii taught him to be open minded in a culturally diverse environment. His goal is to influence participants to have a flexible perspective on social issues, and to awaken their inner confidence to make a positive impact on society.

HINAH E. MIAN hails from the Philippines and Pakistan. She is a political science major at Sophia University and is pursuing a concurrent Masters degree in Development Studies at the Graduate Institute in Geneva. She is the co-founder of Horizon, a student empowerment organisation, president of the Sophia Debate Club and learned design thinking at the Hasso Plattner Institute. She is determined to grow and capacitate not only herself but others to lead initiatives for sustainable social change.

TOMO LOEER is pursuing a B.A. degree from Sophia University, where he immersed himself in business, politics and anthropology. Tomo is co-founder of Horizon, a Sophia student group, a Hasso Plattner Institute design school course alumnus as well as a University Innovation Fellow at Stanford University.  He is passionate about design thinking, education and entrepreneurship.

 

Stay in Touch!

  • Connect with us on Facebook and Instagram @rise2021official 
  • Check out our website to learn more: rebrand.ly/rise2021
  • Or send us an email at risejapan2021@gmail.com
     

Risks

We are aware of the risks associated with organizing this roadtrip in the midst of the pandemic. In this sense we are taking all the precautionary measures. All team members will strictly follow COVID-19 precautionary measures prior to conducting all workshops: the submission of COVID-19 self-test kit’s result every two weeks, temperature measurement report, mask, and frequent sanitization. We are also equipped to deliver all workshops in the virtual format. We have confirmed the support of our local partners in all the prefectures in emergency situations.

 

未来のチェンジメーカーたちよ、
共に立ち上がろう!!

初めまして！私たち、アヒョン、こころ、レン、ヒナ、ともは上智大学の学生です。私たちのRISEチームは、日本各地の若者を対象に、セルフエンパワーメントとリーダーシップのワークショップを行っています。
 

RISEを始めたきっかけ:

多くの人が次世代に物理的な富や遺産を残すことを重視しています。しかし私達RISEは、次世代を担う若者にどのような価値観や信念を継承するのかに重きを置いています！

RISEは、若者が自分の目的の探究、情熱を持っていることの追求、社会に変化をもたらすために必要な自信をつけることを促進し、サポートします。

そのためにこの夏、日本全国の若者を対象にセルフエンパワーメントとリーダーシップのワークショップを開催します。

 

RISEの活動： 

2021年の8月から6週間のロードトリップで日本各地を回ってワークショップを開催します。これに先駆け、この1年間、私たちは大学生のために様々なワークショップの開催し、スキルや経験を培ってきました。今現在、10都道府県にて、若者のコミュニティと共に15回以上のワークショップを行う予定です。

その為に、アメリカで女子生徒にリーダーシップスキルを教えているGirl PossibleというNPOとパートナーシップを結びました。彼らは、私たちも日本の若い世代のためにこのような機会を作るという想いを抱かせてくれただけではなく、ワークショップの開催にあたっても貴重なサポートをしてくれています。

何百人もの中高生と出会い、共に活動することを心待ちにしています！この活動を広めて全国的にワークショップを届けるために、クラウドファンディグへのご協力をお願いします！

RISEのミッション

RISEは学生による学生のための団体です。RISEは、若者がチェンジメーカー、つまり「社会に変化をもたらす者」になることを後押しします。想像力を発揮させ、自分に自信をつけるためのサポートをし、未知の可能性への道を照らします。

この活動の意義

今日、私たちは目まぐるしい変化や厳しい困難の中を生き、時には圧倒されるように感じることもあります。しかし、これは同時に「転機の時代でもある」ということを、若者に伝えたいのです。RISEは、私たち自身が未来を不安に思った若い頃の自分に捧げるものでもあります。

私たちはそれぞれ、人生のあらゆる段階で憧れの人物から励みを受けてきました。その励みは、自分が熱心に取り組んでいることを貫き、身近なコミュニティーに変化を生み出すための後押しとなりました。今、私たちは日本の若者にも励みとなるきっかけを作りたいです。

Girl Possibleのワークショップは、私たちのこの思いとぴったり重なりました。彼らと同じように、私たちも若者に「将来は何になりたいのですか」と尋ねることは、最良のアプローチではないと考えています。それよりも、「あなたは社会にどんな変化をもたらしたいのか、そしてその夢を今日からどのように実現できるのか」を問うべきだと思います。


このワークショップは社会に変化をもたらす１つのツールとして、デザイン思考の手法や考え方を取り入れています。私たちはハッソ・プラットナー・インスティチュートやスタンフォード大学のイノベーション・フェロー・プログラムを通じて、デザイン思考の知識を習得し、実際に複数のデザイン思考に基づくワークショップを開催することで経験を培ってきました。

スタンフォード大学などの名門大学で教えられているこのデザイン思考は、複雑な問題を革新的なおかつクリエイティブに解決するプロセスです。デザイン思考では、ユーザーを知ることから始まり、「ユーザーのニーズ」と「課題」を定義し、解決するためのアイデアを具体的なプロトタイプとして可視化し、ユーザーと共に試すというステップを辿ります！

ワークショップについて

Girl Possibleのワークショップをもとにした2時間のFind Your Drive「未知しるべ」ワークショップは、13歳から18歳までの中学・高校生15〜20名を対象に実施しています。このワークショップでは、生徒たちが笑ったり、遊んだり、絆を深めたりしながら、自分らしいリーダーシップの取り方を見つけ、解決したい課題について議論し、「問題」としてではなく、それらを変化を起こす「機会」として捉え直すことができるようにします。

 

なぜ皆様からのサポートが必要なのか＆寄付金の使用用途

第1目標金額 - 850,000
私たちは、ワークショップを無料で提供します。しかし、私たちのワークショップを必要としているすべての人に届けるために皆様のご支援が必要です。このクラウドファンディングキャンペーンにご協力いただくと、プロジェクトに掛かる交通費、ワークショップ開催のための備品費、6週間の旅費のすべてをカバーすることに貢献していただけます。

宿泊費やワークショプのツールキットの作成費は、寛大な寄付者、企業スポンサー、そしてパートナーであるGirl Possibleからすでに支援していただいています。


第2の目標金額  - 1,200,000
日本国内を移動することは、コストがかかるだけでなく、環境にも大きな影響を及ぼします。そこで、第2の目標金額を達成できた場合、長距離移動の際には、飛行機ではなく二酸化炭素排出量の少ない新幹線を利用するための追加資金へと割り当てます。


第2の目標金額以上、寄付金が集まった場合
第2の目標金額を超えた場合、追加の資金はすべて、プロジェクトの目的に沿った活動のために利用します。これには、若者のコミュニティにワークショップのツールキットを無料で提供し続けること、日本向けのツールキットを開発すること、新しいチームメンバーのスキル取得に掛かる費用などを含みます。


ご支援の返礼として受け取るもの
このプロジェクトは、私たち1人1人の思いが詰まっており、非常に意味のあるものです。ご支援により、皆様も私たちの活動の一部となります。このプロジェクトは、1人の若者、1つの学校、１つの地域に対してだけではなく、それよりはるかに大きなものに貢献していると信じています。それは、日本の若者に前向きな気持ちと未来への希望をもたらし、未来のチェンジメーカーになるきっかけを与えることです。
プロジェクト実施期間中には、インスタグラムと専用に開設するビデオブログでの近況報告を行います。さらにプロジェクトの終了後、最終報告も行います。
 

パートナーとサポーター

参加者の声

チームメンバーについて: 

ノ・アヒョンは、ノ・アヒョンは、上智大学国際教養学部で社会学と人類学を学んでいます。特に若者のためにより良い教育システムを構築することに情熱を注いでいます。彼女は上智大学の元ハルトプライズキャンパスディレクターであり、東京の駐日韓国大使館の韓国語学習YouTubeチャンネル〈チナセムtv〉の編集制作を担当しました。ハッソ・プラットナー・インスティテュートでデザイン思考を学び、バンコクで開催された2020年国連平和サミットの代表を務めました。。

黒岩こころは上智大学法学部の4年生で、人権問題を研究しています。また、問題解決のためのユニークなアプローチとして、デザイン思考を学んでいます。彼女は社会の中で誰もが自分の情熱を追求できる環境を作ることに力を注いでいます。

山田レンは、上智大学国際教養学部の4年生で、インターナショナルビジネスを専攻しています。ハワイで生まれ育った彼は、多様な文化に触れる環境の中でオープンマインドになることを学びました。彼の目標は、人々が社会問題に対して柔軟な視点を持ち、社会にポジティブな影響をもたらすための自信を呼び覚ますことです。

ミアン・ヒナは、フィリピンとパキスタン出身です。上智大学で政治学を専攻し、ジュネーブの大学院で開発学の修士号取得を目指しています。学生のエンパワーメント団体であるHorizonの共同設立者でもあり、上智大学ディベート部の代表を務めています。自分だけの成長のみならず、他の人も成長することで、共に率先して持続可能な社会変革のために行動を取ります。

ロエル朋大は、上智大学国際教養学部でビジネス、政治、人類学を学んでいます。また、上智大学の学生団体 Horizonの共同設立者であり、ハッソ・プラットナー・インスティテュートの卒業生、及びスタンフォード大学のユニバーシティ・イノベーション・フェローでもあります。 デザイン思考や教育、起業家精神に強い興味関心を持っています。
 

お問い合わせ

  • 私たちのFacebook や Instagram @rise2021official からご連絡ください。
  • 活動の詳細はRISEのウェブサイトから: rebrand.ly/rise2021
  • Eメールはこちらから：risejapan2021@gmail.com
     

リスクへの対策

私たちは、パンデミックの最中にこのロードトリップを開催することに伴うリスクに備え、あらゆる予防措置を講じています。全チームメンバーは、すべてのワークショップを実施する前に、PCR検査を2週間ごとに受け、体温測定レポート、マスクの着用、頻繁な除菌など、COVID-19の予防措置を厳格に遵守します。また、すべてのワークショップをオンライン形式で実施できる体制を整えています。緊急時に備えて、訪れる各地域の現地パートナーからのサポートを受けられる体制を確保しています。
story_txt:
日本語の説明は英語に続きます。Hi! We are Ahhyun, Kokoro, Len, Hinah, and Tomo, a team of five Sophia University students. We conduct self-empowerment and leadership workshops for youth across Japan. RISE MissionRISE was created by students for students. Our mission is to enable youth to become changemakers by building their creative confidence and lighting the path into the realm of unknown possibilities.  Why we started RISE:Most people care about what they leave TO the next generation. At RISE, we care about what we leave WITHIN them!We want to inspire and help youth build the self-confidence they need to explore their purpose, pursue their passion and envision their own dream of enacting social change in their communities. That's why we will set out around Japan this summer to engage with young students through carefully designed self-empowerment and leadership workshops. How we will create impact: We will be travelling across Japan for six weeks starting from August 2021 to deliver our workshops. In preparation, over the past year we have built up our skills by hosting workshops for our fellow students. For this roadtrip we have already confirmed over 10 youth communities and scheduled more than 15 workshops in 10 prefectures. We have partnered up with Girl Possible, an experienced US-based NPO that teaches leadership skills to young girls in the US. They have not only inspired us to do the same for young students in Japan, but have also provided us with invaluable advice on delivering our own workshops.We are excited to expand our impact to a national level and engage with the hundreds of middle school and high school students awaiting us!! Please make a donation to help us reach them! Why are we doing this? & Why does this matter?Today we are living through fast changing and challenging times that can feel overwhelming. But this is also a time of opportunities and we want the youth to see that. RISE is a dedication to our younger selves, and those moments when we didn’t know what our future would hold for us.All of us had role models that encouraged us at different stages to follow our own passions and strive to create impact in the communities we live in. Now, we want to do the same for the youth in Japan.We deeply resonated with Girl Possible’s framing of this workshop. Just like them, we believe that asking young students what they want to do in the future is not the best approach. Instead we need to ask them, "What kind of change do you want to create in the world, and how can you begin to achieve that dream today?"We also believe the design thinking mindset, method and tools have the power to enable social change. We have had the opportunity to be immersed in design thinking during our training at the Hasso Plattner Institute and the Stanford University Innovation Fellows programs and we have felt empowered by it. In the past year we have also created and conducted several design thinking workshops in our communities. Design thinking is a creative process for approaching any problem. It starts with getting to know the user and moves through steps for defining the "user need" and challenge, brainstorming solutions, building prototype, and trying them out! THE WORKSHOPAdapted from our partners at Girl Possible, the two-hour-long "Find Your Drive" workshops each cater to 15-20 students from middle school or high school between the ages 13-18. Using the design thinking mindset, the workshop enables youth to uncover their unique leadership styles, discuss the issues that matter most to them, and reframe them as opportunities to make a change - all while laughing, playing, and bonding. Why do we need your support & What are you funding?What do you get in return for your contribution?This project is deeply personal, emotional and meaningful to us. By supporting one student's  dream and creating impact through our work, you too become a part of our journey. We believe this is not just about ourselves, or the youth we reach directly, the schools, or even yourself, our generous donor. This is bigger than all of us! It is about bringing positivity and hope for the future to young people in Japan and inspiring the next generation of changemakers. During our trip we will provide regular updates on the progress through our Instagram posts as well as on the Video Blog we will set up specifically for this purpose. We will also provide a final report at the end of our project. Partners and SupportersTestimonialsRISE TEAM:AHHYUN ROH is a candidate for a bachelor of sociology and anthropology at Sophia University and her passion is to build a better education system, especially for the youth. She is a former Hult Prize Campus Director at Sophia University and a former video editor at the embassy of the Republic of Korea in Tokyo, Japan. She acquired a design thinking mindset through the Hasso Plattner Institute and was a delegate of the 2020 UN Peace Summit in Bangkok.KOKORO KUROIWA is a fourth-year student in Sophia University’s Law Department, studying human rights issues. She also studies design thinking as another unique approach and mindset of problem-solving. She has a keen interest in creating an environment where everyone can explore and pursue their passion in society.LEN YAMADA is a fourth year student in Sophia University’s Liberal Arts program focusing on International Business. Being born and raised in Hawaii taught him to be open minded in a culturally diverse environment. His goal is to influence participants to have a flexible perspective on social issues, and to awaken their inner confidence to make a positive impact on society.HINAH E. MIAN hails from the Philippines and Pakistan. She is a political science major at Sophia University and is pursuing a concurrent Masters degree in Development Studies at the Graduate Institute in Geneva. She is the co-founder of Horizon, a student empowerment organisation, president of the Sophia Debate Club and learned design thinking at the Hasso Plattner Institute. She is determined to grow and capacitate not only herself but others to lead initiatives for sustainable social change.TOMO LOEER is pursuing a B.A. degree from Sophia University, where he immersed himself in business, politics and anthropology. Tomo is co-founder of Horizon, a Sophia student group, a Hasso Plattner Institute design school course alumnus as well as a University Innovation Fellow at Stanford University.  He is passionate about design thinking, education and entrepreneurship. Stay in Touch!
Connect with us on Facebook and Instagram @rise2021official 

Check out our website to learn more: rebrand.ly/rise2021

Or send us an email at risejapan2021@gmail.com 
RisksWe are aware of the risks associated with organizing this roadtrip in the midst of the pandemic. In this sense we are taking all the precautionary measures. All team members will strictly follow COVID-19 precautionary measures prior to conducting all workshops: the submission of COVID-19 self-test kit’s result every two weeks, temperature measurement report, mask, and frequent sanitization. We are also equipped to deliver all workshops in the virtual format. We have confirmed the support of our local partners in all the prefectures in emergency situations. 未来のチェンジメーカーたちよ、共に立ち上がろう!!初めまして！私たち、アヒョン、こころ、レン、ヒナ、ともは上智大学の学生です。私たちのRISEチームは、日本各地の若者を対象に、セルフエンパワーメントとリーダーシップのワークショップを行っています。 RISEを始めたきっかけ:多くの人が次世代に物理的な富や遺産を残すことを重視しています。しかし私達RISEは、次世代を担う若者にどのような価値観や信念を継承するのかに重きを置いています！RISEは、若者が自分の目的の探究、情熱を持っていることの追求、社会に変化をもたらすために必要な自信をつけることを促進し、サポートします。そのためにこの夏、日本全国の若者を対象にセルフエンパワーメントとリーダーシップのワークショップを開催します。 RISEの活動： 2021年の8月から6週間のロードトリップで日本各地を回ってワークショップを開催します。これに先駆け、この1年間、私たちは大学生のために様々なワークショップの開催し、スキルや経験を培ってきました。今現在、10都道府県にて、若者のコミュニティと共に15回以上のワークショップを行う予定です。その為に、アメリカで女子生徒にリーダーシップスキルを教えているGirl PossibleというNPOとパートナーシップを結びました。彼らは、私たちも日本の若い世代のためにこのような機会を作るという想いを抱かせてくれただけではなく、ワークショップの開催にあたっても貴重なサポートをしてくれています。何百人もの中高生と出会い、共に活動することを心待ちにしています！この活動を広めて全国的にワークショップを届けるために、クラウドファンディグへのご協力をお願いします！RISEのミッションRISEは学生による学生のための団体です。RISEは、若者がチェンジメーカー、つまり「社会に変化をもたらす者」になることを後押しします。想像力を発揮させ、自分に自信をつけるためのサポートをし、未知の可能性への道を照らします。この活動の意義今日、私たちは目まぐるしい変化や厳しい困難の中を生き、時には圧倒されるように感じることもあります。しかし、これは同時に「転機の時代でもある」ということを、若者に伝えたいのです。RISEは、私たち自身が未来を不安に思った若い頃の自分に捧げるものでもあります。私たちはそれぞれ、人生のあらゆる段階で憧れの人物から励みを受けてきました。その励みは、自分が熱心に取り組んでいることを貫き、身近なコミュニティーに変化を生み出すための後押しとなりました。今、私たちは日本の若者にも励みとなるきっかけを作りたいです。Girl Possibleのワークショップは、私たちのこの思いとぴったり重なりました。彼らと同じように、私たちも若者に「将来は何になりたいのですか」と尋ねることは、最良のアプローチではないと考えています。それよりも、「あなたは社会にどんな変化をもたらしたいのか、そしてその夢を今日からどのように実現できるのか」を問うべきだと思います。このワークショップは社会に変化をもたらす１つのツールとして、デザイン思考の手法や考え方を取り入れています。私たちはハッソ・プラットナー・インスティチュートやスタンフォード大学のイノベーション・フェロー・プログラムを通じて、デザイン思考の知識を習得し、実際に複数のデザイン思考に基づくワークショップを開催することで経験を培ってきました。スタンフォード大学などの名門大学で教えられているこのデザイン思考は、複雑な問題を革新的なおかつクリエイティブに解決するプロセスです。デザイン思考では、ユーザーを知ることから始まり、「ユーザーのニーズ」と「課題」を定義し、解決するためのアイデアを具体的なプロトタイプとして可視化し、ユーザーと共に試すというステップを辿ります！ワークショップについてGirl Possibleのワークショップをもとにした2時間のFind Your Drive「未知しるべ」ワークショップは、13歳から18歳までの中学・高校生15〜20名を対象に実施しています。このワークショップでは、生徒たちが笑ったり、遊んだり、絆を深めたりしながら、自分らしいリーダーシップの取り方を見つけ、解決したい課題について議論し、「問題」としてではなく、それらを変化を起こす「機会」として捉え直すことができるようにします。 なぜ皆様からのサポートが必要なのか＆寄付金の使用用途第1目標金額 - 850,000私たちは、ワークショップを無料で提供します。しかし、私たちのワークショップを必要としているすべての人に届けるために皆様のご支援が必要です。このクラウドファンディングキャンペーンにご協力いただくと、プロジェクトに掛かる交通費、ワークショップ開催のための備品費、6週間の旅費のすべてをカバーすることに貢献していただけます。宿泊費やワークショプのツールキットの作成費は、寛大な寄付者、企業スポンサー、そしてパートナーであるGirl Possibleからすでに支援していただいています。第2の目標金額  - 1,200,000日本国内を移動することは、コストがかかるだけでなく、環境にも大きな影響を及ぼします。そこで、第2の目標金額を達成できた場合、長距離移動の際には、飛行機ではなく二酸化炭素排出量の少ない新幹線を利用するための追加資金へと割り当てます。第2の目標金額以上、寄付金が集まった場合第2の目標金額を超えた場合、追加の資金はすべて、プロジェクトの目的に沿った活動のために利用します。これには、若者のコミュニティにワークショップのツールキットを無料で提供し続けること、日本向けのツールキットを開発すること、新しいチームメンバーのスキル取得に掛かる費用などを含みます。ご支援の返礼として受け取るものこのプロジェクトは、私たち1人1人の思いが詰まっており、非常に意味のあるものです。ご支援により、皆様も私たちの活動の一部となります。このプロジェクトは、1人の若者、1つの学校、１つの地域に対してだけではなく、それよりはるかに大きなものに貢献していると信じています。それは、日本の若者に前向きな気持ちと未来への希望をもたらし、未来のチェンジメーカーになるきっかけを与えることです。プロジェクト実施期間中には、インスタグラムと専用に開設するビデオブログでの近況報告を行います。さらにプロジェクトの終了後、最終報告も行います。 パートナーとサポーター参加者の声チームメンバーについて: ノ・アヒョンは、ノ・アヒョンは、上智大学国際教養学部で社会学と人類学を学んでいます。特に若者のためにより良い教育システムを構築することに情熱を注いでいます。彼女は上智大学の元ハルトプライズキャンパスディレクターであり、東京の駐日韓国大使館の韓国語学習YouTubeチャンネル〈チナセムtv〉の編集制作を担当しました。ハッソ・プラットナー・インスティテュートでデザイン思考を学び、バンコクで開催された2020年国連平和サミットの代表を務めました。。黒岩こころは上智大学法学部の4年生で、人権問題を研究しています。また、問題解決のためのユニークなアプローチとして、デザイン思考を学んでいます。彼女は社会の中で誰もが自分の情熱を追求できる環境を作ることに力を注いでいます。山田レンは、上智大学国際教養学部の4年生で、インターナショナルビジネスを専攻しています。ハワイで生まれ育った彼は、多様な文化に触れる環境の中でオープンマインドになることを学びました。彼の目標は、人々が社会問題に対して柔軟な視点を持ち、社会にポジティブな影響をもたらすための自信を呼び覚ますことです。ミアン・ヒナは、フィリピンとパキスタン出身です。上智大学で政治学を専攻し、ジュネーブの大学院で開発学の修士号取得を目指しています。学生のエンパワーメント団体であるHorizonの共同設立者でもあり、上智大学ディベート部の代表を務めています。自分だけの成長のみならず、他の人も成長することで、共に率先して持続可能な社会変革のために行動を取ります。ロエル朋大は、上智大学国際教養学部でビジネス、政治、人類学を学んでいます。また、上智大学の学生団体 Horizonの共同設立者であり、ハッソ・プラットナー・インスティテュートの卒業生、及びスタンフォード大学のユニバーシティ・イノベーション・フェローでもあります。 デザイン思考や教育、起業家精神に強い興味関心を持っています。 お問い合わせ
私たちのFacebook や Instagram @rise2021official からご連絡ください。
活動の詳細はRISEのウェブサイトから: rebrand.ly/rise2021

Eメールはこちらから：risejapan2021@gmail.com 
リスクへの対策私たちは、パンデミックの最中にこのロードトリップを開催することに伴うリスクに備え、あらゆる予防措置を講じています。全チームメンバーは、すべてのワークショップを実施する前に、PCR検査を2週間ごとに受け、体温測定レポート、マスクの着用、頻繁な除菌など、COVID-19の予防措置を厳格に遵守します。また、すべてのワークショップをオンライン形式で実施できる体制を整えています。緊急時に備えて、訪れる各地域の現地パートナーからのサポートを受けられる体制を確保しています。

story:
Stretch Goal 1: $7,800

This goal will allow us to add a payment portal within the app and Spark Tokens (plus other awards for students) to allow for monetization that will go toward future development, mentor hires, and new team hires to make your educational experience the best it can be.

 

 

 

 

 

 

These grand ideas are the future of the company Inlight, however, we all know Rome wasn't built in a day. It takes individual steps to walk a mile.

 

The first step in the Inlight journey is Inlight Trading

Max quit his 30hr/week job in high school to trade stocks for a living.  Starting with just $300, Max was able to pay his living expenses with his profits each month.

One day a fellow stock trader in an online forum asked Max to mentor him. This request turned on a light bulb in Max's head as he realized he could combine his two passions: trading and education.

Over the course of five years, Max developed a unique education model that perfectly combines one-on-one mentorship with easily distributable educational content.

As Max honed in on his own skill as a mentor and raised numerous students from the ground up to become consistently profitable traders, he also worked every day to perfect an education model of teaching students then providing a job for students once they master the educational material.

 

 

 

 

One feature we plan to add to the Inlight App is Trade Tracking. This feature will allow users to safely and securely connect their brokerage accounts to automatically pull trade data into the Inlight App (manual entry can also be an option) and create an easy-to-read trade card (see below) you can share on social media, send to friends, or share with a trained Inlight mentor for personal trade analysis.

Our goal is for the app to automatically track students' trades and help categorize them to make it super easy for mentors to provide quality education on each and every single trade taken.

If we reach our stretch goals, the app could also have an implemented AI that helps students find patterns in their trading to maximize profits and minimize losses.

 

 

 

 

We designed Quest Lines for the Inlight App to provide a seamless way to learn from a series of video lessons, written lessons, coaching sessions, community activities, task assignments, and more that are designed to guide students through the journey of learning.

Our goal is for these Quest Lines to offer a more exploratory approach to the learning process where students have the opportunity to follow a guided path that fits their needs rather than dumping a ton of random lessons on the student and expecting them to automatically understand every important detail.

 

 

 

The Inlight App will allow us to offer Mentorships on a much larger scale.

This mentorship is our signature one-on-one learning experience where each student is assigned to a mentor to receive completely personalized lessons and discussions every single day (many students have seen significant improvements to their trading from this mentorship style).

 

 

 

 

The final feature in the Inlight App would be to provide a platform for Inlight to hire experienced students as mentors to teach and help the next generation of students.

This model can provide an opportunity for experienced students to earn more capital to trade with and further their experience and education.

 

 

 

The Goal with this project is to provide a space for students and educators to expand together with our unique approach to education.

If our education platform for the Stock Market space is a success, then we can expand to other areas of education - eventually teaching all areas of life: Physical Well-being, Mental Well-being, Social Well-being, Financial Well-being, Vocational Well-being, Spiritual Well-being, and Close Relationships/Family.

 

 

 

 

Risks and Challenges

Changing methods in an industry that have been practiced for hundreds of years inherently has many risks and challenges, but for the sake of creating a better education system, we at Inlight think it is worth it to try and change the education paradigm.

Our risks include but are not limited to (solutions are gone over below each risk):

Risk 1. Not getting the Indiegogo project funded.

Problem: Spending time, money, and energy on getting this project funded to be able to produce our education app with a growing user base could end up being time, money, and energy wasted if the project doesn't get funded.

Solution: Carefully manage our time and energy spent promoting the Indiegogo campaign while still providing high-quality education to our current user base. Not spending any money on promoting the campaign will also minimize our capital risk.

---

Risk 2. Creating a great app but not having enough users to generate income and study education results.

Problem: An education system is only as good as its base of students. We can have the best platform and best teachers in the world, but without students, education is meaningless.

Solution: Provide free education to people who back the Indiegogo project as a form of gratitude and a way to inspire supporters to become students and try learning something new (no matter how experienced you are at any skill - but especially trading - there is always something to learn). After the Indiegogo campaign, we will provide paid education on the app to generate income to pay our mentors and developers so the project can continue to expand. Our education model is designed specifically to get better as the company grows - this way scaling does not result in decreased quality.

---

Risk 3. Scaling up too fast resulting in lower quality education.

Problem: A lot of start-up projects suffer from scaling too fast and lose quality from this rapid expansion.

Solution: We have planned for this in advance and will only let a certain number of users enter the paid portions of the app at a time so mentors are not overwhelmed with an influx of students. As more people apply to become mentors, we can then increase the number of paid user spots to balance the student-mentor ratio. As long as this ratio is balanced, the quality of education can be maintained and even increase over time as we learn more about different types of students and factor in these findings to better education.

----------

THE BIGGEST CHALLENGE WE HAVE IN FRONT OF US RIGHT NOW IS GETTING THIS INDIEGOGO PROJECT FUNDED...
...so if you want to support this project in even the slightest way, every small donations counts. Crowdfunding works best the larger the crowd is. Even if you can only donate $1, that is better than $0 and gets us $1 closer to our goal.

YOU are the solution to getting over this challenge and we appreciate any amount you back to get over this hurdle.
story_txt:
Stretch Goal 1: $7,800
This goal will allow us to add a payment portal within the app and Spark Tokens (plus other awards for students) to allow for monetization that will go toward future development, mentor hires, and new team hires to make your educational experience the best it can be.
 
 
 
 
 

 
These grand ideas are the future of the company Inlight, however, we all know Rome wasn't built in a day. It takes individual steps to walk a mile.
 
The first step in the Inlight journey is Inlight Trading
Max quit his 30hr/week job in high school to trade stocks for a living.  Starting with just $300, Max was able to pay his living expenses with his profits each month.
One day a fellow stock trader in an online forum asked Max to mentor him. This request turned on a light bulb in Max's head as he realized he could combine his two passions: trading and education.
Over the course of five years, Max developed a unique education model that perfectly combines one-on-one mentorship with easily distributable educational content.
As Max honed in on his own skill as a mentor and raised numerous students from the ground up to become consistently profitable traders, he also worked every day to perfect an education model of teaching students then providing a job for students once they master the educational material.
 

 
 
 

One feature we plan to add to the Inlight App is Trade Tracking. This feature will allow users to safely and securely connect their brokerage accounts to automatically pull trade data into the Inlight App (manual entry can also be an option) and create an easy-to-read trade card (see below) you can share on social media, send to friends, or share with a trained Inlight mentor for personal trade analysis.
Our goal is for the app to automatically track students' trades and help categorize them to make it super easy for mentors to provide quality education on each and every single trade taken.
If we reach our stretch goals, the app could also have an implemented AI that helps students find patterns in their trading to maximize profits and minimize losses.

 
 
 
 

We designed Quest Lines for the Inlight App to provide a seamless way to learn from a series of video lessons, written lessons, coaching sessions, community activities, task assignments, and more that are designed to guide students through the journey of learning.
Our goal is for these Quest Lines to offer a more exploratory approach to the learning process where students have the opportunity to follow a guided path that fits their needs rather than dumping a ton of random lessons on the student and expecting them to automatically understand every important detail.
   The Inlight App will allow us to offer Mentorships on a much larger scale.This mentorship is our signature one-on-one learning experience where each student is assigned to a mentor to receive completely personalized lessons and discussions every single day (many students have seen significant improvements to their trading from this mentorship style).    The final feature in the Inlight App would be to provide a platform for Inlight to hire experienced students as mentors to teach and help the next generation of students.This model can provide an opportunity for experienced students to earn more capital to trade with and further their experience and education.   The Goal with this project is to provide a space for students and educators to expand together with our unique approach to education.If our education platform for the Stock Market space is a success, then we can expand to other areas of education - eventually teaching all areas of life: Physical Well-being, Mental Well-being, Social Well-being, Financial Well-being, Vocational Well-being, Spiritual Well-being, and Close Relationships/Family.    Risks and ChallengesChanging methods in an industry that have been practiced for hundreds of years inherently has many risks and challenges, but for the sake of creating a better education system, we at Inlight think it is worth it to try and change the education paradigm.Our risks include but are not limited to (solutions are gone over below each risk):Risk 1. Not getting the Indiegogo project funded.Problem: Spending time, money, and energy on getting this project funded to be able to produce our education app with a growing user base could end up being time, money, and energy wasted if the project doesn't get funded.Solution: Carefully manage our time and energy spent promoting the Indiegogo campaign while still providing high-quality education to our current user base. Not spending any money on promoting the campaign will also minimize our capital risk.---Risk 2. Creating a great app but not having enough users to generate income and study education results.Problem: An education system is only as good as its base of students. We can have the best platform and best teachers in the world, but without students, education is meaningless.Solution: Provide free education to people who back the Indiegogo project as a form of gratitude and a way to inspire supporters to become students and try learning something new (no matter how experienced you are at any skill - but especially trading - there is always something to learn). After the Indiegogo campaign, we will provide paid education on the app to generate income to pay our mentors and developers so the project can continue to expand. Our education model is designed specifically to get better as the company grows - this way scaling does not result in decreased quality.---Risk 3. Scaling up too fast resulting in lower quality education.Problem: A lot of start-up projects suffer from scaling too fast and lose quality from this rapid expansion.Solution: We have planned for this in advance and will only let a certain number of users enter the paid portions of the app at a time so mentors are not overwhelmed with an influx of students. As more people apply to become mentors, we can then increase the number of paid user spots to balance the student-mentor ratio. As long as this ratio is balanced, the quality of education can be maintained and even increase over time as we learn more about different types of students and factor in these findings to better education.----------THE BIGGEST CHALLENGE WE HAVE IN FRONT OF US RIGHT NOW IS GETTING THIS INDIEGOGO PROJECT FUNDED......so if you want to support this project in even the slightest way, every small donations counts. Crowdfunding works best the larger the crowd is. Even if you can only donate $1, that is better than $0 and gets us $1 closer to our goal.YOU are the solution to getting over this challenge and we appreciate any amount you back to get over this hurdle.

story:
Instagram | Facebook | Twitter | Press pack

 

Hi! We are QUBS, a Swiss company, and we’re launching our first educational toy: Cody Block! 

Cody Block is a Montessori inspired, screen-free wooden toy for children 3+, introducing the basics of computational thinking through tangible programming.
 

It’s a busy city! Go on adventures with Cody, help him find his way home by driving through the cityscape one block at a time! Create and learn the basics of coding, it’s hands on programming!

Cody Block introduces the first concepts of computational thinking to young children via tangible programming. Your task is to lay out a path that leads Cody back to his house by positioning the Building Blocks in a correct order. 

 

Each Building Block gives a unique directional command (turn left, turn right, U turn, repeat last command, stop, record path, play path), together they create a sequence of instructions (the basis of any algorithm). 

 

Cody Block comes with the City Guide, a story book with several exercises & adventures providing different learning outcomes.

 

 

A classic wooden toy combined with patented RFID technology.

 

Children can play with Cody for hours without the need of any smartphone, laptop or screen. We have developed a specific RFID technology (patented!) that is embedded in every wooden block. 

 

Cody Block has been designed with gender equity in mind, it is as much fun for boys as for girls. Also, there are no written information on the toy, it’s ready to play even if your child does not read.

The design of Cody Block takes its inspiration from classic wooden toys and the Montessori philosophy in its material and shape: solid beech wood and intuitive design. We intentionally did not incorporate light or sound, and there are no visible electronics. Just a moving car driving around the city blocks.

 

 

 Your city can be as big as you want, the Building Blocks can be set 20  cm, 50 cm, 1 meter, 10 meters apart! It’s all up to you and your imagination! 

And there are no limits to how many blocks and Cody car you can play with!

 

In this digital age it is important to empower children to be creators and not only passive users of new technologies. The current generation of children will need to be literate in technology in order to understand the world they live in. 

 

Understanding how computers work and learning the basics of coding will not only help children to learn logical thinking but also to develop fundamental problem solving abilities, creativity and resilience. Learning these skills from an early stage creates a natural tendency to assimilate this content in a more efficient way. 

 

Cody helps introducing coding concepts to the little ones. But what will they learn? And how?

Algorithm: An algorithm is a set of rules that define a sequence of operations. When children lay out the Building Blocks for Cody to follow, they are actually giving the computer rules on how and where to move.

Sequencing: Sequencing is the specific order in which instructions are performed in an algorithm. It is important that the steps in an algorithm are performed in the correct order - otherwise the algorithm will not work. In the same way Cody follows the order of the Building Blocks: if one Block is misplaced or there’s a gap in the sequence, Cody will go in the wrong direction.

Debugging: Mistakes in code are called ‘bugs.’ Debugging is a process that includes identifying the problem and then correcting it. Because the Building Blocks are tangible and arranged on a surface for the children to see, it is easier for them to spot the mistake in their code and debug the program.

Function: A function is a part of code that can be called by another part of the program. With Cody, kids can create a function and record it with Cody. Cody will remember that function and perform it again in the code every time he encounters a “Play Function” Block.

Logic: Learning the thinking behind coding teaches children how to tackle large problems by breaking them down into a sequence of smaller, more manageable problems. This logical thinking skill is a powerful tool that can be used in every field and in real life too! 

 

We chose to create a tangible programming language that kids can actually touch with their hands, following the Montessori proposition that kids learn best by experiencing the environment around them. 

 

 

The Cody Block set comes with: 

  •  1 Cody (the little car) with magnetic top and bottom
  •  16 Building Blocks (4 x turn left, 4 x turn right, 2 x U turn, 1 x repeat, 2 x record, 2 x play, 1 x stop)
  •  1 City Guide / story book with exercises 

     

 

There are 7 different Buidling Blocks, each gives a specific order to Cody. Each Cody Block set comes with 16 Building Blocks in total.

  • Blue building > turn LEFT X4 
  • Yellow building > turn RIGHT X4 
  • Green building > U turn X2 
  • Orange building > REPEAT last command X1 
  • Red building > RECORD a path X2 
  • Grey building > PLAY a path X2 
  • Red little house > STOP X1 

     

Here is an interview from Bruce Lamont, a primary school teacher and a Lead Teacher in Zurich with 32 years of experience:

 

 

 You might wonder how Cody detects the instruction commands from the blocks. We are not using any camera recognition. Instead we are using a piece of technology called RFID (Radio-Frequency-Identification). In short, it consists of an antenna (inside Cody) emitting an electromagnetic field in order to detect a tag (inside the blocks) with a unique identification. RFID is commonly used in the industry (contactless payment, door pass, etc.) but it was a challenge to develop that technology to meet Cody Block requirements. We are very proud to say that our use of RFID technology in Cody Block is patented! And don’t worry, the radio frequency we are using is of course safe for your children.

 

 The other advantage with RFID technology is that it means Cody only needs batteries to power up (4 x AA batteries). It works straight out of the box. No Bluetooth, no Wifi required. The Building Blocks are literally just a wooden block with a little tag embedded in it.

 

Cody Block has been designed by Studio Oscar Lhermitte, a multidisciplinary design studio based in Paris & London. The studio developed the product with these factors in mind: being playful, intuitive while at the same time being a beautiful little wooden toy with a life of its own. All the illustration work was created by the talented illustrator, João Fazenda. We hope you love it as much as we do! As well as thinking hard about the way Cody Block looks and feels, we’ve spent a huge amount of time on the engineering side of it. The mechanics, electronics & software development were engineered by Studio Christophe Machet and Studio Peter Krige, respectively.

 

 QUBS is a Swiss company, but our team is all over Europe!

  •  Founder, CEO - Hayri Bulman - Küsnacht near Zurich, Switzerland
  •  Member of the Board of Directors - Rolv-Erik Spilling - Oslo, Norway
  •  Product Design - Studio Oscar Lhermitte - Paris, France
  •  Electronic & Software Engineering - Studio Peter Krige - London, England
  •  Mechanical Engineering - Christophe Machet - Paris, France
  •  Graphic Design - In The Shade Of A Tree - Paris & London
  •  Illustrations - João Fazenda - Lisbon, Portugal
  •  Campaign Management - Federica Orlati - London, England
     
  •  Cody dimensions: L134 x W86 x H85 mm
  •  Building Block dimensions: L40 x W40 x H160 mm
  •  Box dimensions: L233 x W233 x H233 mm
  •  Overall weight (with packaging): 3.4 kg
  •  Material: Solid beech wood with child-friendly oil & ink, ABS plastic, electronic components
  •  Driving speed: ±1 m /12 sec
  •  Battery: 4 x AA battery (not included)
  •  Power: 6V
  •  RFID: Patented technology with Low Frequency RFID 125KHz and passive RFID tags
  •  Certification: CE and FCC (once in production)
     

We are a new company, Cody Block is our first toy and we have big ambitions with it. We are launching it on Kickstarter because we want to raise the necessary funds to start the production of the first batch of 1 000 units. We have done extensive work development on it and are asking you to join us in this journey from now until production and fulfilment. We are also very eager to build a community of early adopters, get feedback and learn from you so we can develop Cody Block even better. Several of our partners/collaborators have had extensive experience with Kickstarter and they all told us it was clear to them that Cody Block should be launched on Kickstarter.

We have our manufacturer secured and have pricing agreement with them. They have been behind several successful products that were launched on Kickstarter and they have done extensive work on toys in general. The funds raised on Kickstarter will go towards:

  • Manufacturing (tooling, components, assembly, …)
  • Development of Design For Manufacture (working hand in hand with the factory and for production optimization)
  • Certifications
  • Testings
  • Storage & Shipping
     

We are aware of the complexity of manufacturing a product and delivering it to the backers. We are confident we have built the right team with the best expertise. The timeline below shows the milestones from now until completion.

 

Thank you so much for reading this far! ;-) We could not be here and have done such work without the contribution of fantastic people, so special thanks to: Rolv-Erik Spilling, Tim Schindel, Bernd Gottwald, Bruce Lamont, Oscar Lhermitte, Federica Orlati, Peter Krige, Christophe Machet, Joao Fazenda, Sophie Demay, Maël Fournier - Comte, Arthur Lhermitte, Elisa Bertron, the whole team at Sidekick Creatives, Solange & Arnaud, Margaux & Hadrien, Marine & Matt, Amandine & Aïssa, Rokhia and Ytaly.

story:
About us

Hi Everyone, 

Drs Chris and Steph Mathieson (Chiropractors) here. We currently practice in Melbourne, Australia and we are passionate about delivering high quality healthcare to our local community. 

Please watch our short video to hear our story:

The reason we are here is because we purchased one of the Demere 3 Spinal Degeneration Model (SDM) back in 2016 and could only find one available in the UK. We were so impressed with the Demere 3 SDM that we wanted 3 more for the practice in 2018 and after months of searching online we couldn’t find any. We decided to call Brian Sherwood the original inventor and designer who was manufacturing these since 1989 to see why we couldn’t purchase one. Brian advised us they were no longer being made so we asked him if we can attain the legal rights to reproduce his SDM. For 30 years the Demere SDM’s were made by hand and we wanted to bring these SDM’s into modern manufacturing processes. 

The original Demere 3 Spinal Degeneration Model.

Manufacturing process

It has taken 13 months, many hours and significant capital investment to modify the design and find a suitable manufacturing process to reproduce the original Demere 3 SDM. The manufacturing process required to produce the Demere® 4 SDM at an acceptable price is through mass production injection moulding.

Diagram of an Injection Moulding machine.

The trade off for the high quality injection moulding manufacturing is a high volume and high cost to begin manufacturing. Manufacture to retail will cost over $1,000,000 AUD. So, we need your support to pre-order your Demere® 4 SDM so we can raise the 40% deposit required from the manufacturers. Once we pay the 40% deposit the bank will back us for the remaining costs. 

If we do not receive the amount of pre-orders to reach our 40% deposit we will not be able to manufacture these models and in that case would refund all pre-orders that have been made. 

Manufacturing the Demere® 4 SDM is important to us as we feel demonstrating to patients what their condition entails improves patient care, patient outcomes and ensures improved communication between health professionals and their patients. 

By supporting us to manufacture the Demere® 4 SDM you are helping us to achieve our goals in supporting healthcare professionals worldwide now and in the future. 

Demonstrating L4 and L5 degeneration to a patient.

Challenges & solutions

We have been able to negotiate manufacturing costs after some feedback from our customers and have managed to reduce the RRP to $599 (GST included). This still includes the highest quality manufacturing, free shipping worldwide for all pre-orders and our Lifetime Replacement Guarantee*.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that pre-ordering a Demere® 4 SDM may not be for you and we thank you for your support so far. We would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word to your colleagues and share this page to support us to manufacture the Demere® 4 SDM. 

You can also register your interest with us directly at info@smilingspines.com.au if you are not in the position to pre-order a Demere® 4 SDM now.

 

*Lifetime Replacement Guarantee Terms and conditions.

story:
Stretch Goals! 

Thank you everyone who helped fund this program :) I'm so absolutely touched by the outpouring that took place to make this a reality. 

 Since this campaign has started, I've thought about what other things that could take the experience of DigiMyths beyond the class.  I've come up with the two following ideas and turned them into stretch goals for this campaign! Since this campaign still has another month, please keep sharing with others.

  • Commissioning Writers for the Documentation Book ($150: $1,252):  Along with the speaker series, it'd be great to commission two artists who work at an intersection that aligns with DigiMyths to write for the book. 
  • Risograph Printing with TXTBOOKs ($400: $1,652): Originally the book was to be printed via Lulu's cheapest option available. However, with the growing interest and investment from so many into this program—I'd like to create an object that extremely memorable for everyone involved. 

Total W/ Stretch Goals: $1,652

 

 

Overview

About the Program

Third-culture kids, or individuals who were raised in a culture other than that of their parents and family or their ethnic background, often have a deeply complex sense of who they are and where they belong; i.e. in a place that exists in concept only. Deepened by the impact of COVID-19, this place fades as connecting with family in-person and trips to visit their familial lands become sporadic or inaccessible, and holding on to one’s heritage becomes harder.

 

What is Digital Folklore? This program emerged out of a desire to support and explore this place as a means of reconnecting with that heritage through contextualizing customs and stories and expanding understanding without geo-physicality.

 

Over the course of two weeks, participants will research mythologies, sketch out potential ideas melding in computer technologies, and actualize their concepts. The class structure will co-work on Wednesdays, convening on Sundays, and  Discord throughout the week to share resources showcasing how artists have recontextualized their heritage through digital media. After the program concludes, a public speaker series will follow, along with the publication of a book documenting participants’ work made during this time.

Participants should either be enrolled in a degree-granting arts program, have graduated within the last two years, or stopped their studies due to COVID-19 complications. Participants should have a connection or want to reestablish a lost connection with another place outside of where they reside and are looking for ways to engage with the culture and tradition of that land.

 

About the Organizers

Kevin Cadena is a Colombian-American graphic designer, web developer, and educator based in NYC. As an educator, he has been involved in planning alternative education programs for the last six years. He teaches at the Parsons Scholars Program, needs-based college-readiness arts and social justice program for NYC high school students, and is a faculty member in the Design department of the School of Visual Arts. He is currently a fall 2020 resident at Babycastles.

Babycastles is a NYC based collective fostering and amplifying diverse voices in videogame culture. Babycastles provides artists support to actualize ideas and expose that work to new audiences.

 

What We Hope to Achieve With Your Help

Through this campaign, we hope to fund the Digital Folklore program and demonstrate how a teaching environment can flourish without the need for traditional classrooms; one where:

  • Everyone is compensated for their involvement
  • The education is supported by a community
  • Teaching can morph as quickly as student needs change 
  • The subject matter can help students learn more about themselves and what matters to them.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What DigiMyths Needs

As with all campaigns here on IndieGogo, we need funding to make this program a reality. Most of the money the we’re raising will go towards compensating those involved during the program (participants, Babycastles, the instructor) and materials after the program concludes, including an organized public speaker series and publication of a book comprised of participants’ work.

Break Down

  • Participants Compensation ($500 / 10 participants)

    • Participants will deposit $20 to secure their spot in the program and receive the deposit plus an additional $50 dollars upon program completion.

  • Speakers Compensation ($150 / 2 speakers)
    • The instructor Kevin Cadena will invite artists whose work aligns with this program to speak as part of a public speaker series.
  • Babycastles Compensation ($150)
    • This will go towards helping fund the second year of their residency and any operational costs.
  • Instructor Compensation ($100)
    • This piece will go towards compensating the instructor for the work of planning the program. 
  • Documentation Books ($202 / 50 books) 
    • We will print books as mementos for the participants, for documentation, for IndieGogo supporters and the rest to be sold.

Total: $1,102

 Where do the funds go if we don’t reach the entire goal?

Depending on what is made, the priority of the funds distribution will be:

  1. Participants Compensation
  2. Babycastles Compensation
  3. Documentation Books
  4. Speaker Series 
  5. Instructor Compensation

One piece of the program must be fully funded before the next piece of the program receives funds with participant compensation being the most important priority of this campaign.

 

What You Get For Supporting

Perks are an exciting part of being a supporter,and we’ve got a couple of different ones to choose from! 

  • Shout-out on Website & Book ($20 Donation)
    • Helping pay for the spot of a participant and for them to be properly compensated? With your consent, I will include your name under a  "Special Thanks to Our Supporters" on the promotional website and documentation book! 
  • Digital PDF & Pre-Order of Book ($30 Donation)
    • Having gone above and beyond? You will get both a shout out in the documentation book, a digital PDF of the documentation book, and a third-off of the price of the physical book when it finishes.
  • Free Documentation Book ($40 Donation)
    • With this tier, you will receive a shout-out in all materials, the digital PDF of the documentation book, and a free physical copy of the book! 

 

Impact

With the COVID-19 pandemic fully exposing the problems of academic institutions from its quick abandonment of students under financial duress, the inaccessibility for anyone but the most privileged, and the precarious state of part-time faculty, the decision to attend art school and the model of paying to be educated has become hard to justify. 

As the need for alternative learning spaces for students has become crucial, Digimyths is the beginning of longer-term research on how teaching can take place without a need for traditional classrooms, relying on communal support, iterating and morphing as quickly as students’ needs change and equally compensating everyone involved from the instructor to the participants.

I have been involved in planning alternative education programs for the last 6 years. Some of the past events I’ve done include:

  • The Whitney Response Project @ Art Future Youth Alliance 2019: http://scholars.parsons.edu/art-future-youth-alliance-2019/
  • Various Events for Learning Gardens 2016-2019: http://learning-gardens.co/
  • Create & Advocate 2017: https://www.newinc.org/archive/create-and-advoc...
  • Citizen + Virtual 2016: https://steamstories.com/post/140836896092/citi...
  • RISD QUICKIES 2016: https://sites.google.com/a/risd.edu/risdquickies/

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenges for this program involve the funding & promotion of the program.

  • Applicant Pool Size
    • While the first iteration of DigiMyths will only have 10 participants, promoting this program so that there is a good ratio of applications to accepted students is important. This will allow for greater change at a larger range of perspectives in the initial cohort and is related to the next challenge. 
  • Range of Participant Perspectives
    • With this program, we also want to make sure that the opportunity is accessible and safe to all people and that specifically those whose identities intersect with BIPOC, LGBTQIA, and disabilities. 
  • Compensation of Participants
    • As stated in the “What We Need Section”, compensation of the participants is the most important part of this campaign. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate right now, thank you for still being here and know that there are other ways to help! 

You can:  

  • Help DigiMyths have a range of perspectives. 
    • Know any college-age students who would be interested in this? Send them the microsite: http://digimyths.online/ and encourage them to apply. 
  • Help spread the word about this campaign! 
    • Know anyone who would be interested in helping this program happen? Send it their way. Every dollar helps towards compensating our participants and realizing the full vision of this program. 

Thank you for visiting my IndieGogo campaign site! Please reach out if you have any questions :)

 

Learn more at: http://digimyths.online/
story_txt:
Stretch Goals! 
Thank you everyone who helped fund this program :) I'm so absolutely touched by the outpouring that took place to make this a reality. 
 Since this campaign has started, I've thought about what other things that could take the experience of DigiMyths beyond the class.  I've come up with the two following ideas and turned them into stretch goals for this campaign! Since this campaign still has another month, please keep sharing with others.



Commissioning Writers for the Documentation Book ($150: $1,252):  Along with the speaker series, it'd be great to commission two artists who work at an intersection that aligns with DigiMyths to write for the book. 

Risograph Printing with TXTBOOKs ($400: $1,652): Originally the book was to be printed via Lulu's cheapest option available. However, with the growing interest and investment from so many into this program—I'd like to create an object that extremely memorable for everyone involved. 

Total W/ Stretch Goals: $1,652
 
 

Overview
About the Program
Third-culture kids, or individuals who were raised in a culture other than that of their parents and family or their ethnic background, often have a deeply complex sense of who they are and where they belong; i.e. in a place that exists in concept only. Deepened by the impact of COVID-19, this place fades as connecting with family in-person and trips to visit their familial lands become sporadic or inaccessible, and holding on to one’s heritage becomes harder. What is Digital Folklore? story:
Help us Reach our Total Goal of $20,000!

 

 

Camp Shark Smarts Mission

If you come into this world as a creative or an artist right out of the gate you start the game screwed! There’s no clear resource to help you succeed & the first thing you’re told before you even begin is: "You can’t make any money doing THAT. You better figure out something else to do with your life!"

  • Hi I’m Jonathan Pierce and at Camp Shark Smarts we want to offer a new answer.
  • Camp Shark Smarts is an educational program that equips creatives with the training they need to turn their craft into a career.
  • After spending the past few years developing it, we’re now headed to the finish line and reaching out for your support on Indiegogo to help us make Camp Shark Smarts happen.

 

 

How You Can Help & What You Get!

We need to raise 20K to accomplish our final three phases and launch Camp Shark Smarts.

  • PHASE 1 is finishing the build out of the program so that every video, visual and action step is completed and ready for launch. We’re in need of the resources to cover the cost of these remaining media elements so we can start helping creatives connect their craft with customers.
  • PHASE 2 is to produce a series of free youtube videos where we sit down with successful creatives who reveal how they made it through each of the laps we talk about in the program. Part of the funds will go towards the production of these free youtube videos so Camp Shark Smarts will be available to everyone regardless of what their life situation is.
  • PHASE 3 is marketing Camp Shark Smarts once it’s completed. If the right people don’t know Camp Shark Smarts exists, it won’t matter that we’ve made it. So the remainder of the funds will make sure Camp Shark Smarts reaches the people it can help the most.

 

 

  • PERK 1  If you'd like to contribute $100 or more, make sure to select "The Jim Jamkins Comic Book" Perk. We’ll send you a comic book called Jim Jamkins which was actually made using the information from Camp Shark Smarts! In the comic you’ll also learn about a cool business called SomethingGoodToWatch.com which was also created using the tools and training from Camp Shark Smarts.

  • PERK 2  If you'd like to contribute $300 or more, make sure to select the "Camp Shark Smarts Training" Perk. You’ll get full access to Camp Shark Smarts and all of the camp training when it launches in the beginning of 2022! This is a special value we want to offer as a thank you for helping us get funded during our crowdfunding stage.

  • Our hope is that everyone who sees our campaign will donate something to help us reach our goal. Any amount will make a huge difference!

 

 

The Impact

Camp Shark Smarts is a hands on online program where creatives actually start turning their craft into a business from day one. We call this going through the Law of 4 Laps.

  • Because it’s hands on and you're accomplishing something every day, by the end of camp you actually graduate having created a business that connects your craft with customers!
  • This is the kind of empowerment that is desperately needed in the creative community. 
  • This gap is so huge, creatives are literally told to go do "something else" with their lives, simply because no one knows how to help them and no one has any answers!

 

Risks & Challenges

The #1 hurdle we have to overcome is getting the word out to enough people. We know if we simply reach enough people, we will accomplish our goal! The good news is, we have a solution in place and with your help we can definitely reach our Goal!

 

Here are 4 ways you can help make Camp Shark Smarts Happen!

 

  • #1 DONATE The main need is financial backing. Any amount you can donate will make a huge impact.

 

  • #2 BECOME A SUPER SUPPORTER The second way you can help is sharing our campaign posts on Facebook. We've put a ton of work into creating unique promotional videos for each day of the campaign. The truth is, besides donations, there's nothing that would help the campaign more than helping us share these videos on Facebook. Each day's video is unique and was created to "be the interesting thing" you go on to Facebook hoping to find. The best part is, it takes less than 10 seconds each day! (Not an exaggeration.) Just join our "Super Supporters" email list and we'll email you the video to share on Facebook for each day of the campaign. All you have to do is click the link in the email! Wow! So easy! It's one of those rare scenarios in life where the easiest way to help is also the one that can make the most difference! To become a Super Supporter just click the link below.

CLICK HERE

 

  • #3 HELP US GET MEDIA EXPOSURE The third way you can help is by helping me connect with any TV show, news program, radio show, youtube channel, or blog that would like to interview me about Camp Shark Smarts. I will be 100% available for the next 30 days to do any publicity I can.  Here's how to get in touch: Jonathan Pierce | 918-277-1750 | jonathan@sharksmarts.com

 

  • #4 FOLLOW ON INSTAGRAM The fourth way you can help is by following on instagram @CampSharkSmarts. We'll be promoting the campaign there as well and it’s also where you can see Camp Shark Smarts updates in the future. Just click the link below to follow @CampSharkSmarts on instagram.

CLICK HERE

 

  • Thanks for taking the time to learn about our funding campaign and for the next 30 days we hope you’ll partner with us to make Camp Shark Smarts happen!

 

Help us Reach our Total Goal of $20,000!

(Not an exaggeration.) Just join our "Super Supporters" email list and we'll email you the video to share on Facebook for each day of the campaign. All you have to do is click the link in the email! Wow! So easy! It's one of those rare scenarios in life where the easiest way to help is also the one that can make the most difference! To become a Super Supporter just click the link below.

CLICK HERE
 
#3 HELP US GET MEDIA EXPOSURE The third way you can help is by helping me connect with any TV show, news program, radio show, youtube channel, or blog that would like to interview me about Camp Shark Smarts. I will be 100% available for the next 30 days to do any publicity I can.  Here's how to get in touch: Jonathan Pierce | 918-277-1750 | jonathan@sharksmarts.com

 
#4 FOLLOW ON INSTAGRAM The fourth way you can help is by following on instagram @CampSharkSmarts. We'll be promoting the campaign there as well and it’s also where you can see Camp Shark Smarts updates in the future. Just click the link below to follow @CampSharkSmarts on instagram.

CLICK HERE
