Help us Reach our Total Goal of $20,000!

story:
Hobbyist - Fathers build it with Sons & Daughters-School Groups-Prove the Science

Poo on VIDEO GAMES-Build science project in your Class Room or Hobby or Family Group-Tested-Proven-no kinks - now-Custom model work &Test runs=Fun-Break USA Speed Records-Make Historic Videos-tech papers-instructions.

Please see the updates for voting link - PLEASE VOTE - Top Tab above- No Cost - Very Easy - only takes a minute. Contest web site extremely safe & absolutely no negative feed back. 

Racing NASCAR Teams & Professionals - Want to be Fast & Furious - Huge Significant Feat - Possibly Easy Now:

Stay home & try a Hobby. Teams can set USA Speed  Records. Want to do a  Huge Significant Feat - Not trivial- Be a  part of History. Choose your models - Many Options. Learn & Experiment. Make & Publish new videos. Better than any other sport or Star Wars since very real. It has been tested & proven thoroughly. Not endless video games. Check out the jumping bulldozer on Face Book for an example. 

Hobbyist - Fathers

Fathers, if you want a relationship with your Son, Daughter, family or friends, the time spent building and learning together will be very good and will last a life time. The learning curve has been reduced substantially- Have kits and instructions.

Instructions include Part Lists. Quick shipment, since common parts. Discount kits-flywheels & motors-Drive Motor-converters-casters. Enhancing your model easy-World Game Changer for complete Mobility-Power Gyro Spinners-Develop new skills-Reduce Fuel Waste & High Way Road over Usage.

Attention: Fathers, Hobbyist, Engineers, Scientist, Technically Astute & Colleges and Others: Please get involved in this project, your country & mankind needs you.  Included mid way below also is a Peer Review Study Journal for your review and comments. Please study, ponder, and /or get involved by building models also. 

It is very exciting to make these models. Each model run makes history, since the size and other data are all unique, especially the slope and distance for up hill runs. These runs will prove the science even more thoroughly for each science / family group, since new configurations are relatively easy to do. Fathers can work with their sons and daughters to build these models together.

Current models include 3 hobby crafts and a larger machine shop model. Current model runs are posted on YouTube. All have produced good forward motion. Craft weight range from 60 lb to 230 lb.

Below first is the best hobby runs. This is uphill immediately and then mostly a slight uphill straight run diagonal  & across the garage, utilizing 16 gyro's.This includes the new 6" dia. factory robo wheel with good & smoother gyro's. An estimate unit weight is over 74 lbs.

Next is a 3D CAD Solid Works model. Simulating a Model drive advancing up an Incline, Using 10 Pairs of Matched Gyro/Flywheels, counter driven to produce sustained forward and upward thrust.

 

Next is a composite video that was presented to the United States Patent and Trade Office on 9-16-2019 for Chapters 1-12. See the link below for the composite model runs. The first 2 chapter are base line runs, without energized gyro flywheels showing no motion. Chapters 3 & 5 are hobby craft model runs uphill in a garage. The chapter 4 run is a mishap with a hobby cart unit with narrow wheelbase, showing that a wider wheelbase is required for framing stability. It also shows the external forces at play. The next 2 runs, chapter 6 & 7, show a machine shop “strong model” on a level surface. The next 5 runs (Chapter 8-12) show this model going up ramps at 1.7% and 0.8% grade. Chapters 8 & 9 climb the 1.7% ramp. Chapter 10-12 utilized the 0.8% ramp. These videos were required to overcome the patent examiner’s comments.

 

 

Want World Records in your Names - Opportunities for You or Group to Break the World Speed & Distance Records & Terrain Records (Land / Water / Ice) - Even Walt Disney would be impressed - New Gyro Motion Machine

If you love mankind, support this game changer. This deserves everyone's full attention. Don't be apathetic for new mobility for mountains, sky, snow and ice travel. Want Great Mobility, then support this, stop long delays. Want progress? Hovering even for the handicapped with speed, power and safety. Want absolute Maneuverability? No propellers, no jets, no cables. Total access to cliffs or mountain peaks. Stop overturning for tall vehicles on sharp turns. Fuel efficient and Powerful. Yes this is blunt, but needed, since nothing else is working. If you want the extremely good mobility benefits for mankind, then support this in some manner. Sharing and posting would help. For the greater good go beyond small mindedness. Pinch yourself, wake up, shame on you. Do your research on us and the project first, then support us, so you can be proud of what you have supported. Remember the - "Pay it forward" movement. Do something good for this noble and beneficial project. Remember Karma, it will come back to you. Introduction:

The gyroscopic motion machine or gyro reaction drive, is a recent innovative discovery in versatile mechanical propulsion, independent of aerodynamic lift. Application submitted long prior to 2020, it has a patent pending status at the United States Patent and Trade Office, by Walter E. Wood, residing in Sylvester Georgia, USA. Applications of this multiple purpose innovation, if fully developed, could become vast and wide ranging. This new form of drive may be superior to many other historical innovations as a Prime Mover. It may even be on the order of the Wright Brothers discovery for powered flight, by means of lift. The new US Space Force would do well to explore and develop this technology. Many earlier attempts to demonstrate these new gyro motion principles were unsuccessful, due to incomplete understanding, in order to achieve the desired directional force.

The unit expands the current science to include a continual reaction force due to the new design configuration of the mechanism. This new reaction force can be readily harnessed and become remarkably useful. It can produce forward motion for crafts or vehicles. It produces a force that is useful for other proposes as well. It has many utilities, and is very versatile, since only a stable frame is required. Ground unit applications will have one main gear-motor driver reaction force, applied through the framing onto a ground surface. For aerial crafts a tail rotor, very similar to helicopters, would resist a turning moment. This effectively establishes a stable frame, as well. By maintaining stability of the unit’s framing, aerial flight capacity can be achieved in principle. Two types of models have extensively proven typical ground travel with good forward motion with force. This was proven by uphill and up ramp testing for several models, with various configurations, including small and large size models. The models produce a forward motion that is consistent during extensive testing. Many parameter variations are available for adjustments. All testing was conducted and certified by professional engineers. Several engineers have completed affidavits for direct physical witness of different unit test runs. Some were made by video observations presented by the inventor. Other expert witnesses provided written affidavits as well, such as a machine shop owner.

The USA patent office (USPTO) has been slow to recognize the actual application of the existing rotational science, therefore a continuing submittal process is ongoing, but will inevitably be accomplished with full patent approval. Spectacular runs are forthcoming. Testing has been video recorded over several years. Exact time frames are confidential due to patent laws for qualified older applications. The Provisional Patent Application was submitted 5/2/2012, and a full Utility 5/2/2013. The Utility Patent number is 13,886,257.

Background and History of Prior Developments

Much of what is known about rotating dynamics of moving bodies, comes from a 17th century scientist, Leonhard Euler, soon after the related law of motion by Sir Isaac Newton.

Today’s technology includes many related applications for gyroscopes (flywheels). Larger gyroscopic stabilizer units are used in Navy Vessels, to minimize the effects of ocean waves. Their reaction forces minimize the normal rotation of the ship. A much better vertical position is maintained preventing the ship from being tilted over.

Many people are familiar with present day camera platform gyro stabilizers, These are smaller but react in the same manner for position stability.

This new gyro motion machine is unique and is well beyond current technologies. It has never been utilized for propulsion or forward motion in any manner. It should be emphasized that this is only one step above existing present day gyro stabilizer capacity and function. But it has been previously ignored or misunderstood. Certainly it has not been developed. The simple expansion for this new development has escaped discovery, hiding in plain sight. In short, it is a simple step forward from existing established and proven gyro technologies. But this gyro craft provides continual and sustained forces, rather than temporary reactions. Power is likewise supplied continually and is sustained.

Many on-line videos are available that show precession. Several You Tube videos show a rotating bicycle wheel for a typical demonstration. One could ignore this and say it is not a large powerful reaction. But the fact is that they do show a steady rotation or precession after an initial disturbance. Therefore, this shows a reaction torque clearly. And it also has an associated reaction force being shown. Therefore, it can be utilized as a force. But it is a temporary reaction, which results in a steady rotational motion with an angular velocity. The reaction is clearly visible. Therefore, these demonstrations show the reaction as a practical and useful principle. Making the reaction continual and sustained is possible, if properly configured within a new gyro motion machine. This will be discussed below in detail.

Explanation & Analysis

There are well known existing commercial gyroscopic applications. Many of which are currently utilized for stability and for guidance. Basically, a flywheel in rotation becomes gyroscopic in nature with a number of fundamental characteristics. One of the main characteristics is the “rigidity in space” nature, which is simply a resistance to any motion. It is better known as rotational inertia and is indeed a re-labeling of the same characteristic. When there is force applied to the axis of the flywheel there is a reaction force created. A temporary one is well known, and has several existing commercial applications for stability. Some examples of this include race cars, large ships, and camera platforms. A reset to the starting position is required for these existing stabilizer gyro units. This new gyro machine keeps the reaction force going by continually moving the gyroscopic rotating flywheel. It seems simple and could easily have been done much earlier in history. However, this is now a very current application for development. It is currently under much experimentation by the inventor. It includes many noted improvements for construction, but the principals are the same. There are some design parameters being adjusted for some better optimization, but the main principles remain.

The reaction forces are continual due the design. See the sketch below for the conceptual design for the ground craft. The first machine being explained is the cart unit. Once the principal is understood for this unit the other units will be similar and more forthcoming.

To correct existing misleading notions and preconceived ideas for this simple machine, an expounded explanation for external reaction forces is appropriate. Included is a simple force to moment conversion diagram, illustrated below to save much discussion. It should be self-explanatory. The diagram is presented to show that the large reactionary moment of the gear-motor is actually converted to vertical forces. Then these forces are applied to the concrete floor surface through the cartwheels. It could even be said that the moment is being transformed and then transmitted. The cart ground unit resists overturning by reactions of the floor surface upon the unit’s wheels. The unit’s weight and the wheelbase work together. The induced external forces resist for two types of reactions in a simple manner. The cart remains stable for both its natural weight and for the induced moment of the unit’s drive gear-motor. Both types of external forces should be classified as ground reaction forces. This is expounded in a PE Certified Analysis for both the ground units and the aerial units. The major point is that both the frames of the ground units and aerial units are stable and allow the gyro machine to function.

Force to Moment Conversion Diagram

For a simple ground craft argument, an essential requirement is the framing stability. It is often overlooked. This requires both a substantial wheelbase and gravity of the unit working together to resist a substantial overturning moment. This allows the other systems in play to react with a forward force. The other systems include the gyroscopic reaction forces for forward motion.

There is no push against a surface, but rather there is a significant and substantial moment conversion to a downward vertical force. This is not a linear push against type action. Linear reaction type analysis and equal opposite linear thinking is not appropriate in rotational dynamics. Linear dynamics and analysis is simpler and more commonly understood.

See the sketch below for part 2 of the external force analysis. It clearly shows the Gear-Motor moment  and associated reactions, which allows for the cart stability, and thus allows the gyro mechanism to function successfully. Clearly the wheel base is a factor to prevent overturning.

Physics and Math Details for a Predictive Theory

These are the precepts, and one existing equation that will be developed, as more is understood of the resulting magnitude of the reaction force.

“Standard Handbook for Mechanical Engineers” by Marks, 7th edition by Theodore Baumeister, McGraw Hill 1967, is copied in sections and inserted below to explain the older existing gyro stability technology. This equation will be useful as a starting point for later studies and developments. Gyroscopic forces are briefly illustrated in Fig. 73 on page 3-32 of the Handbook, which is copied here for reference.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Marks_Gyro_R... 

Mark's Mechanical Engineering Handbook - Gyro Reaction Forces

Taken from Mark’s - "Let k = the radius of gyration of the wheel about it's axis. (If all the weight is at the rim, k2 =R2 ;", or more simply k=R, where R is the radius of the rim weight.

The reference diagram to the left is being utilized by the design of the flywheels with the concentrated weight on the outer part of the wheels. Only a few physical restrictions would limit the design, and the outer weight principle is being maximized, and captured by the design. This is commonly referred as “rim loading”.

Taken from Mark’s - "Now suppose that the axle end A is constrained to move between two smooth fixed guides, forming a slot;” ……. “then the mere motion of A along the slot will call into play a strong lateral pressure P (called a gyroscopic reaction) against one of the guides.”

This lateral pressure “P” is indeed the resultant force being utilized for this new machine. All of the other aspects of the new machine can be optimized to maximize “P” above, that is continuous due to the unique design.

Taken from Mark’s - “The magnitude of the gyroscopic force “P” at any instant is proportional to the spinning velocity, and also to the velocity of A along the slots, having given by

Pb=(w/g)(k2)(π N/30)(v/b)”

Providing more explanation, changing it slightly for clarity to read,

(P x b) = Moment = Force x Moment Arm = (w/g)(k2) ((π =3.14159)(N/30)(v/b)

Taken from Mark’s - “where Pb = moment of P about the center, v = the linear velocity of the point A along the slot at the instant in question, N = rpm in the spinning velocity of the wheel, and g = 32.17 ft per sec.”  Note that “P” is the “gyroscopic reaction” force with a “strong lateral pressure "P ”. The letter “w” is the weight of the disk flywheel in lbs.

Also taken from Mark’s – “It should be noted that the gyroscopic reaction P against the fixed guide does not depend on the magnitude of the accelerating force Q, except in so far as Q is necessary to create the velocity  v,”

It is well established that for gyroscopic devices including spinning flywheels, that when imposing a force “Q” at the end of its axle, a useable reaction always tends to move at right angles (normal) to the imposed force “Q”, as shown in this case. Accordingly, it will react with a force “P” when restrained at the same end in the respective direction.

The illustration above illustrates an axle end “A”  that is constrained to move between the fixed guides, forming a slot. If force  “Q”  is applied to pull the point  “A”  along the slot, while the wheel is turning, the motion of  “A”  will cause a strong lateral pressure “P” as shown in the diagram. “P” is the gyroscopic reaction because of a change in the angular momentum caused by the force “Q”. The direction of the force “P” depends upon the direction of the spin and “Q”. The respective angular momentum vector is not shown in this simple diagram. The force directions for “Q” and “P” are clearly shown and are adequate for understanding of the action and reaction principles. Understanding that gyroscopic reactions are not equal and opposite as per Newton for a 0 & 180 configuration, but utilize the right hand rule per Euler and others to determine their direction, the application of this principle to the invention can be seen in the below diagram.

It does require some imagination to get from the above diagram to the below diagram, but the principle is the same. The gyro flywheel motor’s rigid mounting is where the unique generated lateral force is applied by the gyroscopic reaction. Likewise, the Q force is applied there also. The "b" distance above is difficult to transfer exactly to the new unit's configuration. (The innovation's configuration is the gyro motor mounting arrangements with the respective attached flywheel.) It is clear that "b" is a constant factor that will be determined empirically.

The new innovation’s configuration does not match the above Mark's diagram exactly; therefore more development of the above equation for this new gyro motion machine is required. The principle of the gyro reaction force does remain as a valid engineering forward resultant force, proven by the model runs to date. The above Mark's equation, however, can be a very good starting point. Therefore, the full equation development is a work in progress.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2_Gyro_with_... 

Core Wheel with 2 gyro flywheels - Reaction Force Diagram

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Diagram_alte...

Alternate with  Double Ended Motor 

The conservation of angular momentum is applicable to this unit. The rotation of the gyro flywheels are the energized components that allow energy to be released. Since this energy is available to be utilized, the conservation of angular momentum principle is not violated in any manner. The rotation of the flywheels is motorized, however, and therefore the RPM speed is maintained due to friction or other imperfections. As tests have shown when the unit core “assembly wheel” driver is energized during start up, the rotation of the all the gyro flywheels is disturbed and is affected. The energy is being transformed into forward motion, and the gyro flywheel motors are loaded. This is indicated by a change in speed of the energized flywheels. A slowdown is noticeable. Therefore the angular momentum is conserved, until the unit is started. Then some balancing occurs with a new reduced rpm speed of the gyro motors and respective flywheels. Then after stabilizing the gyro motors maintain their respective flywheel rpm speed. Thus the force forward is maintained for all the cart units presented, a certain forward speed is achieved. Thus all the submitted video’s are verified by Walter E. Wood, free from any doctoring, with all factors presented and fully disclosed in these documents. In fact, all the testing is verifiable and repeatable with the proper construction and assembly.

The Table shown below is taken and manually typed from the College Textbook Physics 101 Course “Physics Part I” by Robert Resnick and David Halliday, published by John Wiley & Sons, Inc. 1966. This publication shows a comparison of scaler equations only and does not include the vector representation or directions. But there are great differences in the equations, and even more with the complete analysis including vector directional representation of all the functions or components, and are indeed two separate science categories. Therefore linear momentum equations and logic are too limited for the internal component analysis of this unit.

The linear equal opposite aspects for normal straight-line rectilinear motion or the normal linear scientific equations should not be applied to this unit for understanding the concept. All the physics publications use the equations of linear motion for comparison only and not for the actual application of rotational kinematics. See the Table below taken from a Physics 101 Course Textbook. Only when the unit has achieved a steady traveling speed, can these linear principles be applied to the unit as a whole. This is indeed a gyroscopic functioning new machine with good utility. For the cart unit to be stabilized, there is a moment balance needed but not in a linear fashion. The needed resisting moment is achieved through the cartwheels by the pavement. The external vertical forces of the pavement acting upon the cartwheels with a moment arm create the resisting moment. Thus the linear equal opposite action reaction principle does not apply for this gyroscopic motion machine. As shown above all forces react normal to, and the applied moment by the drive motor is achieved, balanced, and stabilized by external pavement vertical forces. Since these external force are entirely vertical it has no effect upon the horizontal motion of the cart.

As described in the specification of the pending  patent -“Gyroscopic Motion Machine“ A first gyro motor and flywheel turns counter-clockwise, and a second motor and flywheel turns clockwise, when viewed from the same vantage point, allowing the assembly wheel to create a reaction force, as it is rotated by a drive gear-motor.” The diagram above illustrates the reaction force or pressure created as a result of the change of angular velocity of the gyro flywheels and the applied force “Q” accomplished by the core “assembly wheel” rotation. Force “Q” is applied by the rotation of the assembly wheel, as the assembly wheel continuously applies force “Q” to the axle end of each flywheel, creating a continuous reaction force “P”. The normal force “Q” causes torque and a change in the angular momentum in the direction of that torque, which results in pressure or distributed force “P”, perpendicular to “Q”. Based on the principles governing the direction of that torque, the force of “P” will be same direction with reference to the flywheel axles when the flywheels are turning in opposite directions. (Looking in from the end of each flywheel.) Thus, there is a new force “P” that is generated by the conversion of force “Q” by the gyroscopic reaction, as shown in the above diagram. This conversion creates movement caused by force “P” via the gyroscopic motion machine described by the utility patent claims. Thus, the invention does not violate the principle of conservation of momentum, but rather obeys that principle as the force “P” induces an immediate reaction in a new direction, according to the right-hand rule in rotating bodies. Thus, the invention is demonstrated and proven to be operable according to known dynamics formulas and publications.

Future Potential Impact and Benefits of Technology

Consider the existing propeller driven crafts, specifically air propeller systems. For example, an examination is required of typical airboat for its existing testing methods. The data reported by manufacturers' representatives of current and available commercial units shows an inefficient production of their output force. The testing method consists of a typical cattle weight scale positioned in line of a tie cable or chain, where the cable connects back to a tree on the shore with the boat floating in the water. The total power hp indication is not impressive. There is essentially no friction of the boat in the water. Therefore, it can be assumed that similar inefficient results take place for all propeller driven crafts. This implies that large hp engines are required that produce minimum force output. Force data is not yet available for the gyro crafts, but it is expected to be much better performance results than for air boats. All USA swamp fishermen know the inefficiencies of air boats, compared to normal water propeller boats or even special "mud motor" propeller driven boats.

The range of utility is vast for the new gyro motion machine. In general, this should replace all propeller driven crafts due to efficiency, not to mention safety. Other new applications are too numerous to list completely. But the major list includes horizontal crafts on any surface including ice. Also included are aerial crafts, marine crafts, braking for any craft on any surface, overturning protection for tall vehicles, lifts for inconvenient locations or conditions.

With minimum rocket boosters to prevent a space ship rotation, it could be used for propulsion for space ships. The initial burst or burn is all that is needed since there is no friction in space and the ship’s forward velocity would be maintained with no depleting. 

Remember the movie Back to the Future  – “Roads! Where we’re going, we won’t need roads!” We would ask you to consider the possibility of having hovering vehicles, hovering chairs, increased land speeds for tall vehicles, increased lift for all craft, compact and safe crafts for maneuvering on the side of cliff walls, safe tree work and inspections without booms. Please consider real braking capacity for ice travel. Not to mention a hovering craft for safe fire fighting work. There are extensive applications for this new innovation.

Overcoming the Status Quo Bias

These are some explanations to correct existing misleading notions and preconceived ideas for this simple machine.

First, the main principles for this gyroscopic motion machine require the use and understanding of rotational dynamics which was established by Leonhard Euler. Euler was Swiss and lived from 1707 to 1783. Euler’s work is well accepted as a classic era physicist for rotation. The specific reference for angular momentum is Euler's Laws of Motion. His work was 50 years later than Newton. Therefore in principle, this type rotational system is on an equal level with Newtonian physics. Rotational Physics is a separate science with different equations for motion. Newton encompasses Linear Laws of Motion and Euler encompasses Rotational Laws of Motion with the relevant equations. (Euler's Second Law is the accepted classical science for rotational physics.)

In addition, the most common mistake is Linear thinking for equal opposite reaction forces, since it is simple and more customary in normal mechanical systems. It is customary for tire traction systems for common vehicles. It consists of a common push against type action and reaction system.

Second is the free space evaluation. This is not applicable since the gyro motion machine works in a normal environment, with both gravity and normal atmospheric conditions. That is with gravity to assist in stability for ground units. And for aerial crafts, gravity is overcome but is still utilized for stability, but requires additional detailed force and moment analysis.

Last is the Reactionless drive nomenclature. This unit does not use propellants. The external forces and gyroscopic reaction forces are well explained in Professional Engineering certified analysis. First, the analysis for the ground craft unit is considered to assist understanding. The gyro cart has a force to moment conversion with vertical upward external force. Both this external reaction force and gravity of the craft work together for stability of the unit. The crafts wheelbase is also a factor for stability. This design does not have a horizontal push against a floor surface but rather an equivalent moment reaction by upward external reaction forces of the floor surface. Friction is not applicable, or any other misapplied factors for dismissing these model video runs. Only the pure gyro reaction forces are being utilized, which are well proven and repeatable. With a power supply, they are continual. Base line runs are included showing a well balanced core rotation with no energized flywheels. Therefore, the experimental methods have been professional.

Unsuccessful Developments by Others

To explain the lack of success by others previously, consider the following. No one has presented this exact design. For the current scientific communal posted analysis, the main problem, perhaps, is that no available units existed or were available for study. Maintaining secrecy due to prior patent laws may have hindered the sharing and posting of some inventors. Therefore, it is very easy to discredit an unknown and unproven science where no successful models exist.

Initially without any prior examples, there was some difficulty to construct good working models. There were no available resources for reference. For the best relevant history, Google search for two well renowned men who were pioneers in their day, the late Eric Laithwaite, formerly citizen of UK, and the late Francis J. McCabe, formerly of Mt. Airy, PA. These two men spent their later years attempting to bring a gyro craft to market, but were not successful. They both understood the power and associated benefits of gyroscopic reaction forces, and hoped to see it harnessed in some manner. McCabe published his gyro motion machine demonstration and test after the provisional patent was filed by Walter E. Wood, see below the link listed his web site. McCabe labeled it the Vehicle Gyro Oscillation Drive Model. His demonstration model was partially air and partial electric powered, but the principle are the same. McCabe utilized a single air powered flywheel in lieu of a pair of flywheels.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kyzd3BaDm0&amp... 

Again, no one has presented this exact design. Therefore, others with limited funds, and perhaps limited time were not able to make any commercial success by providing reasonable hobby toy models. The parts and materials are much simpler and this commercial barrier has been broken now. The parts have been standardized and economized. They include wheels, hubs and other manufactured components to perfect the unit, especially the gyro flywheels. Continuous improvements of construction techniques is ongoing and required for economics and performance. To prove the function and capacity, spectacular models with several configurations will be forthcoming and scheduled. The boundaries set by others has been breached. Others did not build successful running models for commercial consumption. These new designs, allow hobbyist to build good working models. In short, other innovators stopped or were stopped by circumstances. Therefore, the scientific community, as yet, has not fully considered the value of these gyro motion machines. All that is required is the power supply, a productive arrangement of gyros, a counter rotation to release the reaction, and a stable frame. This is also the first steps required to understand the science of this unit.

Prior Publications & The Need for Additional Development

The gyro motion machine has been demonstrated in several on-line videos of models and at least one on-line study. The late scientist Fran McCabe, completed the one on-line study. However, it includes discussions about many associated experiments.

Francis J. McCabe's presented all of his experiments for gyro motion, including the failed experiments. This is very confusing. It is known now, that the real concern is the appropriate testing results of a practical design for his cart models and especially its proof video runs. Never the less, McCabe's report, with the associated experiments, is extremely useful for those who are familiar with the true gyroscopic principles.

Perhaps, McCabe was trying to express in his gyro motion study, that gyroscopic behavior occurs in nature more than generally realized. But it does not serve the study of this for simplifying and promoting a clear understanding. It extremely cluttered the material and became confusing. Therefore, it is not beneficial to add and support these far removed connections or relationships in nature. These things may be expounded at some later date.

At this time, the math developments leave room for revisions with several factors to apply for the existing equations. The computations for the resulting outputs will require (as a minimum) substantial empirical development for the relevant formulas.

Prior Omissions or Expert Misconception's in Dynamic Theories & Developments

Several science reports from other sources have been previously accepted by a few in the science community that doubt gyro motion can be possible. The existing publications show a lack of willingness to build, experiment or to conduct open minded research. Below are specific arguments that have been raised. Each one is briefly discussed and put in their proper perspective.

Contra Argument No. 1 - Propeller propulsion is proven and gyro propulsion is not.

Rebuttal: Both of these have reaction force outputs. This is clearly visible with the new videoed and certified cart model runs of the gyro motion machine.

Contra Argument No. 2. Existing gyro stabilizers for ships are not relevant.

Rebuttal: These existing powerful systems produce large reaction forces for stabilizing large Naval Ships. To deny that they are relevant present day systems is ignoring the facts. The next innovative step was to engineer a system for producing continuous gyro reaction forces. Ignoring the creative engineering expansion of these same principles for the gyro motion machine is another unwarranted denial.

Contra Argument No. 3 - Forward motion requires a push against another surface and not gyro induced moment reaction.

Rebuttal: To say that forces and moments cannot be positioned and arranged in such a manner to allow forward motion with a stable frame and with cart wheels rolling on pavement is mistaken. This design utilizes the gyro reaction forces, which in turn creates a very beneficial prime mover. Documentation for the gyro cart model testing includes affidavits and certifications include several expert witnesses and several professional engineering reports.

Contra Argument No. 4 - Presentation of the Linear Newtonian Laws as opposition to gyro motion for a conclusion.

Rebuttal: Euler’s rotational dynamic classical sciences, with it’s classical methods of computations for power, work, moment, rotational speed, etc. are the applicable laws of motion for this, not Newton.

Contra Argument No. 5 – A body will remains at rest, until acted upon by an external force.

Rebuttal: The action of a normal auto type vehicle has a push type force against a paved surface. (The engine drives the tramission, drive shaft, rear end, and axle and therefore, the power train supply power to the rear wheels.) The reaction force from the pavement pushes against the vehicle. These action and reaction forces have normal linear vectors with equal opposite action and reaction force vectors. This machine however has another action against the paved surface, a moment type reaction of forces with their associated moment arm. This moment arm is the distance to the pivot point. The external forces of the pavement push against the wheels of the cart model. It is, however, in a moment to force type manner. This has been extensively developed in the above engineering analysis. Note that both types of actions, whether linear or rotational, induce a reaction from the pavement. Both are external forces. In short, the pavement exerts external forces to maintain a stable frame for the gyro motion machine. External forces are directly involved in the process of this gyro machine. External forces (gravitation) do indeed act upon the cart model, but in an appropriate and scientific manner for this machine to operate and to have purpose, function and utility. The cart model moves forward with force and has been abundantly, thoroughly and extensively proven. These external reaction forces of the pavement upon the cartwheels can't be dismissed or ignored. The required stability for the cart framing has been extensively shown in the engineering analysis, and has been even demonstrated physically.

A consensus against gyro propulsion should not be considered dis-positive in any manner, due to both the engineering analysis and the many cart model demonstrations for various sizes and configurations, which prove the principles. Demonstratively, the specific principles are solid and proven. In support, other independent sources have now become available for the gyro motion machine principles, specifically for the cart model.

This will be discussed below in detail.Explanation & AnalysisThere are well known existing commercial gyroscopic applications. Many of which are currently utilized for stability and for guidance. Basically, a flywheel in rotation becomes gyroscopic in nature with a number of fundamental characteristics. One of the main characteristics is the “rigidity in space” nature, which is simply a resistance to any motion. It is better known as rotational inertia and is indeed a re-labeling of the same characteristic. When there is force applied to the axis of the flywheel there is a reaction force created. A temporary one is well known, and has several existing commercial applications for stability. Some examples of this include race cars, large ships, and camera platforms. A reset to the starting position is required for these existing stabilizer gyro units. This new gyro machine keeps the reaction force going by continually moving the gyroscopic rotating flywheel. The normal force “Q” causes torque and a change in the angular momentum in the direction of that torque, which results in pressure or distributed force “P”, perpendicular to “Q”. See the additional perks for each of the wood hobby kits. Select and click the link that you prefer. You will not need the assembly instructions since it is included in the wood kits. Different size packages or plans are available. The kits only include the wood parts needed. The list of other hardware parts is included in the instructions. It includes the gear-motors, gyro motors and converters model numbers, etc. Please go to the GALLERY next to see the actual appearance of the wood part kits shown on the first video of the inventor Walter Wood. (For the 10 pair model.) The parts may change slightly, but the overall design and function are the same. A properly sized gear motor has been added for the small units, as well as a 120 vac to 14 vdc converter for a very good and convenient power supply.We have done the math for propeller type aircraft, and we believe that with a perfected product we will be able to replace all propeller drivers in a timely manner. The inefficiency for all existing propulsion crafts including both propellers and jets is very wasteful. Both are extremely dangerous and this would totally be eliminated. We expect to switch the manufactures and industries to gyro drivers. This would only occur if the performance efficiency is better than the current propulsion systems. If the efficiency is as expected, we would certainly begin our first replacement for air boats, then helicopters, then aircraft. This does not even mention the hobby industry, which includes drones. These will be converted as well. Think of the propeller crashes and accidents. Even with toy models, one recent death has occurred at a sports club.I, William Cor, am a Mechanical Engineering graduate of The University of Wyoming, and the inventor, Walter Wood, is a Mechanical Engineering graduate of The Georgia Institute of Technology. We are both licensed professionally in numerous states. Both schools are highly reputable. Walter Wood graduated with honors in Mechan

story:
Our dependence on web technology demands that the generation that comes after us have a solid understanding of coding. At Coding N Hosting, we have provided the resources to groom the next generation of programmers.

There are exciting teen books on history, culture, shorthands, and even anatomy. Ever wondered why there aren't practical oriented and real-time experience like coding books for 14+ teens? But let’s cut to the chase!

We have decided to close this gap with our THE 24-HOUR CODING  BOOTCAMP that teach 14+ teens how to develop their first functional website "within the purview of their understanding" in an exciting way.

 

We strongly believe in catching them young and that is why we have taken this approach to groom the next generation of full-stack developers from middle-grade school.

Note: The material is specially prepared for 14+ teens and above. No Jokes!

 

No, No, No! THE 24-HOUR CODING BOOTCAMP is not filled with your comic characters or superhero tales. It is way out of your normal league. It is a creative book that combines coding with a practical approach for teenagers and beginners alike. Unarguably the only book that will teach coding with a dedicated and hosting plan for practice.

Simply Put! It’s a book that will keep on giving. 

We want to see one of our little coders become the brain behind the next big App and this book that will potentially get them interested in coding.

We understand that some teens often require guidance to excel. We have taken the challenge a step further to ensure parents and teachers are also carried along in this awesome coding manual. We have prepared a version that will come in handy for parents and teachers.

Have no fear even if you are a leaner, the book has been prepared to make it easy for parents and teachers to grasp it content with little or no knowledge of coding.

We decided to go all round and ensure the book comes in handy at all times and on all electronic devices.

 

You can literally carry THE 24-HOUR CODING BOOTCAMP anywhere you go.

There are a few reasons why it is not advisable even for adults to head straight to code writing and web development. The foundation is the key to professionalism!

First our approach takes a practical & real-time concept explain in details that can be understood by  middle school grades and above.

At Coding N Hosting, we have built a website that will provide free a 3-month hosting for all newbies with simple and easy steps. Through this approach, the student  could acquire some real-time knowledge and see first hand how and what they have built work.

 

Second, our concept is built to show the student the entire working process and development tools, self dedicated to those who have enrolled. It’s an exciting process and learners will find it to be one of the best code-teaching concepts ever developed. 

 

Each tutorial in the book can be executed with little or no guidance from an adult or tutor.

Each program in the book contains a start to finish easy steps. Before you start coding all through to the finish.

 

We also have a complete pictorial representation of each process including where and how to save the code. 

The book is written in five parts.

Part I. Contains Chapters 1-4 Covers introduction and front-end development:

The basic curiosity behind the web, necessary development tools, coding languages, web servers, connecting to the web, HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language) and CSS (Cascade Style Sheet). All in their simplest forms.

Part 2. Contains Chapters 5-8 which covers web page layout & design:

Font & text, CSS box model, RWD (Responsive Web Design) & Positioning, Media Query with plenty of practical easy to follow examples.

Part 3. Media Query Chapters 9-10:

Covers the magic of a responsive website. This part explains JavaScript & PHP  (Personal Home Page/Hyper Text Preprocessor) with lots of easy examples and approach.

Part 4. Covers chapter 11-12:

Getting things done with practical information: SEO (Search Engine Optimization), DevTools. Web Development, Front-end & Back-end, Database, Big Data and Web Design trends in Year 2020s.

Part 5. Contains the index and appendix:

We have created this exciting 12 chapter books with a total of 389 pages that covers the basic and easy to follow examples; each chapter is broken down to the barest for easy understanding.

To be specific, we will cover topics like:

·        Web & Coding

·        Web Server

·        HTML(Hyper Text Markup Language)

·        CSS(Cascade Style Sheet)

·        JavaScript & PHP

·        Web Development of Front-end & Back-end

·        What is Database & Big Data?

·        Web Design Trends in the Year 2020s​

 

TIMELINE

We need $15,000 for the production of  THE 24-HOUR CODING BOOTCAMP and other expenses. If we meet our campaign goal and raise $15,000, we will be able to completely fund this phase with the match. Most importantly, your contribution brings
you into the Coding N Hosting Community. Becoming a backer means that you not
only yearn for a life for your teens in coding, but this will be a gift that will keep on giving.

All Contributors of $24 and above will get a copy of the book and access to our online hosting platform for 3 months free. 

We are aware of the complexity of book production and delivering it to the backers. Best expertise. The timeline above shows the milestones from the beginning till completion.

There is a myriad of details involved in publishing a book. Your support will help pay for printed proofs/setup costs, hardcover/paperback  production, fulfilment/shipping. All the funds will be going into printing our first run of 2,000 books.

Since the illustrations and formatting all the 389 pages have already been completed, digitized, and ready for print, once the campaign ends, the book can go right into production. This book will be a beautiful hardcover/paperback with high-quality and neat pages.

Our current timeline estimates shipping books to you by Apr/May 2021.

Need something special? Maybe a package of 10 books? Just reach out and I'll be happy to set up a custom perk for you.

Our Book needs pledging but above all, it needs your attention and interest! If you love this book and the approach as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons.

 

All it takes to share is just 2/3 clicks away.

Help us spread the word and get things started!

Story of Samuel Yunse Han

I’m a Dreamer. I have dreamed my whole life. My best achieved dream is when I came to the US. America gave me a lot of good things: education, job, families.

Like most of you, I have fallen and got up many times in my life. But here I am, like all of you. When I had the chance to write a book, two things in my mind : Do I deserve it? Can I write a book? After deep consideration, I decided to do it with one condition. Write as a “book reader” not as an “author.” For doing that, I put a lot of illustration cuts, charts, tables, even funny cartoons instead of boring words and sentences. I did my best to make it simple and concise for your understandings.

I hope buying this book and studying coding is one of the best choices in your life. Likewise, knowing you through this book is the greatest blessing in my life.

Keep dreaming!

 

Story of Penny Esterley

I just love literacy. What exactly is literacy? It is our ability to think, create, share, and grow in that specific area.  I co-created Community Literacy Lab as a way to give my love for literacy back to the community. I wanted to teach and to share the idea that “literacy” is something that is found in all areas of our lives. I hope that as you read this book, it allows you to understand the importance of this thing we call “literacy,” and that it will allow you to love literacy as much as I do! Now, go out there. Think… create… share… and grow your love of literacy!

We appreciate your time and attention. Wishing you peace, happiness, and true success always.

Best Regards.

story:
Short Summary

Born from the need seen by teachers and parents, ScholarWorx is reforming K-12 Education with the use of immersive, virtual reality learning on our newly built ScholarWorx Virtual Campus.

Teacher and mom of five, Desirée Schell watched with dismay as Covid-altered education removed engagement for many students. As a writer and artist and travel leader, Desirée missed delivering instruction using a multi-sensory approach that other chat- or video-based platforms don’t allow. Desirée began to look for a way to harness the current challenges in education, her experience in banking and marketing, and her love for imparting learning to making education better for our kids—and saw a ground-breaking opportunity in creating a safe, virtual, immersive campus for K-12. Desirée has invested her retirement funds into purchasing the ScholarWorx Virtual Campus and outfitting it for educational reform.

Fellow teacher and mom Karen Cangero has partnered with Desirée to bring ScholarWorx Virtual Campus to life. An elementary and math teacher and the author of two books on using the Internet for kids, Karen is ready to tap into the incredible technology in today’s world to make learning and education better for kids. Having taught nearly every grade from K through 12, Karen recognizes the importance of engaging students. Students who do are students who learn.

Contributors, you will be helping Desirée and Karen offer those essential immersive experiences for students on the ScholarWorx Virtual Campus. These 550+ activities are standards-based and curriculum-aligned—spanning learning from early elementary to SAT/ACT Prep and AP. On the ScholarWorx Virtual Campus, students and teachers interact as avatars and will benefit from these immersive experiences in all disciplines. You will help bring learning alive for today’s students as they put their avatar hands on state-of-the-art educational activities! We welcome your support and excitement.

What We Need & What You Get

ScholarWorx needs $10,000 in funding to offer the immersive, virtual activities on our ScholarWorx Virtual Campus:

  • $2,850 for VEATIVE Immersive Technology Solutions for 550 hands-on student adventures (grades 3-12) into Math, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, World History and more!
  • $ 2,700 for Teacher Trainings
  • $1,500 for Student Ocular Viewers
  • $2,700 for Teacher Ocular Headsets

Items are listed in order of importance.

Funding will be by priority if our full funding goal is not met.

The Impact

The struggles of education in the time of Covid have been national and world news. Nearly everyone knows students, parents, teachers—or all of the above—who have felt frustrated and disenfranchised in the last year. Our kids have struggled their way through traditional schooling, online instruction, video conference lessons, and concurrent teaching in the classroom during the pandemic. What do our kids need? Engagement—meaningful lessons that speak to their world and the way they currently learn. We can do better for them by  jumping forward into their world, and stop pulling them back into ours. Education is the cornerstone of our society--and it needs help.

Your contribution is joining our movement for educational reform. ScholarWorx Virtual Campus uses technology to educate, engage, and unite our students—our future. We are breaking ground in melding virtual reality and education. Help us take this first step in creating meaningful reform in education that is sure to spread across our country and the globe. We are bringing the future to reality—virtual reality.

 

Risks & Challenges

Say "virtual reality" to most adults in our world and they will think "game." A virtual reality campus does not spring to mind when pondering or discussing education reform. We need to inform the general public how virtual reality is effective educationally. Appreciably superior learning and retention, combined with engagement and social experience, is more than possible on this sort of platform—and ScholarWorx needs to get that word out. 

To that end, we offer free ScholarWorx Campus tours on Tuesdays at 7pm, Thursdays at 7pm and Saturdays at 9:30am. (All times EDT.) We have been turning tourists to clients at a 29% rate, with the benefit of them having experienced a virtual ScholarWorx Campus tour.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contribution will positively impact many students learning on our virtual campus. If you can't contribute today, we value your share! Like us on Facebook, visit our website at www.scholarworx.com, tell your friends about us. Plus, it's easy to share our Indiegogo campaign. We appreciate every effort!

story:
Summary of the Issue

The Groundwater Project is a non-profit organization based in Canada. Led by Dr. John Cherry, recipient of the 2020 Stockholm Water Award, the Nobel prize for water, and ​managed by a 11-member international Steering Committee and a larger and globally diverse Advisory Committee. The Groundwater Project is committed to contribute to advancement in education by creating and making available online free high-quality groundwater educational material for all.

Books produced in the Groundwater Project are being led by the world’s leading groundwater experts and are ​designed to educate children, the public and professionals​. Most of the Groundwater Project’s books are intended to further train and educate groundwater specialists.
 
Today, more than a billion people lack safe drinking water worldwide. Groundwater makes up 99% of the Earth's liquid freshwater and 2.5 billion people depend solely on groundwater today. Sustainable management of groundwater is at the heart of the solution.

The United Nations (UN) has issued a statement calling for action to ensure that groundwater benefits society now and into the future.

"With a lack of information on groundwater, there is an increasing risk of further negligence and sidelining of the issue. This will have significant repercussions on sustainability, as we all recognize the critical importance and human dependence on groundwater in building resilience to climate change and for water and food security across the globe."
 
The UN highlights the concern of many groundwater scientists, practitioners, and experts regarding the status of global groundwater resources.  “We still do not have sufficient knowledge of the world’s groundwater resources, and more importantly, we do not adequately manage aquifers” (UN, 2020).

What We Need & What You Get

The Groundwater Project will be the source that people throughout the world will rely on for groundwater education and how it relates to other waters and societal needs and issues. It will create synthesized knowledge about all thing’s groundwater for global distribution to raise groundwater consciousness globally.
 
During 2020 and early 2021, twelve original books were published on our website. They are quickly gaining traction worldwide. With a further 200 books currently being written, it is the goal to have them published in the next year and beyond. We invite you to read these incredible books for free at gw-project.org and to help us spread the word by sharing our project with others.

The Impact

In 2021, The Groundwater Project’s goal is to begin the process of expanding the learning from these books into interactive online course modules; we plan to customize this knowledge for different regions of the world (Central America, Africa and the Middle East) and continue translating them into Portuguese, Spanish, Turkish, Arabic, French and Chinese among others.

The materials published by the Groundwater Project will examine all the ways that groundwater resources are being impacted and how these impacts can be monitored, mitigated and improved.

Challenges

Although the Groundwater Project is largely based on volunteerism, funds are essential ​for employed professionals to do project coordination and​ other tasks. The Groundwater Project requires financial support for the following key items:

●  Coordination and liaison, including temporary hiring of undergraduate assistants 
●  Professional services in artistic visual support such as illustrations and videos 
●  Sabbatical support to replace the forgone salary of the best professors so they can produce books now (rather than having to wait for many years until they will retire) 
●  Hiring short-term postdoctoral personnel or graduate students to support research synthesis and organization of information essential to the production of high-quality books 
●  Professional training of volunteers and staff for production of educational self-learning modules in support of the material presented in the books (e.g., set up framework and protocols)
●  Professional assistance for innovation, quality control and educational product enhancements

Please donate to the Groundwater Project and share our message to help us empower global citizens to protect, manage and develop their drinking water supplies for a sustainable future.​

The Groundwater Project requires financial support for the following key items:●  Coordination and liaison, including temporary hiring of undergraduate assistants ●  Professional services in artistic visual support such as illustrations and videos ●  Sabbatical support to replace the forgone salary of the best professors so they can produce books now (rather than having to wait for many years until they will retire) ●  Hiring short-term postdoctoral personnel or graduate students to support research synthesis and organization of information essential to the production of high-quality books ●  Professional training of volunteers and staff for production of educational self-learning modules in support of the material presented in the books (e.g., set up framework and protocols)●  Professional assistance for innovation, quality control and educational product enhancementsPlease donate to the Groundwater Project and share our message to help us empower global citizens to protect, manage and develop their drinking water supplies for a sustainable future.​

story:
Short Summary

My name is Steve Borisenko, I lost my son Jacob to an accidental fentanyl overdose June 11, 2021. It has been the most painful thing any parent can go through and it doesn't need to happen to any of us. Along with my business Partner Rick Corvese we have decided to do all we can to prevent as many of these unnecessary tragedies happening. Covid and the way our governments have handled it has been absolutely disgraceful. Our kids are self medicating with street drugs brought in to our country by Monsters that don't care if they live or Die. We all need to come together and make it STOP!

With your help we are designing a first line of defense against these pieces of human waste. We want to give our kids some protection when this problem comes knocking on their door.

The app will work like this:

-it will use voice recognition to detect a pass phrase set up by the user. When that phase is picked up on by the app. It will immediately reach out to all the safety contacts you have programmed in your phone. It will give GPS Location, rate of speed, and direction so anyone receiving the notification call the police on behalf of your loved one. It will also have a second passcode for the phone that when entered will do the exact same thing.

-the app will have a panic button on it as well for when your loved one is so frightened they cant think properly.

-the app will have an automatic crash detection. If Jacobs wall detects sudden drops in speed and severe impact it will notify 911 and all the contacts in the emergency list for GPS Location.

-It will have very simple easy to use instructions on Naloxone/Narcan. When life or death is on the line we need to make it as easy as possible for someone to make the right decisions.

This app can and will save lives. I may be your son or daughter one day and I want to be able to give them something to help. 

     

    WE NEED HELP

     We need developers, we need ideas, we need funding. We would love to partner up with a company that understands just what kind of hold street drugs are doing to our kids and wants to help save their lives.

    If you aren't a developer but can spare a little money to help, YOU ARE MAKING A DIFFERENCE.

    If you cant spare any money but can share this campaign YOU ARE MAKING A DIFFERENCE.

    In order to beat this thing and save lives it is going to take all of us together to push back hard against these monsters. These drugs don't care if you are black or white, gay or straight, they don't care about politics and they don't care about gender. These drugs will kill your children, trust me I know. Don't ever think, not my kid, 1 bad pill, 1 bad night, 1 bad decision and they are gone forever. Lets at least give them a chance, and we need to do it together!

    FUNDING 

    App development is going to run in the 50-75,000$ range. Every penny that is donated is being handled by our registered Non-Profit JACOBS-WALL. All money will be used for the protection of our children. We have no hidden agenda. I don't want any other parents to go through the pain and anguish that I am right now and we need to all pull together to make sure it isn't you. It is too late for Jacob my son, but if we can make a difference and save some lives then his life will have purpose and we all want our kids lives to have purpose. PLEASE GIVE, PLEASE SHARE, 

     

    I cant force anyone to join us. I cant make you donate or share you make those choices and I hope you will. All I want you to do after reading this is hug your kids a little harder tonight, when they talk to you, be there and listening 100%. Make sure every time they leave your sight they know you LOVE them. Life gets us to busy and if tragedy hits be able to say, they KNEW I loved them. Don't let there be any questions.

    JACOBS-WALL.com

     

    Please Help with whatever you can. Our kids lives are depending on it.

story:
Give teens the voice, skills and confidence to change the world they will inherit!

Today’s teens will be inheriting a number of major societal issues, including: racism, gender inequality, poverty, bullying, higher education costs, and food insecurity.  In addition to these global issues, students are facing problems that are germane to their own schools and communities.  We cannot expect the next generation to address societal issues if they are exposed to the same hyper-partisanship and divisiveness that plague our current society.  And when the traditional educational system is hampered by inequitable funding, overworked staff, extracurricular program cuts, a focus on standardized testing (and not to mention the practical limitations by COVID-19), students struggle to gain the resources, tools and skills that will allow them to engage in the process of making their world a better place. 

How do we change course from entrenched partisanship to a culture of cooperation and empathy to create a positive, highly functional future society?  A mediator and political scientist think they have the solution.  Motivated by their shared passion for creating a positive change in the world and empowering others to rise as leaders, Matthew DeSantis and Kelly Nagle founded Teen Think Tank Project to provide the next generation of leaders, change makers, and advocates with the academic, emotional, and practical skills needed to not only understand today’s societal issues, but correct them.  We're asking for your support to further our vision of giving a future generation of change agents a voice in the world they will inherit. 

Who We Are

Teen Think Tank Project is a student-run policy institute that fosters critical thinking, research techniques, and problem-solving skills to develop policy frameworks for real-life issues and empowers students to become future changemakers.

Our program enrolls students using merit-based, competitive criteria.  Students are provided with leadership training to help them develop effective communication and critical thinking skills.  We give them access to the resource materials that are needed to effectively research, develop, and present a public policy framework that will serve to not only provide a suggested blueprint for possible change, but also inspire experts and thought leaders to reimagine how they can utilize perspectives of the next generation of changemakers to play a role in solving today’s problems.  

The Founders

How We Work

We enroll high achieving high school students, team them with a research coordinator, call them all “colleagues”  and treat them like professionals.  We give them access to thought leaders, advocates, activists, and industry experts to learn about social justice issues that are currently plaguing society,  examining the progress (or lack therefore) that these individuals have made in attempting to correct these societal issues, and walk students through social policy research, formation, and publication.

By fostering a learning environment that focuses on inclusion and diversity, our students are able to tackle societal issues in a safe environment.   We offer twelve weeks of learning modules through a virtual, in-person or hybrid learning environment that guide students through a social justice education curriculum that promotes equity, empathy and diversity, while enabling them to develop actual policy frameworks aimed at solving problems that affect their communities.   Students are provided with the curriculum, materials, instructors, and experts necessary to develop more effective communication, leadership, and problem solving skills. 

The Impact

Besides looking to how they can make an impact on society, our students are also looking towards their next steps into college.  Teen Think Tank Project's rigorous and innovative curriculum helps students stand out from their peers in their ability to lead, think critically and work in diverse environments.  These are qualities universities are seeking in applicants.

  • "Leadership is one of the best, and most impactful, ways to show character and exceptional extra curricular involvement, especially for Top 50 schools." (https://www.huffpost.com/entry/leadership-what-...) 
  • "Colleges look for qualities like leadership and a sense of social responsibility." (https://bigfuture.collegeboard.org/get-in/apply...r)
  • "Colleges want students who appreciate cultural diversity and are eager to engage with and learn from people from a wide range of cultural backgrounds." (https://www.collegedata.com/resources/getting-i...)

 

How You Can Make an Impact

We're raising money to execute research cohorts through April 2022 and continue to grow the Teen Think Tank Project .  This encompasses summer and fall 2021 sessions and winter 2022 cohorts, as well as additional social justice education programming.  

Any contribution is appreciated and supports our social justice education initiatives and equips our students to become the future change makers we need!

 

Risks & Challenges

One of our values is creating a safe and diverse learning environment.  As we continue to grow our program and spread the word, we are mindful of being as inclusive and diverse as possible.  We are working to build relationships with school districts (public, private and charter) to ensure diversity of background, perspectives, race, socio-economic status, etc.  We realize that there are many exceptional and socially conscious teens who would excel in our program but lack the financial means to do so.  As such, we are dedicated to providing funding and scholarships to all accepted students.  Your contributions help us to do this.  

Building and marketing a business is no easy task.  With the combined business and fundraising backgrounds of the founders we are building a realistic and sustainable business model.  Additionally, initial support from industry leaders, activists, advocates and established business leaders has been overwhelming.  These amazing individuals have contributed their time and talents to our research cohort and our podcast, Here's the Problem.   

Other Ways You Can Help

You may love our mission but aren't able contribute, at the moment.  That doesn't mean they can't help.  Follow us on social media @teen_thinktank and join our mailing list on our website to stay up to date.  Spread the word about our program and mission to your network.  You never know who may be able to contribute or who would be interested in enrolling!  Use Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Terms of Service; Didn't Read

"I have read and agree to the Terms" is the biggest lie on The Web. We aim to fix that.
  1. Terms of Service; Didn't Read
  2. Who Are We?
  3. What We Do
    • Our Text Crawler
    • Our Database
  4. Accomplishments
  5. Our Objectives
    • To Improve
    • Hosting Our Platform
    • To Expand
  6. Contact Us
    • Forum
    • Email
    • For Developers
    • Discord
    • Matrix/Element
    • Reddit
  7. Extra

 

 

Who Are We?

We are a user-rights initiative, focused on your Privacy Online, and on your Legal and Economic Rights.

Terms of Service; Didn't Read ("ToS;DR", derived from the acronym "TL;DR") is a non-for-profit project centered on reviewing, summarizing and communicating the legal documents — such as Terms of Service, Privacy Policies, EULA's, etc. — from various services/websites across the web. None of us actually reads those walls of text — thus, "I have read and agree to the Terms" is the biggest lie on the web!

The project is fueled through donations, and maintained by a community of awesome volunteers from all around the world, both through our Forum, and our Subreddit.

 

 

What Do We Do?

ToS;DR aims at creating a transparent and peer-reviewed process to rate and analyse Terms of Service and Privacy Policies in order to create a rating from Grade A to Grade E.

To review a service, we have this procedure to follow:

  1. We add the desired service to our database: Phoenix.
  2. We crawl the documents (ToS, Privacy Policy...) on the newly added service.
  3. A reviewer will highlight the interesting points from a service's document, which will give it a certain amount of points. More Info
  4. When the service is completely reviewed, its rating is published automatically both on our website and our Browser Extensions.

Our Database

We have our own database, called Phoenix. There is where all the magic happens! We crawl documents from other services,

Facebook's legal documents — screenshot taken on 01/11/2021.
 

then, we review specific phrases, which in turn will become Points.

View Point

finally, once the service is sufficiently reviewed, we will post the grade on tosdr.org, which will also be reflected on our Browser Extensions.

 

 

Our Accomplishments

We have reviewed hundreds of services, including Facebook, Google, Reddit, Twitter, and more on Phoenix!
We are also proud of our recent layout redesign on our main page, developed by Justin Back. We have also made translations for the frontpage, which is now available in six languages!

 

We have also been integrated in the DuckDuckGo Privacy Essentials browser extension, which displays a more privacy-focused rating!

We have also made a lot of improvements on all of our platform, making it increasingly more accesible and user-friendly! We have made easy and automated processes on our Forum, to attend to people's requests and inquiries in a much more accessible manner.

 

Our Objectives

We've come so far since 2012, and we want to keep the project alive! For this, we want to communicate with you what we plan to do with your help:

Improve our websites and communities

We want to keep working on the code for our websites. We want to keep improving to deliver the best experience both for our users, and everyone else!

We have the following projects for improvement:

  • An automated document annotator/reviewer (A.K.A. Docbot) — (Currently under development, viewable on our Discord Server, add documentation).
  • Community and PR improvements (Such as new designs, video material, documentation, and more!) — (Currently under planning.)
  • Community translations. — (Currently under development, we have 6 languages on our frontpage by now!)
  • A new Markdown Crawler. — (Implemented, but will need further corrections and improvements.)

Server and Social Media Hosting

We need your help to keep hosting our servers, or — even better — to improve them in the future!

Also, we want to keep our Social Media profiles moderated and in order, with more updates and communications with our users.

We host servers for our Forum, our frontpage, Phoenix, our Discord Server, and more!

Expand Our Community, and our Team

We want to grow our community by allowing us to give back to them in a more regular and bigger manner. This shall include our current perks for this campaign, and more rewards in the future!

We also plan to expand our list of working team members in the future, including more developers behind the scenes, and more moderators and volunteers for our platform.

 

We have a public and transparent list of payments and transactions for everyone to review, and to promote trust between the Project and the Backers!

 

 

Contact Us

The project is managed by the ToS;DR Team, with members from all around the world.

If you wish to contact us for inquiries, doubts or suggestions, we have many ways for you to do so!

You can reach us through:

  • Our Forum, hosted by Discourse — Visit Us
  • Email, including:
     
    • team@tosdr.org — The Team.
    • michiel@unhosted.org — Michiel de Jong.
    • justin@tosdr.org — Justin Back.
    • evan@tosdr.org — Evan Mullen.
    • g.maxc.fox@protonmail.com — Guennadi Maximov.
    • phoenix-core@tosdr.org — Phoenix Developers.
  • Are you a developer? Our platforms are open-source and free software, including:
    • Our Frontpage, Crisp — View Source Code
    • Our Database, Phoenix — View Source Code
    • Our Crawler, tosback-crawler — View Source Code
    • Our API, developed by The Team — More Information
  • Chat with us on Discord — Our Discord Server
  • Check our Community on Element — Our Matrix Community
  • Check our Subreddit — Our Subreddit

 

 

 

Extra

If you have any other doubt, make sure you check our FAQ Section below!

We are very thankful for your contributions. Whatever you may contribute to us, we'll appreciate it!

- The ToS;DR Team.

Our Forum, hosted by Discourse — Visit Us 

Email, including:  
team@tosdr.org — The Team. 
michiel@unhosted.org — Michiel de Jong. 
justin@tosdr.org — Justin Back. 
evan@tosdr.org — Evan Mullen. 
g.maxc.fox@protonmail.com — Guennadi Maximov.
